items.arabic: ليس هناك شهر من الشهور أعظم من شهر رمضان المبارك، فقد اصطفاه اللَّه لأعظم هديّة للمجتمع البشريّ، أي القرآن الكريم. من جانب آخر في هذا الشهر ليلة القدر التي تتقدّر فيها مقدّرات البشرية لسنة- حسب استحقاقهم واستعدادهم- والعبادة فيها خير من عبادة ألف شهر.
items.english: No month among the months is greater than the blessed month of Ramadan, for Allah has chosen it for the greatest gift to human society, which is the Noble Quran. Furthermore, in this month is the Night of Power, in which the destinies of humanity for the year are ordained—according to their merit and preparedness—and worship therein is better than the worship of a thousand months.
items.transliteration: Laysa hunaka shahrun min al-shuhuri a'zamu min shahri Ramadan al-mubarak, faqad istafahu Allahu li-a'zami hadiyyatin lil-mujtama' al-bashari, ay al-Qur'an al-Karim. Min janibin akhar fi hadha al-shahri Laylat al-Qadr allati tataqaddaru fiha muqaddarat al-bashariyah li-sanatin -hasaba istihqaqihim was-ti'dadihim- wal-'ibadatu fiha khayrun min 'ibadati alfi shahr.

items.arabic: إلى جانب كونه ربيع العبادة وشهر التهذيب والتربية والتعليم والطهر والعفاف والورع والتقوى؛ الشهر الذي يطوي بخطوات سريعة وواثقة مراحل السير والسلوك إلى اللَّه.
items.english: Alongside being the spring of worship and the month of self-refinement, upbringing, education, purity, chastity, piety, and God-consciousness; it is the month in which the stages of the spiritual journey toward Allah are traversed with swift and confident steps.
items.transliteration: Ila janibi kawnih rabi' al-'ibadah wa shahr al-tahdhib wal-tarbiyah wal-ta'lim wal-tuhr wal-'afaf wal-wara' wal-taqwa; al-shahr al-ladhi yatwi bi-khutuwat sari'atin wa wathiqatin marahila al-sayr wal-suluk ila Allah.

items.arabic: وكفى في فضل هذا الشهر أنّ النّبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله قال في خطبته على أعتاب رمضان:
items.english: It is sufficient for the merit of this month that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his progeny) said in his sermon on the threshold of Ramadan:
items.transliteration: Wa kafa fi fadli hadha al-shahr anna al-Nabi sallallahu alayhi wa alih qala fi khutbatihi 'ala a'tabi Ramadan:

items.arabic: ليس هناك شهر من الشهور أعظم من شهر رمضان المبارك، فقد اصطفاه اللَّه لأعظم هديّة للمجتمع البشريّ، أي القرآن الكريم. من جانب آخر في هذا الشهر ليلة القدر التي تتقدّر فيها مقدّرات البشرية لسنة- حسب استحقاقهم واستعدادهم- والعبادة فيها خير من عبادة ألف شهر.

Furthermore, in this month is the Night of Power, in which the destinies of humanity for the year are ordained—according to their merit and readiness—and worship therein is better than the worship of a thousand months.
items.transliteration: Laysa hunaka shahrun min al-shuhuri a'zamu min shahri Ramadan al-mubarak, faqad istafahu Allahu li-a'zami hadiyyatin lil-mujtama' al-bashari, ay al-Qur'an al-Karim. Min janibin akhar fi hadha al-shahr Laylat al-Qadr al-lati tutaqaddaru fiha muqaddarat al-bashariyah li-sanatin- hasba istihqaqihim was-ti'dadihim- wal-'ibadatu fiha khayrun min 'ibadati alfi shahr.

items.arabic: إلى جانب كونه ربيع العبادة وشهر التهذيب والتربية والتعليم والطهر والعفاف والورع والتقوى؛ الشهر الذي يطوي بخطوات سريعة وواثقة مراحل السير والسلوك إلى اللَّه.
items.english: Alongside being the spring of worship and the month of self-refinement, upbringing, education, purity, chastity, piety, and God-consciousness; it is the month in which the stages of the spiritual journey toward Allah are traversed with swift and confident steps.
items.transliteration: Ila janibi kawnih rabi' al-'ibadah wa shahr al-tahdhib wal-tarbiyah wal-ta'lim wal-tuhr wal-'afaf wal-wara' wal-taqwa; al-shahr al-ladhi yatwi bi-khutuwat sari'atin wa wathiqatin marahila al-sayr wal-suluk ila Allah.

items.arabic: وكفى في فضل هذا الشهر أنّ النّبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله قال في خطبته على أعتاب رمضان:
items.english: It is sufficient for the merit of this month that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him and his progeny) said in his sermon on the threshold of Ramadan:
items.transliteration: Wa kafa fi fadli hadha al-shahr anna al-Nabi sallallahu alayhi wa alih qala fi khutbatihi 'ala a'tabi Ramadan:

items.arabic: «أيّها الناسُ إنّه قَد أقبلَ إليكُم شهرُ اللَّهِ بِالبركةِ والرّحمةِ والمَغفرةِ شَهرٌ هُو عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيرُ الشُّهورِ وأيّامُهُ أفضلُ الأيّام وَلياليهِ أفضَلُ الليالي وَساعاتُهُ أفضلُ السَّاعاتِ. شَهرٌ دُعِيتُم فِيهِ إلى ضِيافةِ اللَّهِ وَجُعِلتُم فِيهِ مِنْ أهلِ كِرامةِ اللَّهِ أنفاسُكُمْ فِيهِ تَسبيحٌ ونَومُكُم فِيهِ عِبادَةٌ وعَمَلُكُم فِيهِ مَقبُولٌ وَدعاؤُكُم فِيهِ مستَجابٌ فَسَلُوا اللَّهَ رَبَّكُم بِنيّاتٍ صَادقةٍ وَقُلوبٍ طَاهرةٍ أن يُوفَّقَكُم لِصِيامِهِ وَتلاوةِ كِتابِهِ، فَالشَّقِيُّ مَنْ حُرِم غُفرانَ اللَّهِ فِي هذا الشّهرِ ...
items.english: “O people! Indeed, the month of Allah has approached you with blessing, mercy, and forgiveness. It is a month which is, in the sight of Allah, the best of months; its days are the best of days, its nights are the best of nights, and its hours are the best of hours. It is a month in which you have been invited to the banquet of Allah and have been made among the people of Allah’s honor. Your breaths in it are tasbih, your sleep in it is worship, your deeds in it are accepted, and your supplications in it are answered. So ask Allah, your Lord, with sincere intentions and pure hearts, to grant you the success to fast during it and to recite His Book. For wretched is the one who is deprived of Allah’s forgiveness in this month...”
items.transliteration: Ayyuhan-nasu innahu qad aqbala ilaykum shahru Allahi bil-barakati wal-rahmati wal-maghfirah. Shahrun huwa 'inda Allahi khayru al-shuhuri wa ayyamuhu afdalu al-ayyam, wa layalihu afdalu al-layali, wa sa'atuhu afdalu al-sa'at. Shahrun du'itum fihi ila diyafati Allahi wa ju'iltum fihi min ahli karamati Allah. Anfasukum fihi tasbihun wa nawmukum fihi 'ibadatun wa 'amalukum fihi maqbulun wa du'aukum fihi mustajab. Fas'alu Allaha rabbakum bi-niyyatin sadiqatin wa qulubin tahiratin an yuwaffiqakum li-siyamihi wa tilawati kitabihi, fal-shaqiyyu man hurima ghufrana Allahi fi hadha al-shahr...

items.arabic: ». ثمّ أكّد على التصدّق واحتِرام الكبير والعطف على الصغير وصِلَة الرَّحِم وحِفظ اللّسان والعين والأُذُن من الذّنب والتّوبة من المعصية والدعاء- خاصّة عند الصلاة- ثمّ أكّد على إفطار الصائمين ولو بشقّ تمرَةٍ أو شربة ماء لمن لم يستطع، ثمّ قال في آخر الخطبة:
items.english: ”. He then emphasized giving charity, respecting the elderly, showing compassion to the young, maintaining ties of kinship, and guarding the tongue, eyes, and ears from sin, as well as repenting for disobedience and offering supplications—especially at the time of prayer. He then stressed providing iftar for those fasting, even if with half a date or a drink of water for those who are unable [to do more]. Then he said at the end of the sermon:
items.transliteration: ». Thumma akkada 'ala al-tasadduq wa ihtiram al-kabir wal-'atf 'ala al-saghir wa silat al-rahim wa hifz al-lisan wal-'ayn wal-udhun min al-dhanb wal-tawbah min al-ma'siyah wal-du'a' - khassatan 'inda al-salati - thumma akkada 'ala iftar al-sa'imin wa law bi-shiqqi tamratin aw shurbati ma'in liman lam yastati', thumma qala fi akhir al-khutbah:

items.arabic: «أيُّهَا النّاسُ إنَّ أبوابَ الجِنانِ في هذا الشَّهْرِ مُفَتَّحةٌ فَسَلُوا رَبَّكُم أن لا يُغْلِقَها عَلَيكُم وأبْوابَ النِّيرانِ مُغَلَّقَةٌ فَسَلُوا رَبَّكُم أنْ لا يَفْتَحَها عَلَيْكُم والشَّياطِينَ مَغْلُولَةٌ فَسَلُوا رَبَّكُم أن لا يُسَلِّطَها عَلَيكُم.
items.english: “O people! Indeed, the gates of Paradise are opened in this month; so ask your Lord that He may not close them against you. The gates of the Fire are closed; so ask your Lord that He may not open them against you. And the devils are shackled; so ask your Lord that He may not give them power over you.”
items.transliteration: «Ayyuhan-nasu inna abwaba al-jinani fi hadha al-shahri mufattahatun, fas'alu Rabbakum an la yughliqaha 'alaykum, wa abwaba al-nirani mughallaqatun, fas'alu Rabbakum an la yaftahaha 'alaykum, wal-shayatina maghlulatun, fas'alu Rabbakum an la yusallitaha 'alaykum.»

items.arabic: فقال عليٌّ عليه السلام: يا رَسولَ اللَّهِ ما أفْضَلُ الأعْمالِ في هذا الشَّهْرِ؟ قال صلى الله عليه و آله: الكَفُّ عن الذُّنُوبِ» .
items.english: Then Ali (peace be upon him) said: “O Messenger of Allah, what is the best of deeds in this month?” He (peace and blessings be upon him and his progeny) said: “Abstaining from sins.”
items.transliteration: Faqala 'Aliyyun alayhis-salam: Ya Rasul Allah ma afdalu al-a'mali fi hadha al-shahr? Qala sallallahu alayhi wa alih: Al-kaffu 'an al-dhunub.

footnote_refs.title: أمالي الصدوق: ص 93، ح 4؛ بحار الأنوار: ج 93، ص 356.

items.arabic: فالسعيد من عرف قدر هذا الشهر وانتفع ببركته وتغلب على مشاكله المعنوية والمادية ببركة عباداته وصومه في هذا الشهر.
items.english: So, the fortunate one is he who recognizes the worth of this month, benefits from its blessings, and overcomes his spiritual and material problems through the blessings of his acts of worship and fasting in this month.
items.transliteration: Fal-sa'idu man 'arafa qadra hadha al-shahr wa-ntafa'a bi-barakatihi wa-taghallaba 'ala mashakilihi al-ma'nawiyah wal-madiyah bi-barakati 'ibadatihi wa-sawmihi fi hadha al-shahr.

items.arabic: طبعاً لا ينبغي الاكتفاء بالصوم لتحصيل البركات الماديّة والمعنويّة وثواب شهر رمضان المبارك، بل لابدّ من الابتعاد عن المعاصي والعمل على تهذيب النفس ومراقبتها وحملها إلى النفحات الرحمانيّة.
items.english: Of course, one should not settle for fasting alone to attain the material and spiritual blessings and the reward of the blessed month of Ramadan; rather, it is essential to distance oneself from sins and work toward self-refinement and self-vigilance, guiding the soul toward the divine fragrances of mercy.
items.transliteration: Tab'an la yanbaghi al-iktifa'u bil-sawmi li-tahsili al-barakati al-maddiyati wal-ma'nawiyati wa thawabi shahri Ramadan al-mubarak, bal la budda min al-ibti'adi 'an al-ma'asi wal-'amali 'ala tahdhibi al-nafsi wa muraqabatiha wa hamliha ila al-nafahati al-rahmaniyah.

items.arabic: إلهي وفِّقنا جميعاً وأفِض علينا وابِل رحمتِك.
items.english: O my God, grant us all success and shower us with the abundance of Your mercy.
items.transliteration: Ilahi waffiqna jami'an wa-afid 'alayna wabila rahmatik.

items.arabic: «أيّها الناسُ إنّه قَد أقبلَ إليكُم شهرُ اللَّهِ بِالبركةِ والرّحمةِ والمَغفرةِ شَهرٌ هُو عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيرُ الشُّهورِ وأيّامُهُ أفضلُ الأيّام وَلياليهِ أفضَلُ الليالي وَساعاتُهُ أفضلُ السَّاعاتِ. شَهرٌ دُعِيتُم فِيهِ إلى ضِيافةِ اللَّهِ وَجُعِلتُم فِيهِ مِنْ أهلِ كِرامةِ اللَّهِ أنفاسُكُمْ فِيهِ تَسبيحٌ ونَومُكُم فِيهِ عِبادَةٌ وعَمَلُكُم فِيهِ مَقبُولٌ وَدعاؤُكُم فِيهِ مستَجابٌ فَسَلُوا اللَّهَ رَبَّكُم بِنيّاتٍ صَادقةٍ وَقُلوبٍ طَاهرةٍ أن يُوفَّقَكُم لِصِيامِهِ وَتلاوةِ كِتابِهِ، فَالشَّقِيُّ مَنْ حُرِم غُفرانَ اللَّهِ فِي هذا الشّهرِ ...
items.english: “O people! Indeed, the month of Allah has approached you with blessing, mercy, and forgiveness. It is a month which is, in the sight of Allah, the best of months; its days are the best of days, its nights are the best of nights, and its hours are the best of hours. It is a month in which you have been invited to the banquet of Allah and have been made among those who enjoy the honor of Allah. Your breaths in it are glorification (tasbih), your sleep in it is worship, your deeds in it are accepted, and your supplications in it are answered. So ask Allah, your Lord, with sincere intentions and pure hearts, to grant you success in fasting during it and reciting His Book; for the wretched one is he who is deprived of Allah’s forgiveness in this month...”
items.transliteration: «Ayyuhan-nasu innahu qad aqbala ilaykum shahru Allahi bil-barakati wal-rahmati wal-maghfirah. Shahrun huwa 'inda Allahi khayru al-shuhuri wa ayyamuhu afdalu al-ayyam, wa layalihu afdalu al-layali, wa sa'atuhu afdalu al-sa'at. Shahrun du'itum fihi ila diyafati Allahi wa ju'iltum fihi min ahli karamati Allahi, anfasukum fihi tasbihun wa nawmukum fihi 'ibadatun wa 'amalukum fihi maqbulun wa du'aukum fihi mustajab. Fasalu Allaha Rabbakum bi-niyyatin sadiqatin wa qulubin tahiratin an yuwaffiqakum li-siyamihi wa tilawati Kitabihi, fal-shaqiyyu man hurima ghufrana Allahi fi hadha al-shahr...

items.arabic: ». ثمّ أكّد على التصدّق واحتِرام الكبير والعطف على الصغير وصِلَة الرَّحِم وحِفظ اللّسان والعين والأُذُن من الذّنب والتّوبة من المعصية والدعاء- خاصّة عند الصلاة- ثمّ أكّد على إفطار الصائمين ولو بشقّ تمرَةٍ أو شربة ماء لمن لم يستطع، ثمّ قال في آخر الخطبة:
items.english: ”. He then emphasized giving charity, respecting the elderly, showing compassion to the young, maintaining ties of kinship, and guarding the tongue, eyes, and ears from sin, as well as repenting for disobedience and offering supplications—especially at the time of prayer. He then stressed providing iftar for those fasting, even with half a date or a drink of water for those who cannot do more, then he said at the end of the sermon:
items.transliteration: ». Thumma akkada 'ala al-tasadduq wa ihtiram al-kabir wal-'atf 'ala al-saghir wa silat al-rahim wa hifz al-lisan wal-'ayn wal-udhun min al-dhanb wal-tawbah min al-ma'siyah wal-du'a' - khassatan 'inda al-salat - thumma akkada 'ala iftar al-sa'imin wa-law bi-shiqqi tamratin aw sharbati ma'in liman lam yastati', thumma qala fi akhir al-khutbah:

items.arabic: «أيُّهَا النّاسُ إنَّ أبوابَ الجِنانِ في هذا الشَّهْرِ مُفَتَّحةٌ فَسَلُوا رَبَّكُم أن لا يُغْلِقَها عَلَيكُم وأبْوابَ النِّيرانِ مُغَلَّقَةٌ فَسَلُوا رَبَّكُم أنْ لا يَفْتَحَها عَلَيْكُم والشَّياطِينَ مَغْلُولَةٌ فَسَلُوا رَبَّكُم أن لا يُسَلِّطَها عَلَيكُم.
items.english: “O people! Indeed, the gates of Paradise are opened in this month; so ask your Lord that He may not close them against you. The gates of the Fire are closed; so ask your Lord that He may not open them against you. And the devils are shackled; so ask your Lord that He may not give them power over you.”
items.transliteration: «Ayyuhan-nasu inna abwaba al-jinani fi hadha al-shahri mufattahatun, fas'alu Rabbakum an la yughliqaha 'alaykum, wa abwaba al-nirani mughallaqatun, fas'alu Rabbakum an la yaftahaha 'alaykum, wal-shayatina maghlulatun, fas'alu Rabbakum an la yusallitaha 'alaykum.

items.arabic: فقال عليٌّ عليه السلام: يا رَسولَ اللَّهِ ما أفْضَلُ الأعْمالِ في هذا الشَّهْرِ؟ قال صلى الله عليه و آله: الكَفُّ عن الذُّنُوبِ» .
items.english: Then Ali (peace be upon him) said: “O Messenger of Allah, what is the best of deeds in this month?” He (peace and blessings be upon him and his progeny) said: “Abstaining from sins.”
items.transliteration: Faqala 'Aliyyun alayhis-salam: Ya Rasul Allah ma afdalu al-a'mali fi hadha al-shahr? Qala sallallahu alayhi wa alih: Al-kaffu 'an al-dhunub.

footnote_refs.title: أمالي الصدوق: ص 93، ح 4؛ بحار الأنوار: ج 93، ص 356.

items.arabic: فالسعيد من عرف قدر هذا الشهر وانتفع ببركته وتغلب على مشاكله المعنوية والمادية ببركة عباداته وصومه في هذا الشهر.
items.english: So, the fortunate one is he who recognizes the worth of this month, benefits from its blessings, and overcomes his spiritual and material problems through the blessings of his acts of worship and fasting in this month.
items.transliteration: Fal-sa'idu man 'arafa qadra hadha al-shahr wa-ntafa'a bi-barakatihi wa-taghallaba 'ala mashakilihi al-ma'nawiyah wal-madiyah bi-barakati 'ibadatihi wa-sawmihi fi hadha al-shahr.

items.arabic: طبعاً لا ينبغي الاكتفاء بالصوم لتحصيل البركات الماديّة والمعنويّة وثواب شهر رمضان المبارك، بل لابدّ من الابتعاد عن المعاصي والعمل على تهذيب النفس ومراقبتها وحملها إلى النفحات الرحمانيّة.
items.english: Of course, one should not settle for fasting alone to attain the material and spiritual blessings and the reward of the blessed month of Ramadan; rather, it is essential to distance oneself from sins and work toward self-refinement and self-vigilance, guiding the soul toward the divine fragrances of the All-Merciful.
items.transliteration: Tab'an la yanbaghi al-iktifa'u bil-sawmi li-tahsili al-barakati al-maddiyati wal-ma'nawiyati wa thawabi shahri Ramadan al-mubarak, bal la budda min al-ibti'adi 'an al-ma'asi wal-'amali 'ala tahdhibi al-nafsi wa muraqabatiha wa hamliha ila al-nafahati al-rahmaniyah.

items.arabic: إلهي وفِّقنا جميعاً وأفِض علينا وابِل رحمتِك.
items.english: O my God, grant us all success and shower us with the abundance of Your mercy.
items.transliteration: Ilahi waffiqna jami'an wa-afid 'alayna wabila rahmatik.

items.english: The common acts for every day and night:
items.transliteration: Al-a'mal al-mushtarakah li-kulli yawmin wa-laylatin:

items.arabic: الأعمال المشتركة لكل يوم وليلة لشهر رمضان كثيرة جدّاً منها:
items.english: The common acts for every day and night of the month of Ramadan are very many, including:
items.transliteration: Al-a'mal al-mushtarakah li-kulli yawmin wa-laylatin li-shahri Ramadan kathiratun jiddan minha:

items.arabic: 1. روى السيّد ابن طاووس عن الإمامين الصادق والكاظم عليهما السلام قالا: «
items.english: 1. Sayyid Ibn Tawus narrated from the two Imams, al-Sadiq and al-Kadhim (peace be upon them), who said: “
items.transliteration: 1. Rawa al-Sayyid Ibn Tawus 'an al-Imamayni al-Sadiq wal-Kazim 'alayhima al-salam qala: «

items.arabic: تقول في شهر رمضان من أوّله إلى آخره بعد كلّ فريضة
items.english: You say throughout the month of Ramadan, from its beginning to its end, after every obligatory prayer:
items.transliteration: Taqulu fi shahri Ramadan min awwalihi ila akhirihi ba'da kulli faridah.

items.arabic: »: اللهُمَّ ارْزُقْنى حَجَّ بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ، فى عامى هذا وَفى كُلِّ عامٍ، ما ابْقَيْتَنى فى يُسْرٍ مِنْكَ وَعافِيَةٍ وَسَعَةِ رِزْقٍ، وَلا تُخْلِنى مِنْ تِلْكَ الْمواقِفِ الْكَريمَةِ، وَالْمَشاهِدِ الشَّريفَةِ، وَزِيارَةِ قَبْرِ نَبِيِّكَ صَلَواتُكَ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، وَفى جَميعِ حَوائِجِ الدُّنْيا وَالأخِرَةِ فَكُنْ لى اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ فيما تَقْضى وَتُقَدِّرُ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ الْمَحْتُومِ فى لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ، مِنَ الْقَضآءِ الَّذى لا يُرَدُّ وَلا يُبَدَّلُ، انْ تَكْتُبَنى مِنْ حُجَّاجِ بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ، الْمَبْرُورِ حَجُّهُمْ، الْمَشْكُورِ سَعْيُهُمْ، الْمَغْفُورِ ذُنُوبُهُمْ، الْمُكَفَّرِ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئاتُهُمْ، وَاجْعَلْ فيما تَقْضى وَتُقَدِّرُ انْ تُطيلَ عُمْرى وَتُوَسِّعَ عَلَىَّ رِزْقى وَتُؤدِّىَ عَنّى امانَتى وَدَيْنى آمينَ رَبَّ الْعالَمينَ.
items.english: “O Allah, grant me the Hajj to Your Sacred House, in this year of mine and in every year, as long as You keep me alive, in ease from You, well-being, and abundance of provision. Do not deprive me of those noble stations and honorable sites, nor of visiting the grave of Your Prophet—Your blessings be upon him and his progeny. In all the needs of this world and the Hereafter, be there for me. O Allah, I ask You that within what You decree and ordain of the inevitable matter on Laylat al-Qadr—of the decree that is neither overturned nor changed—that You enroll me among the pilgrims of Your Sacred House, whose Hajj is accepted, whose efforts are appreciated, whose sins are forgiven, and whose evil deeds are expiated. And include in what You decree and ordain that You prolong my life, expand my provision, and fulfill my trusts and my debts. Amen, O Lord of the worlds.”
items.transliteration: »: Allahumma-rzuqni hajja baytika al-harami, fi 'ami hadha wa fi kulli 'amin, ma abqaytani fi yusrin minka wa 'afiyatin wa sa'ati rizqin, wa la tukhlini min tilka al-mawaqifi al-karimati, wal-mashahidi al-sharifati, wa ziyarati qabri nabiyyika salawatuka 'alayhi wa alihi, wa fi jami'i hawa'iji al-dunya wal-akhirati fakun li. Allahumma inni as'aluka fima taqdi wa tuqaddiru min al-amri al-mahtumi fi laylati al-qadri, min al-qada'i al-ladhi la yuraddu wa la yubaddalu, an taktubani min hujjaji baytika al-harami, al-mabruri hajjuhum, al-mashkuri sa'yuhum, al-maghfuri dhunubuhum, al-mukaffari 'anhum sayyi'atuhum, waj'al fima taqdi wa tuqaddiru an tutila 'umri wa tuwassi'a 'alayya rizqi wa tu'addiya 'anni amanati wa dayni, Amina Rabba al-'alamin.

items.arabic: وتدعو عقيب كلّ فريضة فتقول:
items.english: And you offer supplication after every obligatory prayer, saying:
items.transliteration: Wa-tad'u 'aqiba kulli faridah fataqulu:

items.arabic: يا عَلِىُّ يا عَظيمُ، يا غَفُورُ يا رَحيمُ، انْتَ الرَّبُّ الْعَظيمُ، الَّذى لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَىْ ءٌ، وَهُوَ السَّميعُ الْبَصيرُ، وَهذا شَهْرٌ عَظَّمْتَهُ وَكَرَّمْتَهُ، وَشَرَّفْتَهُ وَفَضَّلْتَهُ عَلَى الشُّهُورِ،
items.english: O Most High, O Magnificent! O All-Forgiving, O All-Merciful! You are the Magnificent Lord, the One whom there is nothing like, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. And this is the month which You have magnified and honored, and ennobled and favored above all other months,
items.transliteration: Ya 'Aliyyu ya 'Azimu, ya Ghafuru ya Rahimu, Anta al-Rabbu al-'Azimu, al-ladhi laysa ka-mithlihi shay'un, wa huwa al-Sami'u al-Basiru, wa hadha shahrun 'azzamtahu wa karramtahu, wa sharraftahu wa faddaltahu 'ala al-shuhuri,

items.english: And you offer supplication after every obligatory prayer, saying:
items.transliteration: Wa-tad'u 'aqiba kulli faridah fataqulu:

items.arabic: يا عَلِىُّ يا عَظيمُ، يا غَفُورُ يا رَحيمُ، انْتَ الرَّبُّ الْعَظيمُ، الَّذى لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَىْ ءٌ، وَهُوَ السَّميعُ الْبَصيرُ، وَهذا شَهْرٌ عَظَّمْتَهُ وَكَرَّمْتَهُ، وَشَرَّفْتَهُ وَفَضَّلْتَهُ عَلَى الشُّهُورِ،
items.english: O Most High, O Magnificent! O All-Forgiving, O All-Merciful! You are the Magnificent Lord, the One whom there is nothing like, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. And this is the month which You have magnified and honored, and ennobled and favored above all other months,
items.transliteration: Ya 'Aliyyu ya 'Azimu, ya Ghafuru ya Rahimu, Anta al-Rabbu al-'Azimu, al-ladhi laysa ka-mithlihi shay'un, wa huwa al-Sami'u al-Basiru, wa hadha shahrun 'azzamtahu wa karramtahu, wa sharraftahu wa faddaltahu 'ala al-shuhuri,

items.arabic: وَهُوَ الشَّهْرُ الَّذى فَرَضْتَ صِيامَهُ عَلَىَّ، وَهُوَ شَهْرُ رَمَضانَ، الَّذى انْزَلْتَ فيهِ الْقُرْآنَ، هُدًى لِلنَّاسِ وَبَيِّناتٍ مِنَ الْهُدى وَالْفُرْقانِ، وَجَعَلْتَ فيهِ لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ، وَجَعَلْتَها خَيْراً مِنْ الْفِ شَهْرٍ، فَيا ذَا الْمَنِّ وَلا يُمَنُّ عَلَيْكَ، مُنَّ عَلَىَّ بِفَكاكِ رَقَبَتى مِنَ النَّارِ، فيمَنْ تَمُنُّ عَلَيْهِ، وَادْخِلْنِى الْجَنَّةَ، بِرَحْمَتِكَ يا ارْحَمَ الرَّاحِمينَ .
items.english: and it is the month in which You have made fasting obligatory upon me; it is the month of Ramadan, in which You revealed the Quran, as guidance for mankind and clear proofs of guidance and the criterion. And You have placed within it the Night of Power, and made it better than a thousand months. O Bestower of favors, upon whom no favor can be bestowed! Bestow Your favor upon me by releasing my neck from the Fire, among those upon whom You bestow Your favor, and admit me into Paradise, by Your mercy, O Most Merciful of the merciful.
items.transliteration: Wa huwa al-shahru al-ladhi faradta siyamahu 'alayya, wa huwa shahru Ramadana, al-ladhi anzalta fihi al-Qur'ana, hudan lin-nasi wa bayyinatin mina al-huda wal-furqani, wa ja'alta fihi laylata al-qadri, wa ja'altaha khayran min alfi shahrin, fa-ya dhal-manni wa la yumannu 'alayka, munna 'alayya bi-fakaki raqabati mina al-nari, fiman tamunnu 'alayhi, wa adkhilni al-jannata, bi-rahmatika ya arhama al-rahimin.

items.arabic: 2. روى الكفعمي في المصباح والبلد الأمين عن النبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله أنّه قال: «
items.english: 2. Al-Kaf’ami narrated in al-Misbah and al-Balad al-Amin from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) that he said: “
items.transliteration: 2. Rawa al-Kaf'ami fi al-Misbah wal-Balad al-Amin 'an al-Nabiyyi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi annahu qala: «

items.arabic: مَنْ دَعا بهذا الدُّعاءِ فِي رَمَضانَ بَعْدَ كُلِّ فَرِيضَةٍ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ ذُنوبَهُ
items.english: Whoever recites this supplication in Ramadan after every obligatory prayer, Allah will forgive his sins.
items.transliteration: Man da'a bi-hadha al-du'a'i fi Ramadana ba'da kulli faridatin ghafara Allahu lahu dhunubahu.

items.arabic: »: اللَّهُمَّ ادْخِلْ عَلى اهْلِ الْقُبُورِ السُّرُورَ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْنِ كُلَّ فَقيرٍ، اللهُمَّ اشْبِعْ كُلَّ جائِعٍ، اللهُمَّ اكْسُ كُلَّ عُرْيانٍ، اللهُمَّ اقْضِ دَيْنَ كُلِّ مَدينٍ، اللهُمَّ فَرِّجْ عَنْ كُلِّ مَكْرُوبٍ، اللهُمَّ رُدَّ كُلَّ غَريبٍ، اللهُمَّ فُكَّ كُلَّ اسيرٍ، اللهُمَّ اصْلِحْ كُلَّ فاسِدٍ مِنْ امُورِ الْمُسْلِمينَ، اللهُمَّ اشْفِ كُلَّ مَريضٍ، اللهُمَّ سُدَّ فَقْرَنا بِغِناكَ، اللهُمَّ غَيِّرْ سُوءَ حالِنا بِحُسْنِ حالِكَ، اللهُمَّ اقْضِ عَنَّا الدَّيْنَ، وَاغْنِنا مِنَ الْفَقْرِ، انَّكَ عَلى كُلِّ شَىْ ءٍ قَديرٌ .
items.english: “O Allah, grant joy to the inhabitants of the graves. O Allah, enrich every poor person. O Allah, satisfy every hungry person. O Allah, clothe every unclothed person. O Allah, settle the debt of every debtor. O Allah, relieve the distress of every distressed person. O Allah, return every stranger home. O Allah, free every captive. O Allah, rectify every corruption in the affairs of the Muslims. O Allah, heal every sick person. O Allah, fill our poverty with Your wealth. O Allah, change our wretched state with the excellence of Your state. O Allah, settle our debt and enrich us from poverty. Indeed, You are powerful over all things.”
items.transliteration: »: Allahumma adkhil 'ala ahli al-quburi al-surura, Allahumma aghni kulla faqirin, Allahumma ashbi' kulla ja'i'in, Allahumma-ksu kulla 'uryanin, Allahumma-qdi dayna kulli madinin, Allahumma farrij 'an kulli makrubin, Allahumma rudda kulla gharibin, Allahumma fukka kulla asirin, Allahumma aslih kulla fasidin min umuri al-muslimina, Allahumma-shfi kulla maridin, Allahumma sudda faqrana bi-ghinaka, Allahumma ghayyir su'a halina bi-husni halika, Allahumma-qdi 'anna al-dayna, wa aghnina mina al-faqri, innaka 'ala kulli shay'in qadir.

items.english: 3. Al-Kulayni narrated in al-Kafi from Abu Basir, who said: Al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) used to recite this supplication in the month of Ramadan:

items.arabic: اللهُمَّ انّى بِكَ أَتَوَسَّلُ وَمِنْكَ اطْلُبُ حاجَتى مَنْ طَلَبَ حاجَةً الىَ النَّاسِ فَانّى لا اطْلُبُ حاجَتى الَّا مِنْكَ، وَحْدَكَ لا شَريكَ لَكَ، وَاسْئَلُكَ بِفَضْلِكَ وَرِضْوانِكَ، انْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَاهْلِ بَيْتِهِ، وَانْ تَجْعَلَ لى فى عامى هذا الى بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ سَبيلًا، حَجَّةً مَبْرُورَةً، مُتَقَبَّلَةً زاكِيَةً خالِصَةً لَكَ، تَقِرُّ بِها عَيْنى وَتَرْفَعُ بِها
items.english: O Allah, I seek access to You through You, and from You I seek my need. If others seek their needs from people, I do not seek my need except from You, alone, without any partner. I ask You by Your grace and Your pleasure to bless Muhammad and his household, and to grant me a way to Your Sacred House in this year of mine—a Hajj that is righteous, accepted, pure, and sincerely for You, by which my eye is delighted and by which You raise...
items.transliteration: Allahumma inni bika atawassalu wa minka atlubu hajati, man talaba hajatan ila al-nasi fa-inni la atlubu hajati illa minka, wahdaka la sharika laka, wa as-aluka bi-fadlika wa ridwanika, an tusalliya 'ala Muhammadin wa ahli baytihi, wa an taj'ala li fi 'ami hadha ila baytika al-harami sabilan, hajjatan mabruratan, mutaqabbalatan zakiyatan khalisatan laka, taqirru biha 'ayni wa tarfa'u biha.

items.english: and it is the month in which You have made fasting obligatory upon me; it is the month of Ramadan, in which You revealed the Quran, as guidance for mankind and clear proofs of guidance and the criterion. And You have placed within it the Night of Power, and made it better than a thousand months. So, O Bestower of favor, while no favor can be bestowed upon You, bestow Your favor upon me by releasing my neck from the Fire, among those whom You have favored, and admit me into Paradise, by Your mercy, O Most Merciful of the merciful.
items.transliteration: Wa huwa al-shahru al-ladhi faradta siyamahu 'alayya, wa huwa shahru Ramadana, al-ladhi anzalta fihi al-Qur'ana, hudan lin-nasi wa bayyinatin mina al-huda wal-furqani, wa ja'alta fihi laylata al-qadri, wa ja'altaha khayran min alfi shahrin, fa-ya dhal-manni wa la yumannu 'alayka, munna 'alayya bi-fakaki raqabati mina al-nari, fiman tamunnu 'alayhi, wa-adkhilni al-jannata, bi-rahmatika ya arhama al-rahimin.

items.english: “O Allah, grant joy to the inhabitants of the graves. O Allah, enrich every poor person. O Allah, satisfy every hungry person. O Allah, clothe every unclothed person. O Allah, settle the debt of every debtor. O Allah, relieve the distress of every distressed person. O Allah, return every stranger to his home. O Allah, free every captive. O Allah, rectify every corrupt matter of the Muslims’ affairs. O Allah, heal every sick person. O Allah, fill our poverty with Your wealth. O Allah, change our bad state with Your good state. O Allah, settle our debt and free us from poverty. Indeed, You are powerful over all things.”
items.transliteration: »: Allahumma adkhil 'ala ahli al-quburi al-surura, Allahumma aghni kulla faqirin, Allahumma ashbi' kulla ja'i'in, Allahumma-ksu kulla 'uryanin, Allahumma-qdi dayna kulli madinin, Allahumma farrij 'an kulli makrubin, Allahumma rudda kulla gharibin, Allahumma fukka kulla asirin, Allahumma aslih kulla fasidin min umuri al-muslimina, Allahumma-shfi kulla maridin, Allahumma sudda faqrana bi-ghinaka, Allahumma ghayyir su'a halina bi-husni halika, Allahumma-qdi 'anna al-dayna, wa aghnina mina al-faqri, innaka 'ala kulli shay'in qadirun.

items.arabic: اللهُمَّ انّى بِكَ أَتَوَسَّلُ وَمِنْكَ اطْلُبُ حاجَتى مَنْ طَلَبَ حاجَةً الىَ النَّاسِ فَانّى لا اطْلُبُ حاجَتى الَّا مِنْكَ، وَحْدَكَ لا شَريكَ لَكَ، وَاسْئَلُكَ بِفَضْلِكَ وَرِضْوانِكَ، انْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَاهْلِ بَيْتِهِ، وَانْ تَجْعَلَ لى فى عامى هذا الى بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ سَبيلًا، حَجَّةً مَبْرُورَةً، مُتَقَبَّلَةً زاكِيَةً خالِصَةً لَكَ، تَقِرُّ بِها عَيْنى وَتَرْفَعُ بِها
items.english: O Allah, I seek access to You through You, and from You I seek my need. If others seek their needs from people, I do not seek my need except from You, alone, without any partner. I ask You by Your grace and Your pleasure to bless Muhammad and his household, and to grant me a way to Your Sacred House in this year of mine—a Hajj that is pious, accepted, pure, and sincere for You, by which my eye is delighted and by which You elevate [me].
items.transliteration: Allahumma inni bika atawassalu wa minka atlubu hajati, man talaba hajatan ila al-nasi fa-inni la atlubu hajati illa minka, wahdaka la sharika laka, wa as-aluka bi-fadlika wa ridwanika, an tusalliya 'ala Muhammadin wa ahli baytihi, wa an taj'ala li fi 'ami hadha ila baytika al-harami sabilan, hajjatan mabruratan, mutaqabbalatan zakiyatan khalisatan laka, taqirru biha 'ayni wa tarfa'u biha.

items.arabic: دَرَجَتى وَتَرْزُقُنى انْ اغُضَّ بَصَرى وَانْ احْفَظَ فَرْجى وَانْ اكُفَّ بِها عَنْ جَميعِ مَحارِمِكَ، حَتّى لايَكُونَ شَىْ ءٌ آثَرَ عِنْدى مِنْ طاعَتِكَ وَخَشْيَتِكَ، وَالْعَمَلِ بِما احْبَبْتَ، وَالتَّرْكِ لِما كَرِهْتَ وَنَهَيْتَ عَنْهُ، وَاجْعَلْ ذلِكَ فى يُسْرٍ وَيَسارٍ وَعافِيَةٍ، وَاوْزِعْنى شُكْرَ ما انْعَمْتَ بِهِ عَلَىَّ، وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تَجْعَلَ وَفاتى قَتْلًا فى سَبيلِكَ تَحْتَ رايَةِ نَبِيِّكَ مَعَ اوْلِيآئِكَ، وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تَقْتُلَ بى اعْدآئَكَ وَاعْدآءَ رَسُولِكَ، وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تُكْرِمَنى بِهَوانِ مَنْ شِئْتَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، وَلا تُهِنّى بِكَرامَةِ احَدٍ مِنْ اوْلِيآئِكَ، اللهُمَّ اجْعَلْ لى مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبيلًا، حَسْبِىَ اللَّهُ ما شآءَ اللَّهُ .
items.english: ...my rank, and grant me that I lower my gaze, and guard my chastity, and refrain through them from all Your prohibitions, so that nothing may be more preferred by me than obedience to You and fear of You, and acting upon what You love, and abandoning what You dislike and have forbidden. And grant that in ease, prosperity, and well-being. And inspire me to be thankful for the favors You have bestowed upon me. I ask You to make my death as being slain in Your cause, under the banner of Your Prophet, along with Your close friends. I ask You to slay through me Your enemies and the enemies of Your Messenger. I ask You to honor me by the humiliation of whomsoever You will of Your creation, and do not humiliate me by the honoring of any of Your close friends. O Allah, make for me a path with the Messenger. Allah is sufficient for me; whatever Allah wills.
items.transliteration: darajati wa tarzuqani an aghudda basari wa-an ahfaza farji wa-an akuffa biha 'an jami'i maharimika, hatta la yakuna shay'un athara 'indi min ta'atika wa khashyatika, wal-'amali bima ahbabta, wal-tarki lima karihta wa nahayta 'anhu, wa-j'al dhalika fi yusrin wa yasarin wa 'afiyatin, wa awzi'ni shukra ma an'amta bihi 'alayya, wa as-aluka an taj'ala wafati qatlan fi sabilika tahta rayati nabiyyika ma'a awliya'ika, wa as-aluka an taqtula bi a'da'aka wa a'da'a rasulika, wa as-aluka an tukrimani bi-hawani man shi'ta min khalqika, wa la tuhinni bi-karamati ahadin min awliya'ika, Allahumma-j'al li ma'a al-Rasuli sabilan, hasbiya Allahu ma sha'a Allahu.

items.arabic: وروى السيّد ابن طاووس في الإقبال عن أبي بصير أنّ الإمام الصادق عليه السلام قال: «
items.english: Sayyid Ibn Tawus narrated in al-Iqbal from Abu Basir that Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) said: “
items.transliteration: Wa-rawa al-Sayyid Ibn Tawus fi al-Iqbal 'an Abi Basir anna al-Imam al-Sadiq 'alayhi al-salam qala: «

items.arabic: ادْعُ للحَجِّ فِي لَيالِي شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ بَعْدَ المَغْرِبِ» .
items.english: Supplicate for the Hajj during the nights of the month of Ramadan after the Maghrib prayer.”
items.transliteration: Id'u lil-hajji fi layali shahri Ramadana ba'da al-Maghribi. »

items.arabic: وقال الكفعمي في البلد الأمين: يستحبّ الدعاء به في كلّ يوم من رمضان وفي أوّل ليلة منه .
items.english: Al-Kaf’ami said in al-Balad al-Amin: It is recommended to recite this supplication every day of Ramadan and on its first night.
items.transliteration: Wa-qala al-Kaf'ami fi al-Balad al-Amin: yustahabbu al-du'a'u bihi fi kulli yawmin min Ramadana wa-fi awwali laylatin minhu.

items.arabic: 4. أفضل الأعمال في ليالي شهر رمضان وأيّامه هو تلاوة القرآن الكريم ففيه كان نزول القرآن. وجاء في الحديث: «
items.english: 4. The best of deeds during the nights and days of the month of Ramadan is the recitation of the Holy Quran, for in it was the revelation of the Quran. It has been narrated in the Hadith: “
items.transliteration: 4. Afdal al-a'mal fi layali shahri Ramadan wa-ayyamihi huwa tilawat al-Qur'an al-Karim fa-fihi kana nuzulu al-Qur'an. Wa-ja'a fi al-hadith: «

items.arabic: إنَّ لِكُلِّ شَيْ ءٍ رَبِيعاً وَرَبِيعُ القُرآنِ هو شَهْرُ رَمَضَانَ
items.english: Indeed, everything has a spring, and the spring of the Quran is the month of Ramadan.”
items.transliteration: Inna li-kulli shay'in rabi'an wa-rabi'u al-Qur'ani huwa shahru Ramadana.

items.arabic: » ويستحبّ ختم القرآن ختمة واحدة في كلّ شهر وأقل ما روي في ذلك هو ختمه في كلّ ستة أيّام وأمّا في شهر رمضان فختمه كلّ ثلاثة أيّام ويحسن إن تيسّر له أن يختمه ختمة في كلّ يوم .
items.english: It is recommended to complete the recitation of the Quran once every month, and the minimum that has been narrated regarding this is completing it every six days. As for the month of Ramadan, it is to be completed every three days, and it is virtuous, if one is able, to complete it once every day.
items.transliteration: » Wa-yustahabbu khatmu al-Qur'ani khatmatan wahidatan fi kulli shahrin wa-aqallu ma ruwiya fi dhalika huwa khatmuhu fi kulli sittati ayyamin wa-amma fi shahri Ramadana fa-khatmuhu kulla thalathati ayyamin wa-yahsunu in tayassara lahu an yakhtimahu khatmatan fi kulli yawmin.

items.arabic: لاشكّ في أنّ من ليس له معرفة بمفاهيم القرآن ومضمونه ينبغي له تدبّر محتوى الآيات والتتلمذ على القرآن مهما قرأ منه قليلًا، كما أنّ من الضروريّ تشكيل جلسات التفسير لفهم هدى القرآن بهذا الخصوص.
items.english: There is no doubt that whoever lacks knowledge of the concepts and substance of the Quran should contemplate the content of the verses and become a student of the Quran, however little he may read of it. Likewise, it is essential to establish sessions of exegesis to understand the guidance of the Quran in this regard.
items.transliteration: La shakka fi anna man laysa lahu ma'rifatun bi-mafahimi al-Qur'ani wa-madmunihi yanbaghi lahu tadabburu muhtawa al-ayati wal-tatallumudhu 'ala al-Qur'ani mahma qara'a minhu qalilan, kama anna mina al-daruriyyi tashkilu jalasati al-tafsiri li-fahmi huda al-Qur'ani bi-hadha al-khususi.

items.arabic: قال العلّامة المجلسيّ: لو أهدى ثواب الختم للنّبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله وفاطمة الزهراء عليها السلام أو أحد الأئمّة عليهم السلام (أو لإمام العصر عليه السلام) فإنّ ثوابها أكثر . ويظهر من الرواية أنّ ثواب مثل هذا الشخص في يوم القيامة أن يكون في ظلّهم عليهم السلام .
items.english: Allamah al-Majlisi said: If one dedicates the reward of the completion [of the Quran] to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) and Fatima al-Zahra (peace be upon her) or one of the Imams (peace be upon them) (or to the Imam of the Time [peace be upon him]), then its reward is greater. It appears from the narration that the reward for such a person on the Day of Resurrection is to be in their shade (peace be upon them).
items.transliteration: Qala al-'Allamah al-Majlisi: law ahda thawaba al-khatmi lin-Nabiyyi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi wa-Fatimata al-Zahra'i 'alayha al-salam aw ahadi al-A'immati 'alayhim al-salam (aw li-Imami al-'Asri 'alayhi al-salam) fa-inna thawabaha akthar. Wa-yazharu mina al-riwayati anna thawaba mithli hadha al-shakhsi fi yawmi al-qiyamati an yakuna fi zillihim 'alayhim al-salam.

items.arabic: دَرَجَتى وَتَرْزُقُنى انْ اغُضَّ بَصَرى وَانْ احْفَظَ فَرْجى وَانْ اكُفَّ بِها عَنْ جَميعِ مَحارِمِكَ، حَتّى لايَكُونَ شَىْ ءٌ آثَرَ عِنْدى مِنْ طاعَتِكَ وَخَشْيَتِكَ، وَالْعَمَلِ بِما احْبَبْتَ، وَالتَّرْكِ لِما كَرِهْتَ وَنَهَيْتَ عَنْهُ، وَاجْعَلْ ذلِكَ فى يُسْرٍ وَيَسارٍ وَعافِيَةٍ، وَاوْزِعْنى شُكْرَ ما انْعَمْتَ بِهِ عَلَىَّ، وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تَجْعَلَ وَفاتى قَتْلًا فى سَبيلِكَ تَحْتَ رايَةِ نَبِيِّكَ مَعَ اوْلِيآئِكَ، وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تَقْتُلَ بى اعْدآئَكَ وَاعْدآءَ رَسُولِكَ، وَاسْئَلُكَ انْ تُكْرِمَنى بِهَوانِ مَنْ شِئْتَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، وَلا تُهِنّى بِكَرامَةِ احَدٍ مِنْ اوْلِيآئِكَ، اللهُمَّ اجْعَلْ لى مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبيلًا، حَسْبِىَ اللَّهُ ما شآءَ اللَّهُ .
items.english: ...my rank, and grant me that I lower my gaze, and guard my chastity, and refrain through them from all Your prohibitions, so that nothing may be more preferred by me than obedience to You and fear of You, acting upon what You love, and abandoning what You dislike and have forbidden. And place all of that in ease, prosperity, and well-being. And inspire me to be thankful for the favors You have bestowed upon me. I ask You to make my death being slain in Your path, under the banner of Your Prophet, along with Your close friends. I ask You to slay through me Your enemies and the enemies of Your Messenger. I ask You to honor me through the humiliation of whomever You will of Your creation, and do not humiliate me through the honoring of any of Your close friends. O Allah, appoint for me a path with the Messenger. Allah is sufficient for me; whatever Allah wills.
items.transliteration: darajati wa tarzuqani an aghudda basari wa-an ahfaza farji wa-an akuffa biha 'an jami'i maharimika, hatta la yakuna shay'un athara 'indi min ta'atika wa khashyatika, wal-'amali bima ahbabta, wal-tarki lima karihta wa nahayta 'anhu, waj-'al dhalika fi yusrin wa yasarin wa 'afiyatin, wa-awzi'ni shukra ma an'amta bihi 'alayya, wa as-aluka an taj'ala wafati qatlan fi sabilika tahta rayati nabiyyika ma'a awliya'ika, wa as-aluka an taqtula bi a'da'aka wa a'da'a rasulika, wa as-aluka an tukrimani bi-hawani man shi'ta min khalqika, wa la tuhinni bi-karamati ahadin min awliya'ika, Allahumma-j'al li ma'a al-rasuli sabila, hasbiya Allahu ma sha'a Allahu.

items.arabic: وروى السيّد ابن طاووس في الإقبال عن أبي بصير أنّ الإمام الصادق عليه السلام قال: «
items.english: Sayyid Ibn Tawus narrated in al-Iqbal from Abu Basir that Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) said: “
items.transliteration: Wa-rawa al-Sayyid Ibn Tawus fi al-Iqbal 'an Abi Basir anna al-Imam al-Sadiq 'alayhi al-salam qala: «

items.arabic: ادْعُ للحَجِّ فِي لَيالِي شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ بَعْدَ المَغْرِبِ» .
items.english: Supplicate for the Hajj during the nights of the month of Ramadan after the Maghrib prayer.”
items.transliteration: Id'u lil-hajji fi layali shahri Ramadana ba'da al-Maghribi. »

items.arabic: وقال الكفعمي في البلد الأمين: يستحبّ الدعاء به في كلّ يوم من رمضان وفي أوّل ليلة منه .

items.arabic: 5. الإكثار من الدعاء والصلوات والاستغفار ويكثر من قوله:
items.english: 5. Increasing supplication, prayers, and seeking forgiveness, and frequently saying:
items.transliteration: 5. Al-iktharu mina al-du'a'i wal-salawati wal-istighfari wa-yukthiru min qawlihi:

items.arabic: لا إلهَ الَّا اللَّه
items.english: There is no god but Allah.
items.transliteration: La ilaha illa Allah.

items.arabic: . جاء في الخبر:
items.english: It has been narrated in the report:
items.transliteration: Ja'a fi al-khabar:

items.arabic: حين كان يدخل شهر رمضان لم يتكلّم الإمام السجاد عليه السلام سوى بالدعاء والتسبيح والاستغفار والتكبير . كما ينبغي الإتيان بنوافل هذا الشهر الكريم خاصّة من لم يوفّق للإتيان بالنوافل (سيّما نافلة الليل) في غير هذا الشهر.
items.english: When the month of Ramadan would begin, Imam al-Sajjad (peace be upon him) would not speak except with supplication, glorification, seeking forgiveness, and magnification. Likewise, it is fitting to perform the supererogatory prayers of this noble month, especially for those who were not granted the success to perform the supererogatory prayers (particularly the Night Prayer) outside of this month.
items.transliteration: Hayna kana yadkhulu shahru Ramadana lam yatakkalam al-Imam al-Sajjad 'alayhi al-salam siwa bil-du'a'i wal-tasbihi wal-istighfari wal-takbiri. Kama yanbaghi al-ityanu bi-nawafili hadha al-shahri al-karimi khassatan man lam yuwaffaq lil-ityani bil-nawafili (siyyama nafilata al-layli) fi ghayri hadha al-shahri.

items.arabic: 5. الإكثار من الدعاء والصلوات والاستغفار ويكثر من قوله:
items.english: 5. Increasing supplication, prayers, and seeking forgiveness, and frequently saying:

items.arabic: الأعمال التي يؤتى بها في ليالي شهر رمضان هي:
items.english: The deeds to be performed during the nights of the month of Ramadan are:
items.transliteration: Al-a'malu allati yu'ta biha fi layali shahri Ramadana hiya:

items.arabic: 1. الإفطار عند دخول وقت الغروب الشرعيّ، ويستحبّ تأخيره عن صلاة العشاء إلّاإذا غلب عليه الضعف أو كان له قوم ينتظرونه .
items.english: 1. Breaking the fast at the onset of the legal time of sunset; it is recommended to delay it until after the Isha prayer, unless one is overcome by weakness or there are people waiting for him.
items.transliteration: 1. Al-iftaru 'inda dukhuli waqti al-ghurubi al-shar'iyyi, wa-yustahabbu takhiruhu 'an salati al-'isha'i illa idha ghalaba 'alayhi al-du'fu aw kana lahu qawmun yantazirunahu.

items.arabic: 2. أن يفطر بالحلال الخالي من الشبهات . ويحسن الإفطار بالتمر حيث ورد في الحديث أن من أفطر على التمر ضوعف أجره .
items.english: 2. Breaking the fast with what is lawful and free from ambiguities. It is virtuous to break the fast with dates, as it has been narrated in the Hadith that whoever breaks his fast with dates, his reward is multiplied.
items.transliteration: 2. An yuftira bil-halali al-khali mina al-shubuhat. Wa-yahsunu al-iftaru bit-tamri haythu warada fi al-hadithi anna man aftara 'ala al-tamri du'ifa ajruhu.

items.arabic: وعن عليّ عليه السلام أنّه: «
items.english: And it is narrated from Ali (peace be upon him) that he: “
items.transliteration: Wa-'an 'Aliyyin 'alayhi al-salam annahu: «

items.arabic: يُسْتَحَبّ الإفطارُ باللَّبَنِ»
items.english: It is recommended to break the fast with milk.”
items.transliteration: Yustahabbu al-iftaru bil-labani. »

items.arabic: . ويمكن الإفطار بالماء الحار والسكّر والحلوى حيث كان يفطر بها رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله .
items.english: And one may break the fast with warm water, sugar, and sweets, as the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) used to break his fast with them.
items.transliteration: Wa-yumkinu al-iftaru bil-ma'i al-harri wal-sukkari wal-halwa haythu kana yuftiru biha Rasulu Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi.

items.arabic: 3. أن يدعو عند الإفطار بالدعوات المأثورة ومنها:
items.english: 3. To supplicate at the time of breaking the fast with the narrated supplications, including:
items.transliteration: 3. An yad'uwa 'inda al-iftari bil-da'awati al-ma'thurati wa-minha:

items.arabic: أ) اللهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْتُ، وَعَلى رِزْقِكَ افْطَرْتُ، وَعَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ .
items.english: a) O Allah, for You I have fasted, and with Your sustenance I have broken my fast, and in You I have placed my trust.
items.transliteration: a) Allahumma laka sumtu, wa-'ala rizqika aftartu, wa-'alayka tawakkaltu.

items.arabic: ب) وكان أميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام إذا أراد أن يفطر يقول:
items.english: b) When the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) intended to break his fast, he would say:
items.transliteration: b) Wa-kana Amiru al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salam idha arada an yuftira yaqulu:

items.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْنا، وَعَلى رِزْقِكَ افْطَرْنا، فَتَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا، انَّكَ انْتَ السَّميعُ
items.english: In the name of Allah. O Allah, for You we have fasted, and with Your sustenance we have broken our fast, so accept [it] from us; indeed, You are the All-Hearing.
items.transliteration: Bismi Allahi, Allahumma laka sumna, wa-'ala rizqika aftarna, fa-taqabbal minna, innaka anta al-Sami'u.

items.title: الأعمال المشتركة لليالي شهر رمضان المبارك:

items.english: The deeds to be performed during the nights of the month of Ramadan are:

items.english: 1. Breaking the fast at the onset of the legal time of sunset; it is recommended to delay it until after the Isha prayer, unless one is overcome by weakness or there are people waiting for him.
items.transliteration: 1. Al-iftaru 'inda dukhuli waqti al-ghurubi al-shar'iyyi, wa-yustahabbu takhiruhu 'an salati al-'isha'i illa idha ghalaba 'alayhi al-du'fu aw kana lahu qawmun yantazirunahu.

items.arabic: 2. أن يفطر بالحلال الخالي من الشبهات . ويحسن الإفطار بالتمر حيث ورد في الحديث أن من أفطر على التمر ضوعف أجره .
items.english: 2. Breaking the fast with what is lawful and free from ambiguities. It is virtuous to break the fast with dates, as it has been narrated in the Hadith that whoever breaks his fast with dates, his reward is multiplied.
items.transliteration: 2. An yuftira bil-halali al-khali mina al-shubuhati. Wa-yahsunu al-iftaru bit-tamri haythu warada fi al-hadithi anna man aftara 'ala al-tamri du'ifa ajruhu.

items.arabic: وعن عليّ عليه السلام أنّه: «
items.english: And it is narrated from Ali (peace be upon him) that he: “
items.transliteration: Wa-'an 'Aliyyin 'alayhi al-salam annahu: «

items.arabic: يُسْتَحَبّ الإفطارُ باللَّبَنِ»
items.english: It is recommended to break the fast with milk.”
items.transliteration: Yustahabbu al-iftaru bil-labani. »

items.arabic: . ويمكن الإفطار بالماء الحار والسكّر والحلوى حيث كان يفطر بها رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله .
items.english: And one may break the fast with warm water, sugar, and sweets, as the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) used to break his fast with them.
items.transliteration: Wa-yumkinu al-iftaru bil-ma'i al-harri wal-sukkari wal-halwa haythu kana yuftiru biha Rasulu Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi.

items.arabic: 3. أن يدعو عند الإفطار بالدعوات المأثورة ومنها:
items.english: 3. To supplicate at the time of breaking the fast with the narrated supplications, including:
items.transliteration: 3. An yad'uwa 'inda al-iftari bil-da'awati al-ma'thurati wa-minha:

items.arabic: أ) اللهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْتُ، وَعَلى رِزْقِكَ افْطَرْتُ، وَعَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ .
items.english: a) O Allah, for You I have fasted, and with Your sustenance I have broken my fast, and in You I have placed my trust.
items.transliteration: a) Allahumma laka sumtu, wa-'ala rizqika aftartu, wa-'alayka tawakkaltu.

items.arabic: ب) وكان أميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام إذا أراد أن يفطر يقول:
items.english: b) When the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) intended to break his fast, he would say:
items.transliteration: b) Wa-kana Amiru al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salam idha arada an yuftira yaqulu:

items.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ صُمْنا، وَعَلى رِزْقِكَ افْطَرْنا، فَتَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا، انَّكَ انْتَ السَّميعُ
items.english: In the name of Allah. O Allah, for You we have fasted, and with Your sustenance we have broken our fast, so accept [it] from us; indeed, You are the All-Hearing.
items.transliteration: Bismi Allahi, Allahumma laka sumna, wa-'ala rizqika aftarna, fa-taqabbal minna, innaka anta al-Sami'u.

items.arabic: الْعَليمُ .
items.english: the All-Knowing.
items.transliteration: al-'Alimu.

footnote_refs.title: مصباح الكفعمي: ص 631( كما وردت هذه الرواية باختلاف يسير في إقبال الأعمال: ص 116).

items.arabic: 4. أن يتلو عند الإفطار سورة
items.english: 4. To recite a Surah at the time of breaking the fast
items.transliteration: 4. An yatluwa 'inda al-iftari surata

items.arabic: القدر
items.english: al-Qadr.
items.transliteration: al-Qadr.

items.arabic: فلها فضل عظيم .
items.english: For it has great merit.
items.transliteration: Fa-laha fadlun 'azimun.

items.arabic: 5. يقول حين يتناول أوّل لقمة في الإفطار:
items.english: 5. To say when taking the first morsel at the time of breaking the fast:
items.transliteration: 5. Yaqulu hayna yatanawalu awwala luqmatin fi al-iftari:

items.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمنِ الرّحَيمِ، يا واسِعَ الْمَغْفِرَةِ، اغْفِرْلى
items.english: In the name of Allah, the All-Beneficent, the All-Merciful. O Vast in Forgiveness, forgive me.
items.transliteration: Bismi Allahi al-Rahmani al-Rahimi, ya wasi'a al-maghfirati, ighfir li.

items.arabic: قال الإمام الحسن عليه السلام: «
items.english: Imam al-Hasan (peace be upon him) said: “
items.transliteration: Qala al-Imamu al-Hasanu 'alayhi al-salam: «

items.arabic: مَنْ قالَ ذلِك غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ» .
items.english: Whoever says this, Allah will forgive him.”
items.transliteration: Man qala dhalika ghafara Allahu lahu. »

items.arabic: 6. الدعاء عند الإفطار فللصائم دعوة مجابة عند الإفطار كما روي ذلك عن النبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله .
items.english: 6. To supplicate at the time of breaking the fast; for the fasting person has a supplication that is answered at the time of breaking the fast, as that has been narrated from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family).
items.transliteration: 6. Al-du'a'u 'inda al-iftari fa-lis-sa'imi da'watun mujabatun 'inda al-iftari kama ruwiya dhalika 'an al-Nabiyyi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi.

items.arabic: 7. أن يتصدّق عند الافطار ويفطر الصائمين ولو بعدد من التمر أو بشربة ماء. فالإفطار من المستحبّات المؤكّدة التي لا ينبغي أن يغفلها المؤمنون، حيث تنصب مائدة كبيرة في جميع مساجد بعض الدول الإسلاميّة عند الإفطار.
items.english: 7. To give charity at the time of breaking the fast and to provide for the breaking of the fast of those who are fasting, even if with a few dates or a drink of water. For providing for the breaking of the fast is among the highly recommended acts that the believers should not neglect, as a large spread is laid out in all the mosques of some Islamic countries at the time of breaking the fast.
items.transliteration: 7. An yatasaddaqa 'inda al-iftari wa-yufattira al-sa'imina wa-law bi-'adadin mina al-tamri aw bi-shurbati ma'in. Fal-iftaru mina al-mustahabbati al-mu'akkadati allati la yanbaghi an yaghfulaha al-mu'minuna, haythu tunsabu ma'idatun kabiratun fi jami'i masajidi ba'di al-duwali al-islamiyyati 'inda al-iftari.

items.arabic: فقد روي عن رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: For it has been narrated from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family): “
items.transliteration: Fa-qad ruwiya 'an Rasuli Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: «

items.arabic: أنّ مَن فَطَّرَ صائِماً كانَ لَهُ كَعِتْقِ رَقَبةٍ مُؤمِنَةٍ
items.english: That whoever provides for the breaking of the fast of a fasting person, there shall be for him [a reward] like the freeing of a believing slave.
items.transliteration: Anna man fattara sa'iman kana lahu ka-'itqi raqabatin mu'minatin.

items.arabic: »، فلمّا قال له أصحابه ليس كلّنا نقدر على ذلك. قال: «
items.english: ”, and when his companions said to him, “Not all of us are able to do that,” he said: “
items.transliteration: », fa-lamma qala lahu as-habuhu laysa kulluna naqdiru 'ala dhalika. Qala: «

items.arabic: وَلَوْ بِشَقِّ تَمْرَةٍ أو بِشَرْبَةِ مَاءٍ» .
items.english: even if it be with half a date or a drink of water.”
items.transliteration: Wa-law bi-shaqqi tamratin aw bi-shurbati ma'in. »

items.arabic: وفي رواية عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام: «
items.english: And in a narration from Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him): “
items.transliteration: Wa-fi riwayatin 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salam: «

items.arabic: أنّ مَنْ فَطَّرَ صائِماً فَلَهُ أجْرٌ مِثْلُه (دونَ أن يَنْقُصَ مِن أجْرِه شَي ءٌ)» .
items.english: That whoever provides for the breaking of the fast of a fasting person, then for him is a reward like his (without anything being diminished from his reward).”
items.transliteration: Anna man fattara sa'iman fa-lahu ajrun mithluhu (duna an yanqusa min ajrihi shay'un). »

items.arabic: 8. أن يدعو بعد المغرب بدعاء الحجّ الذي مضى سابقاً (ص 471).
items.english: 8. To supplicate after Maghrib with the Supplication of Hajj which was mentioned previously (p. 471).
items.transliteration: 8. An yad'uwa ba'da al-Maghribi bi-du'a'i al-Hajji alladhi mada sabiqan (s. 471).

items.arabic: 9. روى السيّد ابن طاووس في الإقبال: إنّ مَن دعا بهذا الدعاء في كلّ ليلة من شهر رمضان غفرت له ذنوبه:
items.english: 9. Sayyid Ibn Tawus narrated in al-Iqbal: Indeed, whoever supplicates with this supplication every night of the month of Ramadan, his sins shall be forgiven:
items.transliteration: 9. Rawa al-Sayyidu Ibnu Tawusin fi al-Iqbali: Inna man da'a bi-hadha al-du'a'i fi kulli laylatin min shahri Ramadana ghufirat lahu dhunubuhu:

items.arabic: اللهُمَّ رَبَّ شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ، الَّذى انْزَلْتَ فيهِ الْقُرْآنَ، وَافْتَرَضْتَ على عِبادِكَ فيهِ الصِّيامَ، صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَارْزُقْنى حَجَّ بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ، فى عامى هذا وَفى كُلِّ عامٍ، وَاغْفِرْ لى تِلْكَ الذُّنُوبَ الْعِظامَ، فَانَّهُ لا يَغْفِرُها غَيْرُكَ يا رَحْمنُ يا عَلّامُ .
items.english: O Allah, Lord of the month of Ramadan, in which You revealed the Quran and enjoined the fast upon Your servants; bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and grant me the pilgrimage to Your Sacred House in this year of mine and in every year; and forgive me those great sins, for indeed, none forgives them except You, O All-Beneficent, O All-Knowing.
items.transliteration: Allahumma Rabba shahri Ramadana, alladhi anzalta fihi al-Qur'ana, wa-ftaradta 'ala 'ibadika fihi al-siyama, salli 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin, wa-rzuqni hajja baytika al-harami, fi 'ami hadha wa-fi kulli 'amin, wa-ghfir li tilka al-dhunuba al-'izama, fa-innahu la yaghfiruha ghayruka ya Rahmanu ya 'Allamu.

items.arabic: 10. أن يدعو في كلّ ليلة بدعاء الافتتاح.
items.english: 10. To supplicate in every night with the Supplication of al-Iftitah.
items.transliteration: 10. An yad'uwa fi kulli laylatin bi-du'a'i al-Iftitahi.

items.arabic: الْعَليمُ .
items.english: the All-Knowing.
items.transliteration: al-'Alimu.

footnote_refs.title: مصباح الكفعمي: ص 631( كما وردت هذه الرواية باختلاف يسير في إقبال الأعمال: ص 116).

items.transliteration: 10. An yad'uwa fi kulli laylatin bi-du'a'i al-Iftitahi.

items.arabic: روي بسند معتبر عن صاحب الأمر- إمام الزمان أرواحنا فداه- أنّه كتب للشيعة: ادعوا بهذا الدعاء كلّ ليلة من شهر رمضان فإنّ الدعاء في هذا الشهر تسمعه الملائكة وتستغفر لصاحبه.
items.english: It has been narrated with a reliable chain of narration from the Master of the Command—the Imam of the Time (may our souls be sacrificed for him)—that he wrote to the Shia: “Supplicate with this supplication every night of the month of Ramadan; for indeed, the supplication in this month is heard by the angels, and they seek forgiveness for its reciter.”
items.transliteration: Ruwiya bi-sanadin mu'tabarin 'an Sahibi al-Amri - Imami al-Zamani arwahuna fidahu - annahu kataba lish-Shi'ati: Ud'u bi-hadha al-du'a'i kulla laylatin min shahri Ramadana fa-inna al-du'a'a fi hadha al-shahri tasma'uhu al-mala'ikatu wa-tastaghfiru li-sahibihi.

items.arabic: والدعاء كما ورد في زاد المعاد هو:
items.english: And the supplication, as mentioned in Zad al-Ma'ad, is:

items.arabic: اللهُمَّ انّى افْتَتِحُ الثَّنآءَ بِحَمْدِكَ، وَانْتَ مُسَدِّدٌ لِلصَّوابِ بِمَنِّكَ، وَايْقَنْتُ انَّكَ انْتَ ارْحَمُ الرَّاحِمينَ فى مَوْضِعِ الْعَفْوِ وَالرَّحْمَةِ، وَاشَدُّ الْمُعاقِبينَ فى مَوْضِعِ النَّكالِ وَالنَّقِمَةِ، وَاعْظَمُ الْمُتَجَبِّرينَ فى مَوْضِعِ الْكِبْريآءِ وَالْعَظَمَةِ، اللهُمَّ اذِنْتَ لى فى دُعآئِكَ وَمَسْئَلَتِكَ، فَاسْمَعْ يا سَميعُ مِدْحَتى وَاجِبْ يا رَحيمُ دَعْوَتى وَاقِلْ يا غَفُورُ عَثْرَتى فَكَمْ يآ الهى مِنْ كُرْبَةٍ قَدْ فَرَّجْتَها، وَهُمُومٍ قَدْ كَشَفْتَها، وَعَثْرَةٍ قَدْ اقَلْتَها، وَرَحْمَةٍ قَدْ نَشَرْتَها، وَحَلْقَةِ بَلاءٍ قَدْ فَكَكْتَها، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لَمْ يَتَّخِذْ صاحِبَةً وَلا وَلَداً، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ شَريكٌ فى الْمُلْكِ، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ وَلِىٌّ مِنَ الذُّلِّ، وَكَبِّرْهُ تَكْبيراً، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ بِجَميعِ مَحامِدِهِ كُلِّهَا، عَلى جَميعِ نِعَمِهِ كُلِّها، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا مُضآدَّ لَهُ فى مُلْكِهِ، وَلا مُنازِعَ لَهُ فى امْرِهِ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا شَريكَ لَهُ فى خَلْقِهِ، وَلا شَبيهَ لَهُ فى عَظَمَتِهِ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الْفاشى فِى الْخَلْقِ امْرُهُ وَحَمْدُهُ، الظَّاهِرِ بِالْكَرَمِ مَجْدُهُ، الْباسِطِ بِالْجُودِ يَدَهُ، الَّذى لا تَنْقُصُ خَزآئِنُهُ، وَلا تَزيدُهُ كَثْرَةُ الْعَطآءِ الَّا جُوداً وَكَرَماً، انَّهُ هُوَ الْعَزيزُ الْوَهَّابُ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ قَليلًا مِنْ كَثيرٍ مَعَ حاجَةٍ بى الَيْهِ عَظيمَةٍ، وَغِناكَ عَنْهُ قَديمٌ، وَهُوَ عِنْدى كَثيرٌ، وَهُوَ عَلَيْكَ سَهْلٌ يَسيرٌ، اللهُمَّ انَّ عَفْوَكَ عَنْ ذَنْبى وَتَجاوُزَكَ عَنْ خَطيئَتى وَصَفْحَكَ عَنْ ظُلْمى وَسَتْرَكَ عَلى قَبيحِ عَمَلى وَحِلْمَكَ عَنْ كَثيرِ جُرْمى عِنْدَ ما كانَ مِنْ
items.english:
O Allah, I begin the praise with Your glorification, and You direct [me] towards the right course through Your grace. I am certain that You are the Most Merciful of the merciful in the station of pardon and mercy, the most severe of punishers in the station of exemplary punishment and vengeance, and the greatest of the powerful in the station of majesty and greatness. 

O Allah, You have permitted me to supplicate to You and to ask of You; so hear, O Hearer, my praise, and answer, O Merciful, my prayer, and overlook, O Forgiving, my lapse. For how many a distress, O my God, You have relieved, and how many anxieties You have removed, and how many a lapse You have overlooked, and how many a mercy You have spread, and how many a ring of affliction You have dismantled! 

All praise is due to Allah, Who has not taken a spouse nor a son, and Who has no partner in the sovereignty, and Who has no protector from humiliation, and magnify Him with [all] magnificence. All praise is due to Allah with the entirety of His praises, for the entirety of His favors. All praise is due to Allah, for Whom there is no opponent in His sovereignty, nor any contender in His command. All praise is due to Allah, for Whom there is no partner in His creation, nor anyone similar to Him in His greatness. All praise is due to Allah, Whose command and praise are manifest among the creation, Whose glory is apparent through His generosity, Who extends His hand with bounty; Whose treasures never diminish, and the abundance of giving only increases His bounty and generosity; indeed, He is the All-Mighty, the All-Bestower. 

O Allah, I ask of You a little from much, despite my great need for it, while Your independence from it is eternal; and for me it is much, while for You it is easy and simple. O Allah, indeed Your pardon for my sin, Your overlooking of my mistake, Your forgiveness for my wrongdoing, Your concealment of my ugly deed, and Your forbearance toward my many crimes, when I had...
items.transliteration: Allahumma inni aftatihu al-thana'a bi-hamdika, wa-anta musaddidun lil-sawabi bi-mannika, wa-ayqantu annaka anta arhamu al-rahimina fi mawdi'i al-'afwi wa-al-rahmati, wa-ashaddu al-mu'aqibina fi mawdi'i al-nakali wa-al-naqimati, wa-a'zamu al-mutajabbirina fi mawdi'i al-kibriya'i wa-al-'azamati. Allahumma adhinta li fi du'a'ika wa-mas'alatika, fa-sma' ya Sami'u midhati wa-ajib ya Rahimu da'wati wa-aqil ya Ghafuru 'athrati. Fa-kam ya Ilahi min kurbatin qad farrajtaha, wa-humumin qad kashaftaha, wa-'athratin qad aqaltaha, wa-rahmatin qad nashartaha, wa-halqati bala'in qad fakaktaha. Al-hamdu lillahi alladhi lam yattakhidh sahibatan wa-la waladan, wa-lam yakun lahu sharikun fi al-mulki, wa-lam yakun lahu waliyyun mina al-dhulli, wa-kabbirhu takbiran. Al-hamdu lillahi bi-jami'i mahamidihi kulliha, 'ala jami'i ni'amihi kulliha. Al-hamdu lillahi alladhi la mudadda lahu fi mulkihi, wa-la munazi'a lahu fi amrihi. Al-hamdu lillahi alladhi la sharika lahu fi khalqihi, wa-la shabiha lahu fi 'azamatihi. Al-hamdu lillahi al-fashi fi al-khalqi amruhu wa-hamduhu, al-zahiri bil-karami majduhu, al-basiti bil-judi yadahu, alladhi la tanqusu khaza'inuhu, wa-la taziduhu kathratu al-'ata'i illa judan wa-karaman, innahu huwa al-'Azizu al-Wahhabu. Allahumma inni as'aluka qalilan min kathirin ma'a hajatin bi ilayhi 'azimatin, wa-ghinaka 'anhu qadimun, wa-huwa 'indi kathirun, wa-huwa 'alayka sahlun yasirun. Allahumma inna 'afwaka 'an dhanbi wa-tajawuzaka 'an khati'ati wa-safhaka 'an zulmi wa-satraka 'ala qabihi 'amali wa-hilmaka 'an kathiri jurmi 'inda ma kana min

items.arabic: روي بسند معتبر عن صاحب الأمر- إمام الزمان أرواحنا فداه- أنّه كتب للشيعة: ادعوا بهذا الدعاء كلّ ليلة من شهر رمضان فإنّ الدعاء في هذا الشهر تسمعه الملائكة وتستغفر لصاحبه.
items.english: It has been narrated with a reliable chain of narration from the Master of the Command—the Imam of the Time (may our souls be sacrificed for him)—that he wrote to the Shia: “Supplicate with this supplication every night of the month of Ramadan; for indeed, the supplication in this month is heard by the angels, and they seek forgiveness for the one who offers it.”
items.transliteration: Ruwiya bi-sanadin mu'tabarin 'an Sahibi al-Amri - Imami al-Zamani arwahuna fidahu - annahu kataba lish-Shi'ati: Ud'u bi-hadha al-du'a'i kulla laylatin min shahri Ramadana fa-inna al-du'a'a fi hadha al-shahri tasma'uhu al-mala'ikatu wa-tastaghfiru li-sahibihi.

items.english: O Allah, I begin the praise with Your glorification, and You direct [me] towards the right course through Your grace. I am certain that You are the Most Merciful of the merciful in the station of pardon and mercy, the most severe of punishers in the station of exemplary punishment and vengeance, and the greatest of the powerful in the station of pride and majesty. O Allah, You have permitted me to supplicate to You and to ask of You; so hear, O All-Hearing, my praise, and answer, O All-Merciful, my call, and overlook, O All-Forgiving, my stumbling. For how many a distress, O my God, You have relieved, and anxieties You have removed, and stumblings You have overlooked, and mercy You have spread, and circles of affliction You have untied! Praise be to Allah, Who has not taken a spouse nor a son, and Who has no partner in His kingdom, and Who has no protector from humiliation; and magnify Him with all magnificence. Praise be to Allah with all His praises for all His blessings. Praise be to Allah, for Whom there is no opponent in His kingdom, nor contender in His command. Praise be to Allah, for Whom there is no partner in His creation, nor likeness to Him in His greatness. Praise be to Allah, Whose command and praise are manifest among the creation, Whose glory is manifest through generosity, Who extends His hand with bounty, Whose treasures never decrease, and the abundance of giving only increases Him in bounty and generosity; indeed, He is the All-Mighty, the All-Bestower. O Allah, I ask You for a little from much, despite my great need for it, while Your independence from it is eternal; and it is much to me, while for You it is easy and simple. items.arabic: خَطَأى وَعَمْدى اطْمَعَنى فى انْ اسْئَلَكَ ما لا اسْتَوْجِبُهُ مِنْكَ الَّذى رَزَقْتَنى مِنْ رَحْمَتِكَ، وَارَيْتَنى مِنْ قُدْرَتِكَ، وَعَرَّفْتَنى مِنْ اجابَتِكَ، فَصِرْتُ ادْعُوكَ آمِناً، وَاسْئَلُكَ مُسْتَأْنِساً لا خآئِفاً وَلا وَجِلًا، مُدِلًّا عَلَيْكَ فيما قَصَدْتُ فيهِ الَيْكَ، فَانْ ابْطَا عَنّى عَتَبْتُ بِجَهْلى عَلَيْكَ، وَلَعَلَّ الَّذى ابْطَا عَنّى هُوَ خَيْرٌ لى لِعِلْمِكَ بِعاقِبَةِ الْأُمُورِ، فَلَمْ ارَ مَوْلًا كَريماً اصْبَرَ عَلى عَبْدٍ لَئيمٍ مِنْكَ عَلَىَّ يا رَبِّ، انَّكَ تَدْعُونى فَاوَلّى عَنْكَ، وَتَتَحَبَّبُ الَىَّ فَاتَبَغَّضُ الَيْكَ، وَتَتَوَدَّدُ الَىَّ فَلا اقْبَلُ مِنْكَ، كَانَّ لِىَ التَّطَوُّلَ عَلَيْكَ، فَلَمْ يَمْنَعْكَ ذلِكَ مِنَ الرَّحْمَةِ لى وَالْإِحْسانِ الَىَّ، وَالتَّفَضُّلِ عَلَىَّ بِجُودِكَ وَكَرَمِكَ، فَارْحَمْ عَبْدَكَ الْجاهِلَ، وَجُدْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَضْلِ احْسانِكَ، انَّكَ جَوادٌ كَريمٌ، الْحَمْدُللَّهِ مالِكِ الْمُلْكِ، مُجْرِى الْفُلْكِ، مُسَخِّرِ الرِّياحِ، فالِقِ الْإِصْباحِ، دَيَّانِ الدّينِ، رَبِّ الْعَالَمينَ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى حِلْمِهِ بَعْدَ عِلْمِهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى عَفْوِهِ بَعْدَ قُدْرَتِهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى طُولِ اناتِهِ فى غَضَبِهِ، وَهُوَ الْقادِرُ عَلى ما يُريدُ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ خالِقِ الْخَلْقِ، باسِطِ الرِّزْقِ، فالقِ الْإِصْباحِ، ذِى الْجَلالِ وَالْإِكْرامِ، وَالْفَضْلِ وَالْإِنْعامِ، الَّذى بَعُدَ فَلا يُرى وَقَرُبَ فَشَهِدَ النَّجْوى تَبارَكَ وَتَعالى الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لَيْسَ لَهُ مُنازِعٌ يُعادِلُهُ، وَلا شَبيهٌ يُشاكِلُهُ، وَلا ظَهيرٌ يُعاضِدُهُ، قَهَرَ بِعِزَّتِهِ الْأَعِزَّآءَ، وَتَواضَعَ لِعَظَمَتِهِ الْعُظَمآءُ، فَبَلَغَ بِقُدْرَتِهِ ما يَشآءُ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى يُجيبُنى حينَ اناديهِ، وَيَسْتُرُ عَلَىَّ كُلَّ عَوْرَةٍ وَانَا اعْصيهِ، وَيُعَظِّمُ النِّعْمَةَ عَلَىَّ فَلا اجازيهِ، فَكَمْ مِنْ مَوْهِبَةٍ هَنيئَةٍ قَدْ اعْطانى وَعَظيمَةٍ مَخُوفَةٍ قَدْ كَفانى وَبَهْجَةٍ مُونِقَةٍ قَدْ ارانى فَاثْنى عَلَيْهِ حامِداً، وَاذْكُرُهُ مُسَبِّحاً، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا يُهْتَكُ حِجابُهُ، وَلا يُغْلَقُ بابُهُ، وَلا يُرَدُّ سآئِلُهُ، وَلا يُخَيَّبُ آمِلُهُ، الْحَمْدُللَّهِ الَّذى يُؤْمِنُ الْخآئِفينَ، وَيُنَجِّى الصَّالِحينَ، وَيَرْفَعُ الْمُسْتَضْعَفينَ، وَيَضَعُ الْمُسْتَكْبِرينَ، وَيُهْلِكُ مُلُوكاً، وَيَسْتَخْلِفُ آخَرينِ، وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ قاصِمِ الْجَبَّارينَ، مُبيرِ الظَّالِمينَ،
items.english:
...my error and my intent have emboldened me to ask of You that which I do not deserve from You; that which You have provided me from Your mercy, shown me from Your power, and made known to me of Your response. So I have come to call upon You in security, and ask of You in intimacy, neither fearful nor apprehensive, acting with familiarity towards You in that which I have sought from You. If it is slow in coming to me, I blame You in my ignorance, though perhaps the delay in it is better for me, due to Your knowledge of the outcome of all affairs. For I have not seen a generous master more patient with a wretched servant than You are with me, O Lord. Indeed, You invite me but I turn away from You, and You show affection to me but I show animosity towards You, and You endear Yourself to me but I do not accept it from You, as if I have some favor over You. Yet that does not prevent You from having mercy upon me, being kind to me, and favoring me through Your bounty and generosity. So have mercy on Your ignorant servant, and be generous to him through the excellence of Your kindness; indeed, You are Magnanimous and Generous.

All praise is due to Allah, the Owner of Sovereignty, the Mover of the ships, the Subduer of the winds, the Bringer of the dawn, the Dispenser of Judgment, the Lord of the worlds. All praise is due to Allah for His forbearance despite His knowledge; all praise is due to Allah for His pardon despite His power; and all praise is due to Allah for His long-suffering in His anger, while He is capable of doing whatever He wills. All praise is due to Allah, the Creator of all creation, the Expander of sustenance, the Bringer of the dawn, the Possessor of Majesty and Honor, and of Bounty and Grace; He Who is so far that He cannot be seen, and so near that He witnesses the secret conversation. Blessed and Exalted is He. All praise is due to Allah, Who has no antagonist to equal Him, nor any peer to resemble Him, nor any supporter to assist Him. He has subdued the mighty by His glory, and the great have humbled themselves before His greatness; so He attains by His power whatever He wills. All praise is due to Allah, Who answers me when I call Him, conceals for me every fault while I disobey Him, and increases the favor upon me yet I do not reward Him. How many a pleasant gift He has granted me, how many a terrible dread He has sufficed me, and how many a delightful splendor He has shown me! So I extol Him, praising [Him], and I remember Him, glorifying [Him]. All praise is due to Allah, Whose veil is never torn, Whose door is never closed, Whose petitioner is never rejected, and whose hopeful seeker is never disappointed. All praise is due to Allah, Who grants security to the fearful, delivers the righteous, raises the oppressed, abases the arrogant, destroys kings, and appoints others in their place. All praise is due to Allah, the Crusher of the tyrants, the Destroyer of the oppressors,

items.arabic: خَطَأى وَعَمْدى اطْمَعَنى فى انْ اسْئَلَكَ ما لا اسْتَوْجِبُهُ مِنْكَ الَّذى رَزَقْتَنى مِنْ رَحْمَتِكَ، وَارَيْتَنى مِنْ قُدْرَتِكَ، وَعَرَّفْتَنى مِنْ اجابَتِكَ، فَصِرْتُ ادْعُوكَ آمِناً، وَاسْئَلُكَ مُسْتَأْنِساً لا خآئِفاً وَلا وَجِلًا، مُدِلًّا عَلَيْكَ فيما قَصَدْتُ فيهِ الَيْكَ، فَانْ ابْطَا عَنّى عَتَبْتُ بِجَهْلى عَلَيْكَ، وَلَعَلَّ الَّذى ابْطَا عَنّى هُوَ خَيْرٌ لى لِعِلْمِكَ بِعاقِبَةِ الْأُمُورِ، فَلَمْ ارَ مَوْلًا كَريماً اصْبَرَ عَلى عَبْدٍ لَئيمٍ مِنْكَ عَلَىَّ يا رَبِّ، انَّكَ تَدْعُونى فَاوَلّى عَنْكَ، وَتَتَحَبَّبُ الَىَّ فَاتَبَغَّضُ الَيْكَ، وَتَتَوَدَّدُ الَىَّ فَلا اقْبَلُ مِنْكَ، كَانَّ لِىَ التَّطَوُّلَ عَلَيْكَ، فَلَمْ يَمْنَعْكَ ذلِكَ مِنَ الرَّحْمَةِ لى وَالْإِحْسانِ الَىَّ، وَالتَّفَضُّلِ عَلَىَّ بِجُودِكَ وَكَرَمِكَ، فَارْحَمْ عَبْدَكَ الْجاهِلَ، وَجُدْ عَلَيْهِ بِفَضْلِ احْسانِكَ، انَّكَ جَوادٌ كَريمٌ، الْحَمْدُللَّهِ مالِكِ الْمُلْكِ، مُجْرِى الْفُلْكِ، مُسَخِّرِ الرِّياحِ، فالِقِ الْإِصْباحِ، دَيَّانِ الدّينِ، رَبِّ الْعَالَمينَ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى حِلْمِهِ بَعْدَ عِلْمِهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى عَفْوِهِ بَعْدَ قُدْرَتِهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى طُولِ اناتِهِ فى غَضَبِهِ، وَهُوَ الْقادِرُ عَلى ما يُريدُ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ خالِقِ الْخَلْقِ، باسِطِ الرِّزْقِ، فالقِ الْإِصْباحِ، ذِى الْجَلالِ وَالْإِكْرامِ، وَالْفَضْلِ وَالْإِنْعامِ، الَّذى بَعُدَ فَلا يُرى وَقَرُبَ فَشَهِدَ النَّجْوى تَبارَكَ وَتَعالى items.arabic: مُدْرِكِ الْهارِبينَ، نَكالِ الظَّالِمينَ، صَريخِ الْمُسْتَصْرِخينَ، مَوْضِع حاجاتِ الطَّالِبينَ، مُعْتَمَدِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى مِنْ خَشْيَتِهِ تَرْعَدُ السَّمآءُ وَسُكَّانُها، وَتَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَعُمَّارُها، وَتَمُوجُ الْبِحارُ وَمَنْ يَسْبَحُ فى غَمَراتِها، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى هَدانا لِهذا، وَما كُنَّا لِنَهْتَدِىَ لَوْلا انْ هَدانَا اللَّهُ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى يَخْلُقُ وَلَمْ يُخْلَقْ، وَيَرْزُقُ وَلا يُرْزَقُ، وَيُطْعِمُ وَلا يُطْعَمُ، وَيُميتُ الْأَحيآءَ وَيُحْيِى الْمَوْتى وَهُوَ حَىٌّ لا يَمُوتُ، بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُ، وَهُوَ عَلى كُلِّ شَىْ ءٍ قَديرٌ، اللهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ عَبْدِكَ وَرَسُولِكَ، وَامينِكَ وَصَفِيِّكَ، وَحَبيبِكَ وَخِيَرَتِكَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، وَحافِظِ سِرِّكَ، وَمُبَلِّغِ رِسالاتِكَ، افْضَلَ وَاحْسَنَ وَاجْمَلَ، وَاكْمَلَ وَازْكى وَانْمى وَاطْيَبَ وَاطْهَرَ وَاسْنى وَاكْثَرَ ما صَلَّيْتَ وَبارَكْتَ وَتَرَحَّمْتَ، وَتَحَنَّنْتَ وَسَلَّمْتَ عَلى احَدٍ مِن عِبادِكَ وَانْبِيآئِكَ وَرُسُلِكَ وَصَفْوَتِكَ، وَاهْلِ الْكَرامَةِ عَلَيْكَ مِن خَلْقِكَ، اللهُمَّ وَصَلِّ عَلى عَلىٍّ اميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ، وَوَصِىِّ رَسُولِ رَبِّ الْعالَمينَ، عَبْدِكَ وَوَليِّكَ وَاخى رَسُولِكَ، وَحُجَّتِكَ عَلى خَلْقِكَ، وَآيَتِكَ الْكُبْرى وَالنَّبَأِ الْعَظيمِ، وَصَلِّ عَلَى الصِّدّيقَةِ الطَّاهِرَةِ، فاطِمَةَ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِالْعالَمينَ، وَصَلِّ عَلى سِبْطَىِ الرَّحْمَةِ وَامامَىِ الْهُدى الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، سَيّدَىْ شَبابِ اهْلِ الْجَّنَةِ، وَصَلِّ عَلى ائِمَّةِ الْمُسْلِمينَ، عَلِىِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ، وَمُحَمَّدِبْنِ عَلِىٍّ، وَجَعْفَرِبْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَمُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ، وَعَلِىِّ بْنِ مُوسى وَمُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِىٍّ، وَعَلِىِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَالْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِىٍّ، وَالْخَلَفِ الْهادِى الْمَهْدِىِّ، حُجَجِكَ عَلى عِبادِكَ، وَامَنآئِكَ فى بِلادِكَ، صَلاةً كَثيرَةً دآئِمَةً، اللهُمَّ وَصَلِّ عَلى وَلِىِّ امْرِكَ الْقآئِمِ الْمُؤَمَّلِ، وَالْعَدْلِ الْمُنْتَظَرِ، وَحُفَّهُ بِمَلائِكَتِكَ الْمُقَرَّبينَ، وَايِّدْهُ بِرُوحِ الْقُدُسِ يا رَبَّ الْعالَمينَ، اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ الدَّاعِىَ الى كِتابِكَ، وَالْقآئِمَ بِدينِكَ، اسْتَخْلِفْهُ فِى الْأَرْضِ كَمَا اسْتَخْلَفْتَ الَّذينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ، مَكِّنْ لَهُ دينَهُ الَّذِى ارْتَضَيْتَهُ لَهُ، ابْدِلْهُ مِنْ بَعْدِ خَوْفِهِ امْناً، يَعْبُدُكَ لا يُشْرِكُ بِكَ شَيْئاً، اللهُمَّ اعِزَّهُ وَاعْزِزْ بِهِ،
items.english:
The Overtaker of those who flee, the Exemplary Punisher of the oppressors, the Aid of those who seek aid, the Object of the needs of the seekers, the Support of the believers. All praise is for Allah, through Whose fear the heavens and their inhabitants tremble, the earth and its dwellers quake, and the seas and those who swim in their depths surge. All praise is for Allah, Who guided us to this, and we would not have been guided had Allah not guided us. All praise is for Allah, Who creates and is not created, Who provides sustenance and is not provided for, Who feeds and is not fed, Who brings death to the living and brings the dead to life, and He is the Ever-Living Who does not die; in His hand is all good, and He has power over all things.

O Allah, bless Muhammad, Your servant and Your Messenger, Your trustee and Your chosen one, Your beloved and Your elect from among Your creation, the protector of Your secret, and the conveyer of Your messages; with the most excellent, the best, the most beautiful, the most perfect, the purest, the most flourishing, the most pleasant, the cleanest, the most sublime, and the most abundant [blessings] that You have ever bestowed, blessed, had mercy, been compassionate, and granted peace upon any of Your servants, Your Prophets, Your Messengers, Your chosen ones, and the people of honor before You from among Your creation.

O Allah, and bless Ali, the Commander of the Faithful, the successor of the Messenger of the Lord of the worlds, Your servant, Your guardian, the brother of Your Messenger, Your proof over Your creation, Your greatest sign, and the Great News. And bless the Truthful, the Pure, Fatimah, the Mistress of the women of the worlds. And bless the two grandsons of mercy and the two Imams of guidance, Hasan and Husayn, the two leaders of the youth of the inhabitants of Paradise. And bless the Imams of the Muslims: Ali son of Husayn, Muhammad son of Ali, Ja'far son of Muhammad, Musa son of Ja'far, Ali son of Musa, Muhammad son of Ali, Ali son of Muhammad, Hasan son of Ali, and the Successor, the Guide, the Mahdi; Your proofs over Your servants and Your trustees in Your lands, with many and everlasting blessings.

O Allah, and bless the guardian of Your command, the Upright, the Hoped-for, and the awaited Justice; surround him with Your proximate angels and strengthen him with the Holy Spirit, O Lord of the worlds. O Allah, make him the caller to Your Book and the establisher of Your religion; make him a successor on the earth as You made those before him successors; establish for him his religion which You have approved for him; exchange his fear for security, that he may worship You, not associating anything with You. O Allah, grant him honor and grant honor through him.
items.transliteration: Mudriki al-haribina, nakali al-zalimina, sarikhi al-mustasrikhina, mawdi'i hajati al-talibina, mu'tamadi al-mu'minina, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi min khashyatihi tar'adu al-sama'u wa-sukkanuha, wa-tarjufu al-ardu wa-'ummaruha, wa-tamuju al-biharu wa-man yasbahu fi ghamaratiha, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi hadana li-hadha, wa-ma kunna li-nahtadiya lawla an hadana Allahu, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi yakhluqu wa-lam yukhlaq, wa-yarzuqu wa-la yurzaqu, wa-yut'imu wa-la yut'amu, wa-yumitu al-ahya'a wa-yuhyi al-mawta wa-huwa hayyun la yamutu, bi-yadihi al-khayru, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadirun, Allahumma salli 'ala Muhammadin 'abdika wa-rasulika, wa-aminika wa-safiyyika, wa-habibika wa-khiyaratika min khalqika, wa-hafizi sirrika, wa-muballighi risalatika, afdala wa-ahsana wa-ajmala, wa-akmala wa-azka wa-anma wa-atyaba wa-athara wa-asna wa-akthara ma sallayta wa-barakta wa-tarahhamta, wa-tahannanta wa-sallamta 'ala ahadin min 'ibadika wa-anbiya'ika wa-rusulika wa-safwatika, wa-ahli al-karamati 'alayka min khalqika, Allahumma wa-salli 'ala 'Aliyyin Amiri al-Mu'minina, wa-wasiyyi Rasuli Rabbi al-'alamina, 'abdika wa-waliyyika wa-akhi rasulika, wa-hujjatika 'ala khalqika, wa-ayatika al-kubra wa-al-naba'i al-'azimi, wa-salli 'ala al-Siddiqati al-Tahirata, Fatimata sayyidati nisa'i al-'alamina, wa-salli 'ala sibtay al-rahmati wa-imamay al-huda al-Hasani wa-al-Husayni, sayyiday shababi ahli al-jannati, wa-salli 'ala a'immati al-muslimina, 'Aliyyi bni al-Husayni, wa-Muhammadibni 'Aliyyin, wa-Ja'faribni Muhammadin, wa-Musa bni Ja'farin, wa-'Aliyyi bni Musa, wa-Muhammadi bni 'Aliyyin, wa-'Aliyyi bni Muhammadin, wa-al-Hasani bni 'Aliyyin, wa-al-Khalafi al-Hadi al-Mahdiyyi, hujajika 'ala 'ibadika, wa-umana'ika fi biladika, salatan kathiratan da'imatan, Allahumma wa-salli 'ala waliyyi amrika al-Qa'imi al-mu'ammali, wa-al-'adli al-muntazari, wa-huffahu bi-mala'ikatika al-muqarrabina, wa-ayyid-hu bi-ruhi al-qudusi ya Rabba al-'alamina, Allahumma ij'alhu al-da'iya ila kitabika, wa-al-qa'ima bi-dinika, istakhlifhu fi al-ardi kama istakhlafta alladhina min qablihi, makkin lahu dinahu alladhi artadaytahu lahu, abdilhu min ba'di khawfihi amnan, ya'buduka la yushriku bika shay'an, Allahumma a'izzahu wa-a'ziz bihi.
