items.arabic: وَانْصُرْهُ وَانْتَصِرْ بِهِ، وَانْصُرْهُ نَصْراً عَزيزاً، وَافْتَحْ لَهُ فَتْحاً يَسيراً، وَاجْعَلْ لَهُ مِنْ لَدُنْكَ سُلْطاناً نَصيراً، اللهُمَّ اظْهِرْ بِهِ دينَكَ وَسُنَّةَ نَبِيِّكَ، حَتّى لا يَسْتَخْفِىَ بِشَىْ ءٍ مِنَ الْحَقِّ مَخافَةَ احَدٍ مِنَ الْخَلْقِ، اللهُمَّ انَّا نَرْغَبُ الَيْكَ فى دَوْلَةٍ كَريمَةٍ، تُعِزُّ بِهَا الْإِسْلامَ وَاهْلَهُ، وَتُذِلُّ بِهَا النِّفاقَ وَاهْلَهُ، وَتَجْعَلُنا فيها مِنَ الدُّعاةِ الى طاعَتِكَ، وَالْقادَةِ الى سَبيلِكَ، وَتَرْزُقُنا بِها كَرامَةَ الدُّنْيا وَالْاخِرَةِ، اللَّهُمَّ ما عَرَّفْتَنا مِنَ الْحَقِّ فَحَمِّلْناهُ، وَما قَصُرْنا عَنْهُ فَبَلِّغْناهُ، اللهُمَّ الْمُمْ بِهِ شَعْثَنا، وَاشْعَبْ بِهِ صَدْعَنا، وَارْتُقْ بِهِ فَتْقَنا، وَكَثِّرْبِهِ قِلَّتَنا، وَاعْزِزْ بِهِ ذِلَّتَنا، وَاغْنِ بِهِ عآئِلَنا، وَاقْضِ بِهِ عَنْ مُغْرَمِنا، وَاجْبُرْبِهِ فَقْرَنا، وَسُدَّ بِهِ خَلَّتَنا، وَيَسِّرْ بِهِ عُسْرَنا، وَبَيِّضْ بِهِ وُجُوهَنا، وَفُكَّ بِهِ اسْرَنا، وَانْجِحْ بِهِ طَلِبَتَنا، وَانْجِزْ بِهِ مَواعيدَنا، وَاسْتَجِبْ بِهِ دَعْوَتَنا، وَاعْطِنا بِهِ سُؤْلَنا، وَبَلِّغْنا بِهِ مِنَ الدُّنْيا وَالْاخِرَةِ آمالَنا، وَاعْطِنا بِهِ فَوْقَ رَغْبَتِنا، يا خَيْرَ الْمَسْئُولينَ وَاوْسَعَ الْمُعْطينَ، اشْفِ بِهِ صُدُورَنا، وَاذْهِبْ بِهِ غَيْظَ قُلُوبِنا، وَاهْدِنا بِهِ لِمَا اخْتُلِفَ فيهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِاذْنِكَ، انَّكَ تَهْدى مَنْ تَشآءُ الى صِراطٍ مُسْتَقيمٍ، وَانْصُرْنا بِهِ عَلى عَدُوِّكَ وَعَدُوِّنآ، الهَ الْحَقِّ آمينَ، اللهُمَّ انَّا نَشْكُو الَيْكَ فَقْدَ نَبِيِّنا صَلَواتُكَ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، وَغَيْبَةَ وَلِيِّنا، وَكَثْرَةَ عَدُوِّنا، وَقِلَّةَ عَدَدِنا، وَشِدّةَ الْفِتَنِ بِنا، وَتَظاهُرَ الزَّمانِ عَلَيْنا، فَصَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ الِهِ، وَاعِنَّا عَلى ذلِكَ بِفَتْحٍ مِنْكَ تُعَجِّلُهُ، وَ بِضُرٍّ تَكْشِفُهُ، وَنَصْرٍ تُعِزُّهُ، وَسُلْطانِ حَقٍّ تُظْهِرُهُ، وَرَحْمَةٍ مِنْكَ تَجَلِّلُناها، وَعافِيَةٍ مِنْكَ تُلْبِسُناها، بِرَحْمَتِكَ يا ارْحَمَ الرَّاحِمينَ.
items.english: And help him and grant victory through him, and grant him a mighty victory, and grant him an easy opening, and appoint for him from Yourself a helping authority. O Allah, manifest through him Your religion and the Sunnah of Your Prophet, so that nothing of the truth may remain hidden out of fear of any of the creation. O Allah, we ardently desire from You a noble state, through which You honor Islam and its people, and through which You abase hypocrisy and its people; and through which You place us among those who call to Your obedience and the leaders to Your path, and grant us through it the honor of this world and the Hereafter. O Allah, whatever of the truth You have made known to us, then make us bear it; and whatever we have fallen short of, then make us reach it. O Allah, through him, collect our dispersed affairs, and through him, mend our brokenness, and through him, join our separation, and through him, increase our small numbers, and through him, grant honor to our lowliness, and through him, enrich our dependency, and through him, pay our debts, and through him, redress our poverty, and through him, fill our gaps, and through him, make easy our difficulty, and through him, whiten our faces, and through him, free our captives, and through him, grant success to our requests, and through him, fulfill our promises, and through him, answer our supplication, and through him, grant us our petition, and through him, make us attain our hopes of this world and the Hereafter, and through him, give us more than our desire. O Best of those who are asked and the Most Liberal of givers! Through him, heal our breasts, and through him, remove the anger of our hearts, and through him, guide us to the truth in that wherein there has been disagreement, by Your permission; indeed, You guide whomsoever You will to a straight path. And through him, help us against Your enemy and our enemy, O Allah of Truth, Amen. O Allah, we complain to You of the loss of our Prophet (Your blessings be upon him and his family), the absence of our guardian, the abundance of our enemies, the smallness of our numbers, the severity of trials upon us, and the turning of time against us. So bless Muhammad and his family, and assist us against that with a victory from You that You hasten, and with the removal of affliction that You uncover, and with a help that You strengthen, and with an authority of truth that You manifest, and with a mercy from You that covers us, and with a well-being from You that You clothe us with; by Your mercy, O Most Merciful of the merciful.
items.transliteration: Wa-nsurhu wa-ntasir bihi, wa-nsurhu nasran 'azizan, wa-ftah lahu fathan yasiran, wa-j'al lahu min ladunka sultanan nasiran. Allahumma azhir bihi dinaka wa-sunnata nabiyyika, hatta la yastakhfiya bi-shay'in mina al-haqqi makhafata ahadin mina al-khalqi. Allahumma inna narghabu ilayka fi dawlatin karimatin, tu'izzu biha al-Islama wa-ahlahu, wa-tudhillu biha al-nifaqa wa-ahlahu, wa-taj'aluna fiha mina al-du'ati ila ta'atika, wa-al-qadati ila sabilika, wa-tarzuquna biha karamata al-dunya wa-al-akhirati. Allahumma ma 'arraftana mina al-haqqi fa-hammilnahu, wa-ma qasurna 'anhu fa-ballighnahu. Allahumma-lmum bihi sha'thana, wa-sh'ab bihi sad'ana, wa-rtuq bihi fatqana, wa-kaththir bihi qillatana, wa-a'ziz bihi dhillatana, wa-aghni bihi 'a'ilana, wa-qdi bihi 'an mughramina, wa-jbur bihi faqrana, wa-sudda bihi khallatana, wa-yassir bihi 'usrana, wa-bayyid bihi wujuhana, wa-fukka bihi asrana, wa-anjih bihi talibatana, wa-anjiz bihi maw'idana, wa-stajib bihi da'watana, wa-a'tina bihi su'lana, wa-ballighna bihi mina al-dunya wa-al-akhirati amalana, wa-a'tina bihi fawqa raghbatina, ya khayra al-mas'ulina wa-awsa'a al-mu'tina, ishfi bihi sudurana, wa-adhhib bihi ghayza qulubina, wa-hdina bihi lima-khtulifa fihi mina al-haqqi bi-idhnika, innaka tahdi man tasha'u ila siratin mustaqimin. Wa-nsurna bihi 'ala 'aduwwika wa-'aduwwina, ilaha al-haqqi amina. Allahumma inna nashku ilayka faqda nabiyyina salawatuka 'alayhi wa-alihi, wa-ghaybata waliyyina, wa-kathrata 'aduwwina, wa-qillata 'adadina, wa-shiddata al-fitani bina, wa-tazahura al-zamani 'alayna, fa-salli 'ala Muhammadin wa-alihi, wa-a'inna 'ala dhalika bi-fathin minka tu'ajjiluhu, wa-bi-durrin takshifuhu, wa-nasrin tu'izzuhu, wa-sultani haqqin tuzhiruhu, wa-rahmatin minka tajallilunaha, wa-'afiyatin minka tulbisunaha, bi-rahmatika ya arhamu al-rahimina.

items.arabic: 11. تقول في كلّ ليلة:
items.english: 11. To say in every night:
items.transliteration: 11. Taqulu fi kulli laylatin:

items.arabic: اللهُمَّ بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِى الصَّالِحينَ فَادْخِلْنا، وَفى عِلِّيّينَ فَارْفَعْنا، وِبَكَاْسٍ مِنْ مَعينٍ مِنْ عَيْنٍ سَلْسَبيلٍ فَاسْقِنا، وَمِنَ الْحُورِ الْعينِ بِرَحْمَتِكَ فَزَوِّجْنا، وَمِنَ الْوِلْدانِ
items.english: O Allah, by Your mercy, admit us among the righteous; and raise us to 'Illiyyin; and give us to drink from a cup of flowing water from the spring of Salsabil; and by Your mercy, marry us to the fair-skinned maidens with wide eyes; and from the youths
items.transliteration: Allahumma bi-rahmatika fi al-salihina fa-dkhilna, wa-fi 'illiyyina fa-rfa'na, wa-bi-ka'sin min ma'inin min 'aynin Salsabilin fa-sqina, wa-mina al-huri al-'ini bi-rahmatika fa-zawwijna, wa-mina al-wildani.

items.arabic: الْمُخَلَّدينَ كَانَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَكْنُونٌ فَاخْدِمْنا، وَمِنْ ثِمارِ الْجَنَّةِ وَلُحُومِ الطَّيْرِ فَاطْعِمْنا، وَمِنْ ثِيابِ السُّنْدُسِ وَالْحَريرِ وَالْإِسْتَبْرَقِ فَالْبِسْنا، وَلَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ وَحَجَّ بَيْتِكَ الْحرامِ وَقَتْلًا فى سَبيلِكَ فَوَفِّقْ لَنا، وَصالِحَ الدُّعآءِ وَالْمَسْئَلةِ فَاسْتَجِبْ لَنا، وَاذا جَمَعْتَ الأَوَّلينَ وَالأخِرينَ يَوْمَ الْقِيامَةِ فَارْحَمْنا، وَبَرآئَةً مِنَ النَّارِ فَاكْتُبْ لَنا، وَفى جَهَنَّمَ فَلا تَغُلَّنا، وَفى عَذابِكَ وَهَوانِكَ فَلا تَبْتَلِنا، وَمِنَ الزَّقُّومِ وَالضَّريعِ فَلا تُطْعِمْنا، وَمَعَ الشَّياطينِ فَلا تَجْعَلْنا، وَفِى النَّارِ عَلى وُجُوهِنا فَلا تَكْبُبْنا، وَمِنْ ثِيابِ النَّارِ وَسَرابيلِ الْقَطِرانِ فَلا تُلْبِسْنا، وَمِنْ كُلِّ سُوءٍ يا لا الهَ الَّا انْتَ بِحَقِّ لا الهَ الَّا انْتَ فَنَجِّنا .
items.english: who are eternally youthful, as if they were hidden pearls, grant us service; and from the fruits of Paradise and the meat of birds, feed us; and from garments of fine silk, silk, and brocade, clothe us; and for the Night of Power, the pilgrimage to Your Sacred House, and martyrdom in Your way, grant us success; and for righteous supplication and petition, answer us; and when You gather the first and the last on the Day of Resurrection, have mercy on us; and a decree of immunity from the Fire, write for us; and in Hell, do not shackle us; and with Your punishment and humiliation, do not afflict us; and from Zaqqum and the bitter thorn, do not feed us; and with the devils, do not place us; and in the Fire upon our faces, do not cast us headlong; and with garments of fire and shirts of pitch, do not clothe us; and from every evil—O You besides Whom there is no god—by the right of 'there is no god but You', deliver us.
items.transliteration: al-mukhalladina ka-annahum lu'lu'un maknunun fa-khdimna, wa-min thimari al-jannati wa-luhumi al-tayri fa-at'imna, wa-min thiyabi al-sundusi wa-al-hariri wa-al-istabraqi fa-lbisna, wa-laylata al-Qadri wa-hajja baytika al-harami wa-qatlan fi sabilika fa-waffiq lana, wa-saliha al-du'a'i wa-al-mas'alati fa-stajib lana, wa-idha jama'ta al-awwalina wa-al-akhirina yawma al-qiyamati fa-rhamna, wa-bara'atan mina al-nari fa-ktub lana, wa-fi jahannama fa-la taghullana, wa-fi 'adhabika wa-hawanika fa-la tabtalina, wa-mina al-zaqqumi wa-al-dari'i fa-la tut'imna, wa-ma'a al-shayatini fa-la taj'alna, wa-fi al-nari 'ala wujuhina fa-la takbubna, wa-min thiyabi al-nari wa-sarabili al-qatirani fa-la tulbisna, wa-min kulli su'in ya la ilaha illa anta bi-haqqi la ilaha illa anta fa-najjina.

items.arabic: 12. عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام: «
items.english: 12. From Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him): “
items.transliteration: 12. 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salam: «

items.arabic: تَقُولُ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ مِن شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ:
items.english: To say in every night of the month of Ramadan:
items.transliteration: Taqulu fi kulli laylatin min shahri Ramadana:

items.arabic: اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ انْ تَجْعَلَ فيما تَقْضى وَتُقَدِّرُ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ الْمَحْتُومِ فِى الْأَمْرِ الْحَكيمِ، مِنَ الْقَضآءِ الَّذى لا يُرَدُّ وَلا يُبَدَّلُ، انْ تَكْتُبَنى مِنْ حُجَّاجِ بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ، الْمَبْرُورِ حَجُّهُمْ، الْمَشْكُورِ سَعْيُهُمْ، الْمَغْفُورِ ذُنُوبُهُمْ، الْمُكَفَّرِ عَنْ سَيِّئاتِهِمْ، وَانْ تَجْعَلَ فيما تَقْضى وَتُقَدِّرُ، انْ تُطيلَ عُمْرى فى خَيْرٍ وَعافِيَةٍ، وَتُوَسِّعَ فى رِزْقى وَتَجْعَلَنى مِمَّنْ تَنْتَصِرُ بِهِ لِدينِكَ، وَلا تَسْتَبْدِلْ بى غَيْرى .- چ چ-
items.english: O Allah, I ask You to include among that which You decree and ordain of the inevitable command in the wise affair—of the decree that is neither rescinded nor altered—that You enroll me among the pilgrims of Your Sacred House, whose Hajj is accepted, whose striving is appreciated, whose sins are forgiven, and whose evil deeds are expiated; and that You include among what You decree and ordain, that You prolong my life in goodness and well-being, expand my provision, and make me among those through whom You grant victory to Your religion, and do not replace me with another.
items.transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka an taj'ala fi-ma taqdi wa-tuqaddiru mina al-amri al-mahtumi fi al-amri al-hakimi, mina al-qada'i alladhi la yuraddu wa-la yubaddalu, an taktubani min hujjaji baytika al-harami, al-mabruri hajjuhum, al-mashkuri sa'yuhum, al-maghfuri dhunubuhum, al-mukaffari 'an sayyi'atihim, wa-an taj'ala fi-ma taqdi wa-tuqaddiru, an tutila 'umri fi khayrin wa-'afiyatin, wa-tuwassi'a fi rizqi wa-taj'alani mimman tantasiru bihi li-dinika, wa-la tastabdil bi ghayri.

items.arabic: 13. قال المرحوم المحدّث القمّي: جاء في أنيس الصالحين: ادع ذ في كلّ ليلةٍ من ليالي شهر رمضان قائلًا:
items.english: 13. The late al-Muhaddith al-Qummi said: It has been mentioned in Anis al-Salihin: Supplicate during every night of the nights of the month of Ramadan, saying:
items.transliteration: 13. Qala al-marhumu al-muhaddithu al-Qummi: ja'a fi Anisi al-Salihina: ud'u dha fi kulli laylatin min layali shahri Ramadana qa'ilan:

items.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِجَلالِ وَجْهِكَ الْكَريمِ، أَنْ يَنْقَضِىَ عَنّى شَهْرُ رَمَضانَ، اوْ يَطْلُعَ الْفَجْرُ مِنْ لَيْلَتى هذِهِ، وَلَكَ قِبَلى تَبِعَةٌ اوْ ذَنْبٌ تُعَذِّبُنى عَلَيْهِ .
items.english: I seek refuge in the Majesty of Your Noble Face, that the month of Ramadan should pass from me, or that the dawn of this night of mine should rise, while there remains against me a liability or a sin for which You would punish me.
items.transliteration: A'udhu bi-jalali wajhika al-karimi, an yanqadiya 'anni shahru Ramadana, aw yatlu'a al-fajru min laylati hadhihi, wa-laka qibali tabi'atun aw dhanbun tu'adhdhibuni 'alayhi.

items.english: 12. From Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him): “
items.transliteration: 12. 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salam: «

items.arabic: تَقُولُ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ مِن شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ:
items.english: To say in every night of the month of Ramadan:
items.transliteration: Taqulu fi kulli laylatin min shahri Ramadana:

items.english: I seek refuge in the Majesty of Your Noble Face, that the month of Ramadan should pass from me, or that the dawn of this night of mine should rise, while there remains against me a liability or a sin for which You would punish me.

items.arabic: 14. يستحبّ في كلّ ليلة صلاة ركعتين تقرأ في كلّ ركعة
items.english: 14. It is recommended every night to perform a two-rak'ah prayer, reciting in each rak'ah:
items.transliteration: 14. Yustahabbu fi kulli laylatin salatu rak'atayni taqra'u fi kulli rak'atin

items.arabic: الحمد والتوحيد
items.english: al-Hamd and al-Tawhid.
items.transliteration: al-Hamda wa-al-Tawhida.

items.arabic: ثلاث مرّات فإذا سلّمت تقول:
items.english: three times. Then when you offer the taslim, say:
items.transliteration: thalatha marratin, fa-idha sallamta taqulu:

items.arabic: سُبْحانَ مَنْ هُوَ حَفيظٌ لا يَغْفُلُ، سُبحانَ مَنْ هُوَ رَحيمٌ لا يَعْجَلُ، سُبْحانَ مَنْ هُوَ قآئِمٌ لا يَسْهُو، سُبْحانَ مَنْ هُوَ دائِمٌ لا يَلْهُو. ثمّ تسبّح بالتسبيحات الأربعة سبع مرّات ثمّ تقول: سُبْحانَكَ سُبْحانَكَ سُبْحانَكَ، يا عَظيمُ اغْفِرْ لِىَ الذَّنْبَ الْعَظيمَ.
items.english: Glory be to Him Who is a Protector and never neglects; Glory be to Him Who is Merciful and never hastens; Glory be to Him Who is Self-Subsisting and never overlooks; Glory be to Him Who is Everlasting and never treats anything with levity. Then recite the four glorifications seven times, then say: Glory be to You, Glory be to You, Glory be to You; O All-Tremendous, forgive me the tremendous sin.
items.transliteration: Subhana man huwa hafizun la yaghfulu, subhana man huwa rahimun la ya'jalu, subhana man huwa qa'imun la yashu, subhana man huwa da'imun la yalhu. Thumma tusabbihu bi-al-tasbihati al-arba'ati sab'a marratin thumma taqulu: Subhanaka subhanaka subhanaka, ya 'Azimu ighfir liya al-dhanba al-'azima.

items.arabic: ثمّ تصلّي على النّبيِّ وآلِه عَشْرَ مرّات. من صلّى هذه الصلاة غفر اللَّه له ذنوباً كثيرة .
items.english: Then invoke blessings upon the Prophet and his family ten times. Whoever performs this prayer, Allah will forgive him many sins.
items.transliteration: Thumma tusalli 'ala al-Nabiyyi wa-alihi 'ashra marratin. Man salla hadhihi al-salata ghafara Allahu lahu dhunuban kathiratan.

items.arabic: 15. في رواية عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام: «
items.english: 15. In a narration from Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him): “
items.transliteration: 15. Fi riwayatin 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salam: «

items.arabic: مَنْ قَرَأ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ مِن شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ سُورَةَ إنّا فَتَحْنا في صَلاةٍ مَسْنونَةٍ كان مَصُوناً في ذلِكَ العامِ» .
items.english: Whoever recites Surah al-Fath in every night of the month of Ramadan in a recommended prayer shall be protected throughout that year.”
items.transliteration: Man qara'a fi kulli laylatin min shahri Ramadana surata Inna Fatahna fi salatin masnunatin kana masunan fi dhalika al-'ami» .

items.arabic: 16. الصلاة ألف ركعة في شهر رمضان. وقد اختلف في كيفيّتها، ولكن ما ورد في رواية عليّ ابن مهران وطائفة كبيرة من الأعلام عن الإمام الجواد عليه السلام: «
items.english: 16. The prayer of one thousand rak'ahs in the month of Ramadan. There has been disagreement regarding its manner, but what has been reported in the narration of Ali ibn Mahran and a large group of prominent scholars from Imam al-Jawad (peace be upon him): “
items.transliteration: 16. Al-salatu alfu rak'atin fi shahri Ramadana. Wa-qad ukhtulifa fi kayfiyyatiha, wa-lakin ma warada fi riwayati 'Ali ibni Mahran wa-ta'ifatin kabiratin mina al-a'lami 'an al-Imami al-Jawadi 'alayhi al-salamu: «

items.arabic: أنْ يُصَلِّي مِنْها في كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ مِن لَيالِي العَشْرِ الاولى والثانِيَةِ عِشْرِينَ رَكْعَةً يُسَلِّمُ بَيْنَ كُلِّ رَكْعَتَيْنِ فَيُصَلِّي ثَمانٍ مِنْها بَعْدَ المَغْرِبِ واثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ رَكْعَةً تُؤَخَّرُ عن صَلاةِ العِشَاءِ، وفي العَشْرِ الأخِيرَةِ يُصَلِّي مِنْها كُلَّ لَيْلَةٍ ثَلاثِينَ رَكْعَةً، يُؤتى ثَمانٌ مِنْها بَعْدَ صَلاةِ المَغْرِبِ أيْضاً ويُؤَخّر الباقِيَةَ عَنِ العِشاءِ فَيكُونُ المَجموعُ سَبْعَمائَةِ رَكْعَةً فَتَبْقى ثَلاثمائَةُ رَكْعَة. وهي تُؤدّى فِي لَيالي القَدْرِ، مائَةُ رَكْعَة لَيْلَةَ التاسِع عَشَر (بالإضافة إلى العِشْرين رَكْعَةً التي صلّاها سابقاً) ومَائَةُ رَكْعَة لَيْلَةَ الحادِي والعِشْرِين (بالإضَافَة إِلى الثّلاثِين) ومائَةُ رَكْعَةً لَيْلَة الثالِثِ والعِشْرِين (بالإضافَةِ إلى الثّلاثين رَكْعَةً) فَتَتِمُّ ألْفُ رَكْعَة»
items.english: to perform twenty rak'ahs during each night of the first and second ten days, offering the taslim after every two rak'ahs; eight of them are performed after the Maghrib prayer, and twelve rak'ahs are delayed until after the Isha prayer. During the last ten days, thirty rak'ahs are performed each night; eight of them are also offered after the Maghrib prayer, and the remainder are delayed until after the Isha prayer. Thus, the total becomes seven hundred rak'ahs, and three hundred rak'ahs remain. These are performed on the Nights of Power: one hundred rak'ahs on the nineteenth night (in addition to the twenty rak'ahs performed previously), one hundred rak'ahs on the twenty-first night (in addition to the thirty), and one hundred rak'ahs on the twenty-third night (in addition to the thirty rak'ahs), thus completing one thousand rak'ahs.”
items.transliteration: an yusalliya minha fi kulli laylatin min layali al-'ashri al-ula wa-al-thaniyati 'ishrina rak'atan yusallimu bayna kulli rak'atayni fa-yusalli thamani minha ba'da al-maghribi wa-thnata 'ashrata rak'atan tu'akhkharu 'an salati al-'isha'i, wa-fi al-'ashri al-akhirati yusalli minha kulla laylatin thalathina rak'atan, yu'ta thamanun minha ba'da salati al-maghribi aydan wa-yu'akhkharu al-baqiyata 'an al-'isha'i fa-yakunu al-majmu'u sab'ami'ati rak'atan fa-tabqa thalathumi'atu rak'atin. wa-hiya tu'adda fi layali al-Qadri, mi'atu rak'atin laylata al-tasi'a 'ashara (bi-al-idafati ila al-'ishrina rak'atan allati sallaha sabiqan) wa-mi'atu rak'atin laylata al-hadi wa-al-'ishrina (bi-al-idafati ila al-thalathina) wa-mi'atu rak'atan laylata al-thalithi wa-al-'ishrina (bi-al-idafati ila al-thalathina rak'atan) fa-tatimmu alfu rak'atin»

items.arabic: . (ينبغي للمؤمنين أن لا يغفلوا عنها قدر المستطاع).
items.english: (It behooves the believers not to neglect them as much as they are able.)
items.transliteration: (Yanbaghi lil-mu'minina an la yaghfulu 'anha qadra al-mustata'i).

items.arabic: 14. يستحبّ في كلّ ليلة صلاة ركعتين تقرأ في كلّ ركعة
items.english: 14. It is recommended every night to perform a two-rak'ah prayer, reciting in each rak'ah:
items.transliteration: 14. Yustahabbu fi kulli laylatin salatu rak'atayni taqra'u fi kulli rak'atin

items.arabic: الحمد والتوحيد
items.english: al-Hamd and al-Tawhid.
items.transliteration: al-Hamda wa-al-Tawhida.

items.arabic: ثلاث مرّات فإذا سلّمت تقول:
items.english: three times. Then when you offer the taslim, say:
items.transliteration: thalatha marratin, fa-idha sallamta taqulu:

items.arabic: سُبْحانَ مَنْ هُوَ حَفيظٌ لا يَغْفُلُ، سُبحانَ مَنْ هُوَ رَحيمٌ لا يَعْجَلُ، سُبْحانَ مَنْ هُوَ قآئِمٌ لا يَسْهُو، سُبْحانَ مَنْ هُوَ دائِمٌ لا يَلْهُو. ثمّ تسبّح بالتسبيحات الأربعة سبع مرّات ثمّ تقول: سُبْحانَكَ سُبْحانَكَ سُبْحانَكَ، يا عَظيمُ اغْفِرْ لِىَ الذَّنْبَ الْعَظيمَ.
items.english: Glory be to Him Who is a Protector and never neglects; Glory be to Him Who is Merciful and never hastens; Glory be to Him Who is Self-Subsisting and never overlooks; Glory be to Him Who is Everlasting and never treats anything with levity. Then recite the four glorifications seven times, then say: Glory be to You, Glory be to You, Glory be to You; O Magnificent, forgive me the great sin.
items.transliteration: Subhana man huwa hafizun la yaghfulu, subhana man huwa rahimun la ya'jalu, subhana man huwa qa'imun la yashu, subhana man huwa da'imun la yalhu. Thumma tusabbihu bi-al-tasbihati al-arba'ati sab'a marratin thumma taqulu: Subhanaka subhanaka subhanaka, ya 'Azimu ighfir liya al-dhanba al-'azima.

items.arabic: ثمّ تصلّي على النّبيِّ وآلِه عَشْرَ مرّات. من صلّى هذه الصلاة غفر اللَّه له ذنوباً كثيرة .
items.english: Then invoke blessings upon the Prophet and his family ten times. Whoever performs this prayer, Allah will forgive him many sins.
items.transliteration: Thumma tusalli 'ala al-Nabiyyi wa-alihi 'ashra marratin. Man salla hadhihi al-salata ghafara Allahu lahu dhunuban kathiratan.

items.arabic: 15. في رواية عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام: «
items.english: 15. In a narration from Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him): “
items.transliteration: 15. Fi riwayatin 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salam: «

items.arabic: مَنْ قَرَأ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ مِن شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ سُورَةَ إنّا فَتَحْنا في صَلاةٍ مَسْنونَةٍ كان مَصُوناً في ذلِكَ العامِ» .
items.english: Whoever recites Surah al-Fath in every night of the month of Ramadan in a recommended prayer shall be protected throughout that year.”
items.transliteration: Man qara'a fi kulli laylatin min shahri Ramadana surata Inna Fatahna fi salatin masnunatin kana masunan fi dhalika al-'ami» .

items.arabic: 16. الصلاة ألف ركعة في شهر رمضان. وقد اختلف في كيفيّتها، ولكن ما ورد في رواية عليّ ابن مهران وطائفة كبيرة من الأعلام عن الإمام الجواد عليه السلام: «

items.arabic: 1. أن يتسحّر فلا يدع السحور ولو على حشفة تمر كما روي عن النبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله .
items.english: 1. To partake of the pre-dawn meal and not to neglect it, even if it be with a single dried date, as has been narrated from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family).
items.transliteration: 1. An yatasahhara fa-la yada'a al-suhura wa-law 'ala hashafati tamrin kama ruwiya 'an al-Nabiyyi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi.

items.arabic: 1. أن يتسحّر فلا يدع السحور ولو على حشفة تمر كما روي عن النبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله .

items.arabic: وقال صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: And he (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) said: “
items.transliteration: Wa-qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: «

items.arabic: إنّ اللَّهَ وَمَلائِكَتَهُ يُصَلُّونَ عَلَى الْمُسْتَغفِرينَ وَالْمُتَسَحِّرِيْنَ بِالْأَسْحارِ، فَتَسَحَّرُوا وَلَوْ بِجُرَع مِن الماءِ» .
items.english: Verily, Allah and His angels send blessings upon those who seek forgiveness and those who partake of the pre-dawn meal during the pre-dawn hours; so partake of the pre-dawn meal, even if with gulps of water.”
items.transliteration: Inna Allaha wa-mala'ikatahu yusalluna 'ala al-mustaghfirina wa-al-mutasahhirina bi-al-as-hari, fa-tasahharu wa-law bi-jura'in mina al-ma'i» .

items.arabic: 2. أن يقرأ سورة «
items.english: 2. To recite Surah «
items.transliteration: 2. An yaqra'a surata «

items.arabic: إنّا أنزلناه
items.english: al-Qadr.
items.transliteration: Inna Anzalnahu

items.arabic: » عند السحور، عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام قال: «
items.english: » during the pre-dawn meal; it is narrated from Imam al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) that he said: “
items.transliteration: » 'inda al-suhuri, 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salam qala: «

items.arabic: مَا مِنْ مُؤْمِنٍ صَامَ فَقَرأ «إنّا أنْزَلْناهُ في لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ» عِنْدَ سُحُورِهِ وعِنْدَ إفْطَارِهِ إلّاكانَ فِيما بَيْنَهُما كالمُتَشَحِّطِ بِدَمِه في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ» .
items.english: “There is no believer who fasts and recites ‘Indeed, We revealed it on the Night of Ordainment’ at his pre-dawn meal and at his breaking of the fast, except that between the two he is like one who wallows in his blood in the way of Allah.”
items.transliteration: Ma min mu'minin sama fa-qara'a «Inna Anzalnahu fi laylati al-qadri» 'inda suhurihi wa-'inda iftarihi illa kana fima baynahuma ka-al-mutashahhiti bi-damihi fi sabili Allahi» .

items.arabic: هذا دعاء عظيم المضامين ومبيّن لعظمة صفات اللَّه، يعين الإنسان على السير والسلوك إلى اللَّه وكماله المعنويّ ويعلّمنا التنبّه لمعانيه معارف التوحيد الخالص. وقد روي هذا الدعاء عن الإمام الرضا عليه السلام الذي قال: «
items.english: This is a supplication of great themes, manifesting the greatness of Allah’s attributes. It assists man in the journey and path towards Allah and his spiritual perfection, and teaches us, by paying attention to its meanings, the knowledge of pure Tawhid. This supplication has been narrated from Imam al-Rida (peace be upon him), who said: “
items.transliteration: Hadha du'a'un 'azimun al-madamini wa-mubayyinun li-'azamati sifati Allahi, yu'inu al-insana 'ala al-sayri wa-al-suluki ila Allahi wa-kamalihi al-ma'nawiyyi wa-yu'allimuna al-tanabbuha li-ma'anihi ma'arifa al-tawhidi al-khalisi. Wa-qad ruwiya hadha al-du'a'u 'an al-Imami al-Rida 'alayhi al-salamu al-ladhi qala: «

items.arabic: إنَّهُ دعاء الإمام الباقر عليه السلام في أسْحَارِ شَهْرِ رَمَضان وفِيه اسمُ اللَّهِ الأعْظَم والدعاء:
items.english: It is the supplication of Imam al-Baqir (peace be upon him) during the pre-dawn hours of the month of Ramadan, and in it is the Greatest Name of Allah. The supplication is:
items.transliteration: Innahu du'a'u al-Imami al-Baqiri 'alayhi al-salam fi ashari shahri Ramadana wa-fihi ismu Allahi al-a'zamu wa-al-du'a'u:

items.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ بَهآئِكَ بِابْهاهُ، وَكُلُّ بَهآئِكَ بَهِىٌّ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِبَهآئِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ جَمالِكَ بِاجْمَلِهِ، وَكُلُّ جَمالِكَ جَميلٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِجَمالِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ جَلالِكَ بِاجَلِّهِ، وَكُلُّ جَلالِكَ جَليلٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِجَلالِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عَظَمَتِكَ بِاعْظَمِها، وَكُلُّ عَظَمَتِكَ عَظَيمَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعَظَمَتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسَئَلُكَ مِنْ نُورِكَ بِانْوَرِهِ، وَكُلُّ نُورِكَ نَيِّرٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِنُورِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ رَحْمَتِكَ بِاوْسَعِها، وَكُلُّ رَحْمَتِكَ واسِعَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِرَحْمَتِكَ كُلِّها، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ كَلِماتِكَ بِاتَمِّها، وَكُلُّ كَلِماتِكَ تآمَّةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِكَلِماتِكَ كُلِّهَا، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ كَمالِكَ بِاكْمَلِهِ، وَكُلُّ كَمالِكَ كامِلٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ
items.english: O Allah, I ask You for the most resplendent of Your splendor, and all Your splendor is resplendent; O Allah, I ask You by all Your splendor. O Allah, I ask You for the most beautiful of Your beauty, and all Your beauty is beautiful; O Allah, I ask You by all Your beauty. O Allah, I ask You for the most majestic of Your majesty, and all Your majesty is majestic; O Allah, I ask You by all Your majesty. O Allah, I ask You for the greatest of Your greatness, and all Your greatness is great; O Allah, I ask You by all Your greatness. O Allah, I ask You for the most luminous of Your light, and all Your light is luminous; O Allah, I ask You by all Your light. O Allah, I ask You for the most extensive of Your mercy, and all Your mercy is extensive; O Allah, I ask You by all Your mercy. O Allah, I ask You for the most perfect of Your words, and all Your words are perfect; O Allah, I ask You by all Your words. O Allah, I ask You for the most complete of Your perfection, and all Your perfection is complete; O Allah, I ask You...

items.arabic: هذا دعاء عظيم المضامين ومبيّن لعظمة صفات اللَّه، يعين الإنسان على السير والسلوك إلى اللَّه وكماله المعنويّ ويعلّمنا التنبّه لمعانيه معارف التوحيد الخالص. وقد روي هذا الدعاء عن الإمام الرضا عليه السلام الذي قال: «
items.english: This is a supplication of great themes, manifesting the greatness of Allah’s attributes. It assists man in the journey and path towards Allah and his spiritual perfection, and teaches us, by paying attention to its meanings, the knowledge of pure Tawhid. This supplication has been narrated from Imam al-Rida (peace be upon him), who said: “
items.transliteration: Hadha du'a'un 'azimun al-madamini wa-mubayyinun li-'azamati sifati Allahi, yu'inu al-insana 'ala al-sayri wa-al-suluki ila Allahi wa-kamalihi al-ma'nawiyyi wa-yu'allimuna al-tanabbuha li-ma'anihi ma'arifa al-tawhidi al-khalisi. Wa-qad ruwiya hadha al-du'a'u 'an al-Imami al-Rida 'alayhi al-salam alladhi qala: «

items.arabic: إنَّهُ دعاء الإمام الباقر عليه السلام في أسْحَارِ شَهْرِ رَمَضان وفِيه اسمُ اللَّهِ الأعْظَم والدعاء:

items.arabic: بِكَمالِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ اسمآئِكَ بِاكْبَرِها، وَكُلُّ اسْمآئِكَ كَبيرَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِاسْمآئِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عِزَّتِكَ باعَزِّها، وَكُلُّ عِزَّتِكَ عَزيزَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعِزَّتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مَشِيَّتِكَ بِامْضاها، وَكُلُّ مَشِيَّتِكَ ماضِيَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمَشِيَّتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ قُدْرَتِكَ بِالْقُدْرَةِ الَّتِى اسْتَطَلْتَ بِها عَلى كُلِّ شَىْ ءٍ، وَكُلُّ قُدْرَتِكَ مُسْتَطيلَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِقُدْرَتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عِلْمِكَ بِانْفَذِهِ، وَكُلُّ عِلْمِكَ نافِذٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعِلْمِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ قَوْلِكَ بِارْضاهُ، وَكُلُّ قَوْلِكَ رَضِىٌّ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِقَوْلِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مَسآئِلِكَ بِاحَبِّها الَيْكَ، وَكُلُّ مَسآئِلِكَ الَيْكَ حَبيبَةٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمَسآئِلِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ شَرَفِكَ بِاشْرَفِهِ، وَكُلُّ شَرَفِكَ شَريفٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِشَرَفِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ سُلْطانِكَ بِادْوَمِهِ، وَكُلُّ سُلطانِكَ دآئِمٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِسُلْطانِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مُلْكِكَ بِافْخَرِهِ، وَكُلُّ مُلْكِكَ فاخِرٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمُلْكِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عُلُوِّكَ بِاعْلاهُ، وَكُلُّ عُلُوِّكَ عالٍ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعُلُوِّكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مَنِّكَ بِاقْدَمِهِ، وَكُلُّ مَنِّكَ قَديمٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمَنِّكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ آياتِكَ بِاكْرَمِها، وَكُلُّ آياتِكَ كَريمَةٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِآياتِكَ كُلِّها، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِما انْتَ فيهِ مِنَ الشَّاْنِ وَالْجَبَرُوتِ، وَاسْئَلُكَ بِكُلِّ شَاْنٍ وَحْدَهُ وَجَبَرُوتٍ وَحْدَها، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِما تُجيبُنى [بِهِ حينَ اسْئَلُكَ، فَاجِبْنى يا اللَّهُ.
items.english: by all Your perfection. O Allah, I ask You for the greatest of Your names, and all Your names are great; O Allah, I ask You by all Your names. O Allah, I ask You for the mightiest of Your might, and all Your might is mighty; O Allah, I ask You by all Your might. O Allah, I ask You for the most effective of Your will, and all Your will is effective; O Allah, I ask You by all Your will. O Allah, I ask You for the power by which You have dominated everything, and all Your power is dominating; O Allah, I ask You by all Your power. O Allah, I ask You for the most penetrating of Your knowledge, and all Your knowledge is penetrating; O Allah, I ask You by all Your knowledge. O Allah, I ask You for the most pleasing of Your speech, and all Your speech is pleasing; O Allah, I ask You by all Your speech. O Allah, I ask You for the requests most beloved to You, and all Your requests are beloved to You; O Allah, I ask You by all Your requests. O Allah, I ask You for the most noble of Your honor, and all Your honor is noble; O Allah, I ask You by all Your honor. O Allah, I ask You for the most enduring of Your authority, and all Your authority is enduring; O Allah, I ask You by all Your authority. O Allah, I ask You for the most magnificent of Your sovereignty, and all Your sovereignty is magnificent; O Allah, I ask You by all Your sovereignty. O Allah, I ask You for the loftiest of Your loftiness, and all Your loftiness is lofty; O Allah, I ask You by all Your loftiness. O Allah, I ask You for the most ancient of Your favor, and all Your favor is ancient; O Allah, I ask You by all Your favor. O Allah, I ask You for the most honored of Your signs, and all Your signs are honored; O Allah, I ask You by all Your signs. O Allah, I ask You by that status and omnipotence which You possess, and I ask You by every status individually and every omnipotence individually. O Allah, I ask You by that through which You answer me when I ask You, so answer me, O Allah.

بِكَمالِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ اسمآئِكَ بِاكْبَرِها، وَكُلُّ اسْمآئِكَ كَبيرَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِاسْمآئِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عِزَّتِكَ باعَزِّها، وَكُلُّ عِزَّتِكَ عَزيزَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعِزَّتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مَشِيَّتِكَ بِامْضاها، وَكُلُّ مَشِيَّتِكَ ماضِيَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمَشِيَّتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ قُدْرَتِكَ بِالْقُدْرَةِ الَّتِى اسْتَطَلْتَ بِها عَلى كُلِّ شَىْ ءٍ، وَكُلُّ قُدْرَتِكَ مُسْتَطيلَةٌ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِقُدْرَتِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عِلْمِكَ بِانْفَذِهِ، وَكُلُّ عِلْمِكَ نافِذٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعِلْمِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ قَوْلِكَ بِارْضاهُ، وَكُلُّ قَوْلِكَ رَضِىٌّ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِقَوْلِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مَسآئِلِكَ بِاحَبِّها الَيْكَ، وَكُلُّ مَسآئِلِكَ الَيْكَ حَبيبَةٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمَسآئِلِكَ كُلِّها، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ شَرَفِكَ بِاشْرَفِهِ، وَكُلُّ شَرَفِكَ شَريفٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِشَرَفِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ سُلْطانِكَ بِادْوَمِهِ، وَكُلُّ سُلطانِكَ دآئِمٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِسُلْطانِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مُلْكِكَ بِافْخَرِهِ، وَكُلُّ مُلْكِكَ فاخِرٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمُلْكِكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ عُلُوِّكَ بِاعْلاهُ، وَكُلُّ عُلُوِّكَ عالٍ، اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِعُلُوِّكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ مَنِّكَ بِاقْدَمِهِ، وَكُلُّ مَنِّكَ قَديمٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِمَنِّكَ كُلِّهِ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ مِنْ آياتِكَ بِاكْرَمِها، وَكُلُّ آياتِكَ كَريمَةٌ، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِآياتِكَ كُلِّها، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِما انْتَ فيهِ مِنَ الشَّاْنِ وَالْجَبَرُوتِ، وَاسْئَلُكَ بِكُلِّ شَاْنٍ وَحْدَهُ وَجَبَرُوتٍ وَحْدَها، اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِما تُجيبُنى [بِهِ حينَ اسْئَلُكَ، فَاجِبْنى يا اللَّهُ.
items.english: by all Your perfection. O Allah, I ask You for the greatest of Your names, and all Your names are great; O Allah, I ask You by all Your names. O Allah, I ask You for the mightiest of Your might, and all Your might is mighty; O Allah, I ask You by all Your might. O Allah, I ask You for the most effective of Your will, and all Your will is effective; O Allah, I ask You by all Your will. O Allah, I ask You for that power of Yours with which You dominate over all things, and all Your power is dominating; O Allah, I ask You by all Your power. O Allah, I ask You for the most penetrating of Your knowledge, and all Your knowledge is penetrating; O Allah, I ask You by all Your knowledge. O Allah, I ask You for the most pleasing of Your words, and all Your words are pleasing; O Allah, I ask You by all Your words. O Allah, I ask You for the most beloved of Your petitions to You, and all Your petitions are beloved to You; O Allah, I ask You by all Your petitions. O Allah, I ask You for the most noble of Your nobility, and all Your nobility is noble; O Allah, I ask You by all Your nobility. O Allah, I ask You for the most eternal of Your authority, and all Your authority is eternal; O Allah, I ask You by all Your authority. O Allah, I ask You for the most magnificent of Your kingdom, and all Your kingdom is magnificent; O Allah, I ask You by all Your kingdom. O Allah, I ask You for the highest of Your exaltation, and all Your exaltation is high; O Allah, I ask You by all Your exaltation. O Allah, I ask You for the most ancient of Your favor, and all Your favor is ancient; O Allah, I ask You by all Your favor. O Allah, I ask You for the most honored of Your signs, and all Your signs are honored; O Allah, I ask You by all Your signs. O Allah, I ask You by that dignity and omnipotence which You possess, and I ask You by every dignity individually and every omnipotence individually. O Allah, I ask You by that with which You answer me when I ask You, so answer me, O Allah.

items.arabic: چ چ-
دعاء أبو حمزة الثماليّ
items.english: The Supplication of Abu Hamzah al-Thumali
items.transliteration: Du'a'u Abu Hamzata al-Thumaliyyi.

footnote_refs.title: سبب التسمية أنّ راوي هذا الدعاء عن الإمام زين العابدين عليه السلام هو أبو حمزة الثمالي واسمه« ثابت بن دينار» وكان من خواصّ الإمام عليه السلام قال فيه عالم علم الرجال المعروف« النجاشي»: أدرك أربعة أئمّة من الإمام السجاد عليه السلام إلى الإمام الكاظم عليه السلام وروى عنهم وهو من أفضل رواة الشيعة وتثق به علماء الإماميّة. قال فيه الصادق عليه السلام:« أبو حَمْزَة سَلْمانُ زَمانِه».( معجم رجال الحديث: ج 4، ص 292).

items.arabic: يتمتع دعاء أبو حمزة الثمالي الذي يقرأ في أسحار شهر رمضان المبارك بمضامين رفيعة جدّاً بحيث لو كان للداعي أدنى استعداد روحيّ وركّز عليه لنوّر قلبه قطعاً وأحدث فيه هزّة روحيّة.
items.english: The Supplication of Abu Hamzah al-Thumali, which is recited during the pre-dawn hours of the blessed month of Ramadan, possesses such sublime themes that if the supplicant has the slightest spiritual receptivity and focuses upon it, it would certainly illuminate his heart and bring about a profound spiritual stirring within him.
items.transliteration: Yatamatta'u du'a'u Abu Hamzata al-Thumaliyyi alladhi yuqra'u fi ashari shahri Ramadana al-mubaraki bi-madamina rafi'atin jiddan bi-haythu law kana lil-da'i adna isti'dadin ruhiyyin wa-rakkaza 'alayhi la-nawwara qalbahu qat'an wa-ahdatha fihi hazzatan ruhiyyatan.

items.arabic: وبالإضافة إلى اشتمال هذا الدعاء على دورة في معرفة اللَّه فإنّه يلهم الداعي نهج العبودية وسبيل التوبة والإنابة إلى اللَّه. قال أبو حمزة الثماليّ: كان عليّ بن الحسين سيّد العابدين عليه السلام يصلّي عامّة ليله في شهر رمضان فإذا كان في السحر دعا بهذا الدعاء :
items.english: In addition to this supplication encompassing a course in the knowledge of Allah, it inspires the supplicant with the path of servitude and the way of repentance and turning back to Allah. Abu Hamzah al-Thumali said: “Ali ibn al-Husayn, the Master of Worshippers (peace be upon him), used to pray for the greater part of the night during the month of Ramadan; when it was the pre-dawn, he would recite this supplication:”
items.transliteration: Wa-bi-al-idafati ila ishtimali hadha al-du'a'i 'ala dawratin fi ma'rifati Allahi fa-innahu yulhimu al-da'iya nahja al-'ubudiyyati wa-sabila al-tawbati wa-al-inabati ila Allahi. Qala Abu Hamzata al-Thumaliyyu: kana 'Aliyyu bnu al-Husayni sayyida al-'abidina 'alayhi al-salam yusalli 'ammata laylihi fi shahri Ramadana fa-idha kana fi al-sahari da'a bi-hadha al-du'a'i:

footnote_refs.title: ذكره الشيخ في المصباح: ص 582؛ السيّد ابن طاووس في الإقبال: ص 67، كما رواه العلّامة المجلسي في بحار الأنوار: ج 95، ص 82. ونقلناه طبق نسخة المصباح. وذكرنا في الحاشية العبارات التي وردت في النسخ المتداولة ولم ترد في المصباح.

items.arabic: الهى لا تُؤَدِّبْنى بِعُقُوبَتِكَ، وَلا تَمْكُرْ بى فى حيلَتِكَ، مِنْ ايْنَ لِىَ الْخَيْرُ يا رَبِّ، وَلا يُوجَدُ الَّا مِنْ عِنْدِكَ، وَمِنْ ايْنَ لِىَ النَّجاةُ، وَلا تُسْتَطاعُ الَّا بِكَ، لَا الَّذى احْسَنَ اسْتَغْنى عَنْ عَوْنِكَ وَرَحْمَتِكَ، وَلَا الَّذى اسآءَ وَاجْتَرَءَ عَلَيْكَ وَلَمْ يُرْضِكَ خَرَجَ عَنْ قُدْرَتِكَ، يا رَبِّ يا رَبِّ يا رَبِ حتّى ينقطع النفس بك، ثمّ تقول: بِكَ عَرَفْتُكَ، وَانْتَ دَلَلْتَنى عَلَيْكَ، وَدَعَوْتَنى الَيْكَ، وَلَوْ لا انْتَ لَمْ ادْرِ ما انْتَ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى ادْعُوهُ فَيُجيبُنى وَانْ كُنْتُ بَطيئاً حينَ يَدْعُونى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى اسْئَلُهُ فَيُعْطينى وَانْ كُنْتُ بَخيلًا حينَ يَسْتَقْرِضُنى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى اناديهِ كُلَّما شِئْتُ لِحاجَتى وَاخْلُو بِهِ حَيْثُ شِئْتُ لِسِرِّى بِغَيْرِ شَفيعٍ فَيَقْضى لى حاجَتى الْحَمْدُللَّهِ الَّذى لا ادْعُو غَيْرَهُ، وَلَوْ دَعَوْتُ غَيْرَهُ لَمْ يَسْتَجِبْ لى دُعآئى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا ارْجُو غَيْرَهُ، وَلَوْ رَجَوْتُ غَيْرَهُ لَأَخْلَفَ رَجآئى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى وَكَلَنى الَيْهِ فَاكْرَمَنى وَلَمْ يَكِلْنى الَى النَّاسِ فَيُهينُونى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى تَحَبَّبَ الَىَّ وَهُوَ غَنِىٌّ عَنّى
items.english: My Allah, do not discipline me with Your punishment, and do not entrap me with Your plan. From where can I find goodness, O Lord, when it is not found except with You? And from where can I find salvation, when it cannot be attained except through You? Neither he who does good can dispense with Your help and Your mercy, nor he who does evil and is audacious against You and does not please You can escape Your power. O Lord, O Lord, O Lord... (until the breath is exhausted). Then say: By You I have known You, and You have guided me to Yourself and called me to Yourself; were it not for You, I would not have known what You are. Praise be to Allah, whom I call and He answers me, even though I am slow when He calls me. Praise be to Allah, whom I ask and He gives to me, even though I am stingy when He asks me for a loan. Praise be to Allah, whom I call whenever I wish for my need, and with whom I commune in private whenever I wish for my secret, without an intercessor, and He fulfills my need. Praise be to Allah, whom I do not call upon besides Him; for had I called upon another, he would not have answered my prayer. Praise be to Allah, in whom alone I place my hope; for had I placed my hope in another, he would have failed my hope. Praise be to Allah, who entrusted me to Himself and thus honored me, and did not entrust me to the people, for they would have humiliated me. Praise be to Allah, who endears Himself to me, though He is in no need of me.
items.transliteration: Ilahi la tu'addibni bi-'uqubatika, wa-la tamkur bi fi hilatika, min ayna liya al-khayru ya Rabbi, wa-la yujadu illa min 'indika, wa-min ayna liya al-najatu, wa-la tustata'u illa bika, la alladhi ahsana istaghna 'an 'awnika wa-rahmatika, wa-la alladhi asa'a wa-ijtara'a 'alayka wa-lam yurdika kharaja 'an qudratika, ya Rabbi ya Rabbi ya Rabbi hatta yanqati'a al-nafasu bika, thumma taqulu: Bika 'araftuka, wa-anta dalaltani 'alayka, wa-da'awtani ilayka, wa-law la anta lam adri ma anta, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi ad'uhu fa-yujibuni wa-in kuntu bati'an hina yad'uni, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi as'aluhu fa-yu'tini wa-in kuntu bakhilan hina yastaqriduni, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi unadihi kullama shi'tu li-hajati wa-akhlu bihi haythu shi'tu li-sirri bi-ghayri shafi'in fa-yaqdi li hajati, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi la ad'u ghayrahu, wa-law da'awtu ghayrahu lam yastajib li du'a'i, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi la arju ghayrahu, wa-law rajawtu ghayrahu la-akhlafa raja'i, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi wakalani ilayhi fa-akramani wa-lam yakilni ila al-nasi fa-yuhinuni, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi tahabbaba ilayya wa-huwa ghaniyyun 'anni.

items.transliteration: Wa-bi-al-idafati ila ishtimali hadha al-du'a'i 'ala dawratin fi ma'rifati Allahi fa-innahu yulhimu al-da'iya nahja al-'ubudiyyati wa-sabila al-tawbati wa-al-inabati ila Allahi. Qala Abu Hamzata al-Thumaliyyu: kana 'Aliyyu bnu al-Husayni sayyidu al-'abidina 'alayhi al-salamu yusalli 'ammata laylihi fi shahri Ramadana fa-idha kana fi al-sahari da'a bi-hadha al-du'a'i:

footnote_refs.title: ذكره الشيخ في المصباح: ص 582؛ السيّد ابن طاووس في الإقبال: ص 67، كما رواه العلّامة المجلسي في بحار الأنوار: ج 95، ص 82. ونقلناه طبق نسخة المصباح. وذكرنا في الحاشية العبارات التي وردت في النسخ المتداولة ولم ترد في المصباح.

items.arabic: الهى لا تُؤَدِّبْنى بِعُقُوبَتِكَ، وَلا تَمْكُرْ بى فى حيلَتِكَ، مِنْ ايْنَ لِىَ الْخَيْرُ يا رَبِّ، وَلا يُوجَدُ الَّا مِنْ عِنْدِكَ، وَمِنْ ايْنَ لِىَ النَّجاةُ، وَلا تُسْتَطاعُ الَّا بِكَ، لَا الَّذى احْسَنَ اسْتَغْنى عَنْ عَوْنِكَ وَرَحْمَتِكَ، وَلَا الَّذى اسآءَ وَاجْتَرَءَ عَلَيْكَ وَلَمْ يُرْضِكَ خَرَجَ عَنْ قُدْرَتِكَ، يا رَبِّ يا رَبِّ يا رَبِ حتّى ينقطع النفس بك، ثمّ تقول: بِكَ عَرَفْتُكَ، وَانْتَ دَلَلْتَنى عَلَيْكَ، وَدَعَوْتَنى الَيْكَ، وَلَوْ لا انْتَ لَمْ ادْرِ ما انْتَ، الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى ادْعُوهُ فَيُجيبُنى وَانْ كُنْتُ بَطيئاً حينَ يَدْعُونى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى اسْئَلُهُ فَيُعْطينى وَانْ كُنْتُ بَخيلًا حينَ يَسْتَقْرِضُنى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى اناديهِ كُلَّما شِئْتُ لِحاجَتى وَاخْلُو بِهِ حَيْثُ شِئْتُ لِسِرِّى بِغَيْرِ شَفيعٍ فَيَقْضى لى حاجَتى الْحَمْدُللَّهِ الَّذى لا ادْعُو غَيْرَهُ، وَلَوْ دَعَوْتُ غَيْرَهُ لَمْ يَسْتَجِبْ لى دُعآئى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا ارْجُو غَيْرَهُ، وَلَوْ رَجَوْتُ غَيْرَهُ لَأَخْلَفَ رَجآئى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى وَكَلَنى الَيْهِ فَاكْرَمَنى وَلَمْ يَكِلْنى الَى النَّاسِ فَيُهينُونى وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى تَحَبَّبَ الَىَّ وَهُوَ غَنِىٌّ عَنّى
items.english: My Allah, do not discipline me with Your punishment, and do not entrap me with Your plan. From where can I find goodness, O Lord, when it is not found except with You? And from where can I find salvation, when it cannot be attained except through You? Neither he who does good can dispense with Your help and Your mercy, nor he who does evil and dares against You and does not please You has exited from Your power. O Lord, O Lord, O Lord... (repeating it until the breath is exhausted). Then say: Through You I have known You, and You have guided me to Yourself, and called me to Yourself; were it not for You, I would not have known what You are. All praise is due to Allah, whom I call and He answers me, even though I am slow when He calls me. All praise is due to Allah, whom I ask and He gives to me, even though I am stingy when He asks a loan of me. All praise is due to Allah, whom I call whenever I wish for my need, and with whom I commune in private whenever I wish for my secret, without an intercessor, and He fulfills my need. All praise is due to Allah, besides whom I call no other; and were I to call another, he would not answer my prayer. All praise is due to Allah, besides whom I hope in no other; and were I to hope in another, he would fail my hope. All praise is due to Allah, who entrusted me to Himself and thus honored me, and did not entrust me to the people, for they would humiliate me. All praise is due to Allah, who has endeared Himself to me, though He is in no need of me.
items.transliteration: Ilahi la tu'addibni bi-'uqubatika, wa-la tamkur bi fi hilatika, min ayna liya al-khayru ya Rabbi, wa-la yujadu illa min 'indika, wa-min ayna liya al-najatu, wa-la tustata'u illa bika, la alladhi ahsana istaghna 'an 'awnika wa-rahmatika, wa-la alladhi asa'a wa-ijtara'a 'alayka wa-lam yurdika kharaja 'an qudratika, ya Rabbi ya Rabbi ya Rabbi (hatta yanqati'a al-nafasu bika), thumma taqulu: bika 'araftuka, wa-anta dalaltani 'alayka, wa-da'awtani ilayka, wa-law la anta lam adri ma anta, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi ad'uhu fa-yujibuni wa-in kuntu bati'an hina yad'uni, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi as'aluhu fa-yu'tini wa-in kuntu bakhilan hina yastaqriduni, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi unadihi kullama shi'tu li-hajati wa-akhlu bihi haythu shi'tu li-sirri bi-ghayri shafi'in fa-yaqdi li hajati, al-hamdu lillahi alladhi la ad'u ghayrahu, wa-law da'awtu ghayrahu lam yastajib li du'a'i, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi la arju ghayrahu, wa-law rajawtu ghayrahu la-akhlafa raja'i, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi wakalani ilayhi fa-akramani wa-lam yakilni ila al-nasi fa-yuhinuni, wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi tahabbaba ilayya wa-huwa ghaniyyun 'anni.

items.arabic: وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى يَحْلُمُ عَنّى حَتّى كَانّى لا ذَنْبَ لى فَرَبّى احْمَدُ شَىْ ءٍ عِنْدى وَاحَقُّ بِحَمْدى اللهُمَّ انّى اجِدُ سُبُلَ الْمَطالِبِ الَيْكَ مُشْرَعَةً، وَمَناهِلَ الرَّجآءِ الَيْكَ مُتْرَعَةً، وَالْإِسْتِعانَةَ بِفَضْلِكَ لِمَنْ امَّلَكَ مُباحَةً، وَابْوابَ الدُّعآءِ الَيْكَ لِلصَّارِخينَ مَفْتُوحَةً، وَاعْلَمُ انَّكَ لِلرَّاجى بِمَوْضِعِ اجابَةٍ، وَلِلْمَلْهُوفينَ بِمَرْصَدِ اغاثَةٍ، وَانَّ فِى اللَّهْفِ الى جُودِكَ، وَالرِّضا بِقَضآئِكَ عِوَضاً مِنْ مَنْعِ الْباخِلينَ، وَمَنْدُوحَةً عَمَّا فى ايْدِى الْمُسْتَاْثِرينَ، وَانَّ الرَّاحِلَ الَيْكَ قَريبُ الْمَسافَةِ، وَانَّكَ لا تَحْتَجِبُ عَنْ خَلْقِكَ الَّا انْ تَحْجُبَهُمُ الْأَعْمالُ دُونَكَ، وَقَدْ قَصَدْتُ الَيْكَ بِطَلِبَتى وَتَوَجَّهْتُ الَيْكَ بِحاجَتى وَجَعَلْتُ بِكَ اسْتِغاثَتى وَبِدُعآئِكَ تَوَسُّلى مِنْ غَيْرِ اسْتِحْقاقٍ لِاسْتِماعِكَ مِنّى وَلَا اسْتيجابٍ لِعَفْوِكَ عَنّى بَلْ لِثِقَتى بِكَرَمِكَ، وَسُكُونى الى صِدْقِ وَعْدِكَ، وَلَجَأى الَى الْإيمانِ بِتَوْحيدِكَ، وَيَقينى [وَثِقَتى بِمَعْرِفَتِكَ مِنّى انْ لا رَبَّ لى غَيْرُكَ، وَلا الهَ الَّا انْتَ، وَحْدَكَ لا شَريكَ لَكَ، اللَّهُمَّ انْتَ الْقائِلُ وَقَوْلُكَ حَقٌّ، وَوَعْدُكَ صِدْقٌ: وَاسْئَلُوا اللَّهَ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ انَّ اللَّهَ كانَ بِكُمْ رَحيماً. وَلَيْسَ مِنْ صِفاتِكَ يا سَيِّدى انْ تَاْمُرَ بِالسُّؤالِ وَتَمْنَعَ الْعَطِيَّةَ، وَانْتَ الْمَنّانُ بِالْعَطِيَّاتِ عَلى اهْلِ مَمْلَكَتِكَ، وَالْعائِدُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِتَحَنُّنِ رَاْفَتِكَ، الهى رَبَّيْتَنى فى نِعَمِكَ وَاحْسانِكَ صَغيراً، وَنَوَّهْتَ بِاسْمى كَبيراً، فَيا مَنْ رَبَّانى فِى الدُّنْيا بِاحْسانِهِ وَتَفَضُّلِهِ وَنِعَمِهِ، وَاشارَ لى فِى الْأخِرَةِ الى عَفْوِهِ وَكَرَمِهِ، مَعْرِفَتى يا مَوْلاىَ دَليلى عَلَيْكَ، وَحُبّى لَكَ شَفيعى الَيْكَ، وَانَا واثِقٌ مِنْ دَليلى بِدَلالَتِكَ، وَساكِنٌ مِنْ شَفيعى الى شَفاعَتِكَ، ادْعُوكَ يا سَيِّدى بِلِسانٍ قَدْ اخْرَسَهُ ذَنْبُهُ، رَبِّ اناجيكَ بِقَلْبٍ قَدْ اوْبَقَهُ جُرْمُهُ، ادْعُوكَ يا رَبِّ راهِباً راغِباً راجِياً خآئِفاً، اذا رَايْتُ مَوْلاىَ ذُنُوبى فَزِعْتُ، وَاذا رَايْتُ كَرَمَكَ طَمِعْتُ، فَانْ عَفَوْتَ فَخَيْرُ راحِمٍ، وَانْ عَذَّبْتَ فَغَيْرُ ظالِمٍ، حُجَّتى يا اللَّهُ فى جُرْاتى عَلى مَسْئَلَتِكَ مَعَ اتْيانى ما تَكْرَهُ،
items.english: And all praise is due to Allah, Who is so forbearing toward me that it is as if I have no sin; so my Lord is the most praiseworthy of all things to me, and the most worthy of my praise. O Allah, I find the paths of requests to You wide open, and the watering-places of hope in You brimming, and seeking assistance through Your favor accessible for him who places his hope in You, and the doors of supplication to You open for those who cry out. I know that You are in a position of response for the one who hopes, and a station of rescue for the distressed; and that in longing for Your generosity and being satisfied with Your decree, there is a recompense for the withholding of the miserly, and a sufficiency from what is in the hands of the possessive. Indeed, he who journeys toward You has a short distance to travel, and You are not veiled from Your creation unless their own deeds veil them from You. I have directed myself toward You with my request and turned toward You with my need; I have made my appeal for help through You and my supplication my means of approach to You, without any merit to deserve Your listening to me, nor any right to necessitate Your pardon of me, but rather because of my trust in Your generosity, my reliance upon the truth of Your promise, my refuge in the faith of Your Oneness, and my certainty in my knowledge of You that I have no Lord other than You, and there is no god but You, alone, without any partner. O Allah, You are the One Who has said—and Your word is the truth, and Your promise is true: “Ask Allah of His favor; indeed, Allah is ever Merciful to you.” And it is not among Your attributes, O my Master, to command us to ask and then withhold the gift, for You are the Bestower of gifts upon the inhabitants of Your kingdom, and the One Who turns toward them with the tenderness of Your compassion. My Allah, You nurtured me with Your blessings and Your kindness when I was young, and You made my name prominent when I grew older. So O He Who nurtured me in this world through His kindness, favor, and blessings, and has pointed me toward His pardon and generosity in the Hereafter. My knowledge, O my Master, is my guide to You, and my love for You is my intercessor with You. I am confident in my guide because of Your guidance, and I am at peace with my intercessor because of Your intercession. I call upon You, O my Master, with a tongue that has been silenced by its sin; my Lord, I confide in You with a heart that has been ruined by its offense. I call upon You, O Lord, in dread and desire, in hope and in fear. When I see my sins, O my Master, I am terrified, but when I see Your generosity, I become hopeful. So if You forgive, You are the best of the merciful, and if You punish, You are not unjust. My plea, O Allah, in my audacity in asking You despite my committing what You dislike,
items.transliteration: Wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi yahlumu 'anni hatta ka'anni la dhanba li, fa-Rabbi ahmadu shay'in 'indi wa-ahaqqu bi-hamdi. Allahumma inni ajidu subula al-matalibi ilayka mushra'atan, wa-manahila al-raja'i ilayka mutra'atan, wa-al-isti'anata bi-fadlika liman ammalaka mubahatan, wa-abwaba al-du'a'i ilayka lil-sarikhina maftuhatan, wa-a'lamu annaka lil-raji bi-mawdi'i ijabatin, wa-lil-malhufina bi-marsadi ighathatin, wa-anna fi al-lahfi ila judika, wa-al-rida bi-qada'ika 'iwadan min man'i al-bakhilina, wa-mandūhatan 'amma fi aydi al-musta'thirina, wa-anna al-rahila ilayka qaribu al-masafati, wa-annaka la tahtajibu 'an khalqika illa an tahjubahumu al-a'malu dunaka, wa-qad qasadtu ilayka bi-talibati wa-tawajjahtu ilayka bi-hajati wa-ja'altu bika istighathati wa-bi-du'a'ika tawassuli min ghayri istihqaqin li-stima'ika minni wa-la istijabin li-'afwika 'anni bal li-thiqati bi-karamika, wa-sukuni ila sidqi wa'dika, wa-laja'i ila al-imani bi-tawhidika, wa-yaqini [wa-thiqati] bi-ma'rifatika minni an la Rabba li ghayruka, wa-la ilaha illa Anta, wahdaka la sharika laka, Allahumma Anta al-qa'ilu wa-qawluka haqqun, wa-wa'duka sidqun: Wa-as'alu Allaha min fadlihi inna Allaha kana bikum rahiman. Wa-laysa min sifatika ya sayyidi an ta'mura bi-al-su'ali wa-tamna'a al-'atiyyata, wa-Anta al-Mannanu bi-al-'atiyyati 'ala ahli mamlakatika, wa-al-'a'idu 'alayhim bi-tahannuni ra'fatika, Ilahi rabbaytani fi ni'amika wa-ihsanika saghiran, wa-nawwahta bi-ismi kabiran, fa-ya man rabbani fi al-dunya bi-ihsanihi wa-tafaddulihi wa-ni'amihi, wa-ashara li fi al-akhirati ila 'afwihi wa-karamihi, ma'rifati ya Mawlaya dalili 'alayka, wa-hubbi laka shafi'i ilayka, wa-ana wathiqun min dalili bi-dalalatika, wa-sakinun min shafi'i ila shafa'atika, ad'uka ya sayyidi bi-lisanin qad akhrasahu dhanbuhu, Rabbi unajika bi-qalbin qad awbaqahu jurmuhu, ad'uka ya Rabbi rahiban raghiban rajiyan kha'ifan, idha ra'aytu Mawlaya dhunubi fazi'tu, wa-idha ra'aytu karamaka tami'tu, fa-in 'afawta fa-khayru rahimin, wa-in 'adhdhabta fa-ghayru zalimin, hujjati ya Allahu fi jur'ati 'ala mas'alatika ma'a ityani ma takrahu,

وَاسْئَلُوا اللَّهَ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ انَّ اللَّهَ كانَ بِكُمْ رَحيماً. وَلَيْسَ مِنْ صِفاتِكَ يا سَيِّدى انْ تَاْمُرَ بِالسُّؤالِ وَتَمْنَعَ الْعَطِيَّةَ، وَانْتَ الْمَنّانُ بِالْعَطِيَّاتِ عَلى اهْلِ مَمْلَكَتِكَ، وَالْعائِدُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِتَحَنُّنِ رَاْفَتِكَ، الهى رَبَّيْتَنى فى نِعَمِكَ وَاحْسانِكَ صَغيراً، وَنَوَّهْتَ بِاسْمى كَبيراً، فَيا مَنْ رَبَّانى فِى الدُّنْيا بِاحْسانِهِ وَتَفَضُّلِهِ وَنِعَمِهِ، وَاشارَ لى فِى الْأخِرَةِ الى عَفْوِهِ وَكَرَمِهِ، مَعْرِفَتى يا مَوْلاىَ دَليلى عَلَيْكَ، وَحُبّى لَكَ شَفيعى الَيْكَ، وَانَا واثِقٌ مِنْ دَليلى بِدَلالَتِكَ، وَساكِنٌ مِنْ شَفيعى الى شَفاعَتِكَ، ادْعُوكَ يا سَيِّدى بِلِسانٍ قَدْ اخْرَسَهُ ذَنْبُهُ، رَبِّ اناجيكَ بِقَلْبٍ قَدْ اوْبَقَهُ جُرْمُهُ، ادْعُوكَ يا رَبِّ راهِباً راغِباً راجِياً خآئِفاً، اذا رَايْتُ مَوْلاىَ ذُنُوبى فَزِعْتُ، وَاذا رَايْتُ كَرَمَكَ طَمِعْتُ، فَانْ عَفَوْتَ فَخَيْرُ راحِمٍ، وَانْ عَذَّبْتَ فَغَيْرُ ظالِمٍ، حُجَّتى يا اللَّهُ فى جُرْاتى عَلى مَسْئَلَتِكَ مَعَ اتْيانى ما تَكْرَهُ،
items.english: And all praise is due to Allah, Who is so forbearing toward me that it is as if I have no sin; so my Lord is the most praiseworthy of all things to me, and the most worthy of my praise. O Allah, I find the paths of requests to You wide open, and the watering-places of hope in You brimming, and seeking assistance through Your favor for whoever hopes in You freely available, and the gates of supplication to You for those who cry out open. I know that You are in a position of response for the one who hopes, and in a place of rescue for the distressed, and that in yearning for Your generosity and being pleased with Your decree there is a substitute for the withholding of the miserly, and a sufficiency from what is in the hands of the selfish. The traveler toward You has a short distance to cover, and You are not veiled from Your creation except that their deeds veil them from You. I have turned toward You with my request, and directed myself toward You with my need, and made my plea for help to You, and my seeking of means through Your supplication, without deserving that You listen to me, nor meriting Your pardon of me, but rather because of my trust in Your nobility, my reliance upon the truth of Your promise, my resorting to faith in Your Oneness, and my certainty [and trust] in my knowledge of You that I have no lord other than You, and there is no god but You, alone without any partner. O Allah, You have said—and Your word is true and Your promise is sincere: “And ask Allah of His favor; indeed, Allah is ever, to you, Merciful.” It is not of Your attributes, my Master, that You should command asking and then withhold the gift, for You are the Bestower of gifts upon the inhabitants of Your kingdom, and the One who returns to them with the affection of Your compassion. My Allah, You raised me in Your blessings and Your favor when I was small, and You made my name known when I grew older. So, O One Who raised me in this world with His favor, His grace, and His blessings, and pointed me toward His pardon and His nobility in the Hereafter; my knowledge of You, O my Master, is my guide to You, and my love for You is my intercessor before You, and I am confident in my guide because of Your guidance, and I am at ease with my intercessor because of Your intercession. I call upon You, my Master, with a tongue that has been silenced by its sin; my Lord, I converse with You with a heart that has been destroyed by its crime. I call upon You, O Lord, in awe, in longing, in hope, and in fear. When I see my sins, O my Master, I am terrified, and when I see Your nobility, I am filled with hope. So if You pardon, then You are the best of those who show mercy; and if You punish, then You are not being unjust. My plea, O Allah, in my audacity to ask You despite my committing what You dislike...
items.transliteration: Wa-al-hamdu lillahi alladhi yahlumu 'anni hatta ka'anni la dhanba li, fa-Rabbi ahmadu shay'in 'indi wa-ahaqqu bi-hamdi. Allahumma inni ajidu subula al-matalibi ilayka mushra'atan, wa-manahila al-raja'i ilayka mutra'atan, wa-al-isti'anata bi-fadlika liman ammalaka mubahatan, wa-abwaba al-du'a'i ilayka lil-sarikhina maftuhatan, wa-a'lamu annaka lil-raji bi-mawdi'i ijabatin, wa-lil-malhufina bi-marsadi ighathatin, wa-anna fi al-lahfi ila judika, wa-al-rida bi-qada'ika 'iwadan min man'i al-bakhilina, wa-manduthatan 'amma fi aydi al-musta'thirina, wa-anna al-rahila ilayka qaribu al-masafati, wa-annaka la tahtajibu 'an khalqika illa an tahjubahumu al-a'malu dunaka, wa-qad qasadtu ilayka bi-talibati wa-tawajjahtu ilayka bi-hajati wa-ja'altu bika istighathati wa-bi-du'a'ika tawassuli min ghayri istihqaqin li-stima'ika minni wa-la istijabin li-'afwika 'anni bal li-thiqati bi-karamika, wa-sukuni ila sidqi wa'dika, wa-laja'i ila al-imani bi-tawhidika, wa-yaqini [wa-thiqati] bi-ma'rifatika minni an la rabba li ghayruka, wa-la ilaha illa anta, wahdaka la sharika laka, Allahumma anta al-qa'ilu wa-qawluka haqqun, wa-wa'duka sidqun: wa-as'alu Allaha min fadlihi inna Allaha kana bikum rahiman. Wa-laysa min sifatika ya sayyidi an tamura bi-al-su'ali wa-tamna'a al-'atiyyata, wa-anta al-mannanu bi-al-'atiyyati 'ala ahli mamlakatika, wa-al-'a'idu 'alayhim bi-tahannuni ra'fatika, Ilahi rabbaytani fi ni'amika wa-ihsanika saghiran, wa-nawwahta bi-ismi kabiran, fa-ya man rabbani fi al-dunya bi-ihsanihi wa-tafaddulihi wa-ni'amihi, wa-ashara li fi al-akhirati ila 'afwihi wa-karamihi, ma'rifati ya Mawlaya dalili 'alayka, wa-hubbi laka shafi'i ilayka, wa-ana wathiqun min dalili bi-dalalatika, wa-sakinun min shafi'i ila shafa'atika, ad'uka ya sayyidi bi-lisanin qad akhrasahu dhanbuhu, Rabbi unajika bi-qalbin qad awbaqahu jurmuhu, ad'uka ya Rabbi rahiban raghiban rajiyan kha'ifan, idha ra'aytu Mawlaya dhunubi fazi'tu, wa-idha ra'aytu karamaka tami'tu, fa-in 'afawta fa-khayru rahimin, wa-in 'adhdhabta fa-ghayru zalimin, hujjati ya Allahu fi jur'ati 'ala mas'alatika ma'a ityani ma takrahu,

items.arabic: جُودُكَ وَكَرَمُكَ، وَعُدَّتى فى شِدَّتى مَعَ قِلَّةِ حَيائى رَاْفَتُكَ وَرَحْمَتُكَ، وَقَدْ رَجَوْتُ انْ لا تَخيبَ بَيْنَ ذَيْنِ وَذَيْنِ مُنْيَتى فَحَقِّقْ رَجآئى وَاسْمَعْ دُعآئى يا خَيْرَ مَنْ دَعاهُ داعٍ، وَافْضَلَ مَنْ رَجاهُ راجٍ، عَظُمَ يا سَيِّدى امَلى وَسآءَ عَمَلى فَاعْطِنى مِنْ عَفْوِكَ بِمِقْدارِ امَلى وَلا تُؤاخِذْنى بِاسْوَءِ عَمَلى فَانَّ كَرَمَكَ يَجِلُّ عَنْ مُجازاةِ الْمُذْنِبينَ، وَحِلْمَكَ يَكْبُرُ عَنْ مُكافاةِ الْمُقَصِّرينَ، وَا نَا ياسَيِّدى عائِذٌ بِفَضْلِكَ، هارِبٌ مِنْكَ الَيْكَ، مُتَنَجِّزٌ ما وَعَدْتَ مِنَ الصَّفْحِ عَمَّنْ احْسَنَ بِكَ ظَنّاً، وَما ا نَا يا رَبِّ وَما خَطَرى هَبْنى بِفَضْلِكَ، وَتَصَدَّقْ عَلَىَّ بِعَفْوِكَ، اىْ رَبِّ جَلِّلْنى بِسَتْرِكَ، وَاعْفُ عَنْ تَوْبيخى بِكَرَمِ وَجْهِكَ، فَلَوِ اطَّلَعَ الْيَوْمَ عَلى ذَنْبى غَيْرُكَ ما فَعَلْتُهُ، وَلَوْ خِفْتُ تَعْجيلَ الْعُقُوبَةِ لَاجْتَنَبْتُهُ، لا لِأَنَّكَ اهْوَنُ النَّاظِرينَ، وَاخَفُّ الْمُطَّلِعينَ [عَلَىَ ، بَلْ لِأَنَّكَ يارَبِّ خَيْرُ السَّاتِرينَ، وَاحْكَمُ الْحاكِمينَ، وَاكْرَمُ الْأَكْرَمينَ، سَتَّارُ الْعُيُوبِ، غَفَّارُ الذُّنُوبِ، عَلّامُ الْغُيُوبِ، تَسْتُرُ الذَّنْبَ بِكَرَمِكَ، وَتُؤَخِّرُ الْعُقُوبَةَ بِحِلْمِكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ عَلى حِلْمِكَ بَعْدَ عِلْمِكَ، وَعَلى عَفْوِكَ بَعْدَ قُدْرَتِكَ، وَيَحْمِلُنى وَيُجَرِّئُنى عَلى مَعْصِيَتِكَ حِلْمُكَ عَنّى وَيَدْعُونى الى قِلَّةِ الْحَيآءِ سِتْرُكَ عَلَىَّ، وَيُسْرِعُنى الَى التَّوَثُّبِ عَلى مَحارِمِكَ مَعْرِفَتى بِسَعَةِ رَحْمَتِكَ، وَعَظيمِ عَفْوِكَ، يا حَليمُ يا كَريمُ، يا حَىُّ يا قَيُّومُ، يا غافِرَ الذَّنْبِ، يا قابِلَ التَّوْبِ، يا عَظيمَ الْمَنِّ، يا قَديمَ الْإِحسانِ، ايْنَ سَتْرُكَ الْجَميلُ، ايْنَ عَفْوُكَ الْجَليلُ، ايْنَ فَرَجُكَ الْقَريبُ، ايْنَ غِياثُكَ السَّريعُ، ايْنَ رَحْمَتُكَ الْواسِعَةُ، ايْنَ عَطاياكَ الْفاضِلَةُ، ايْنَ مَواهِبُكَ الْهَنيئَةُ، ايْنَ صَنائِعُكَ السَّنِيَّةُ، ايْنَ فَضْلُكَ الْعَظيمُ، ايْنَ مَنُّكَ الْجَسيمُ، ايْنَ احْسانُكَ الْقَديمُ، ايْنَ كَرَمُكَ يا كَريمُ، بِهِ وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ فَاسْتَنْقِذْنى وَبِرَحْمَتِكَ فَخَلِّصْنى يا مُحْسِنُ يا مُجْمِلُ، يا مُنْعِمُ يا مُفْضِلُ، لَسْتُ
items.english: Your liberality and Your generosity; and my provision in my hardship, despite my lack of shame, is Your compassion and Your mercy. I have hoped that my wish would not be disappointed between these two; so fulfill my hope and hear my prayer, O Best of those whom a caller calls, and most Excellent of those in whom a hoper hopes! My hope, O my Master, has grown great, while my deeds are evil; so grant me of Your pardon in measure with my hope, and do not take me to task for the worst of my deeds. For Your generosity is too sublime to penalize the sinners, and Your forbearance is too great to requite those who fall short. And I, O my Master, am seeking refuge in Your grace, fleeing from You to You, seeking the fulfillment of what You have promised of forgiveness for one who holds a good opinion of You. What am I, O Lord, and what is my worth? Grant me [salvation] by Your grace, and bestow charity upon me with Your pardon. O Lord, cover me with Your veil, and excuse me from my reprimand by the generosity of Your Countenance. For if any other than You were to see my sin today, I would not have committed it; and had I feared the haste of punishment, I would have avoided it—not because You are the least of those who look on, or the most insignificant of those who observe, but because You, O Lord, are the Best of those who veil sins, and the Wisest of judges, and the Most Generous of the generous; the Concealer of faults, the Forgiver of sins, the Knower of the unseen. You veil the sin by Your generosity, and delay the punishment by Your forbearance. To You belongs praise for Your forbearance despite Your knowledge, and for Your pardon despite Your power. It is Your forbearance toward me that emboldens me to disobey You, and it is Your veiling of me that invites me to a lack of shame. It is my knowledge of the vastness of Your mercy and the greatness of Your pardon that hastens me to transgress Your prohibitions. O Forbearing, O Generous, O Ever-Living, O Self-Subsisting, O Forgiver of sin, O Accepter of repentance, O Great in favor, O Eternal in benevolence! Where is Your beautiful veiling? Where is Your magnificent pardon? Where is Your near relief? Where is Your swift aid? Where is Your vast mercy? Where is Your superior gifts? Where is Your pleasant endowments? Where is Your sublime favors? Where is Your great grace? Where is Your immense favor? Where is Your eternal benevolence? Where is Your generosity, O Generous One? By it, and by Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, rescue me! And by Your mercy, deliver me! O Benefactor, O Beautifier, O Bestower of blessings, O Giver of grace! I am not
items.transliteration: Juduka wa-karamuka, wa-'uddati fi shiddati ma'a qillati haya'i ra'fatuka wa-rahmatuka, wa-qad rajawtu an la takhiba bayna dhayni wa-dhayni munyati, fa-haqqiq raja'i wa-isma' du'a'i ya khayra man da'ahu da'in, wa-afdala man rajahu rajin, 'azuma ya sayyidi amali wa-sa'a 'amali fa-a'tini min 'afwika bi-miqdari amali wa-la tu'akhidhni bi-aswa'i 'amali fa-inna karamaka yajillu 'an mujazati al-mudhnibina, wa-hilmaka yakburu 'an mukafati al-muqassirina, wa-ana ya sayyidi 'a'idhun bi-fadlika, haribun minka ilayka, mutanajjizun ma wa'adta mina al-safhi 'amman ahsana bika zannan, wa-ma ana ya Rabbi wa-ma khatari habni bi-fadlika, wa-tasaddaq 'alayya bi-'afwika, ay Rabbi jallilni bi-sitrika, wa-a'fu 'an tawbikhi bi-karami wajhika, fa-law ittala'a al-yawma 'ala dhanbi ghayruka ma fa'altuhu, wa-law khiftu ta'jila al-'uqubati la-ajtanabtuhu, la li-annaka ahwanu al-nazirina, wa-akhaffu al-muttali'ina, bal li-annaka ya Rabbi khayru al-satirina, wa-ahkamu al-hakimina, wa-akramu al-akramina, sattaru al-'uyubi, ghaffaru al-dhunubi, 'allamu al-ghuyubi, tasturu al-dhanba bi-karamika, wa-tu'akhkhiru al-'uqubata bi-hilmika, fa-laka al-hamdu 'ala hilmika ba'da 'ilmika, wa-'ala 'afwika ba'da qudratika, wa-yahmiluni wa-yujarri'uni 'ala ma'siyatika hilmuka 'anni wa-yad'uni ila qillati al-haya'i sitruka 'alayya, wa-yusri'uni ila al-tawaththubi 'ala maharimika ma'rifati bi-sa'ati rahmatika, wa-'azimi 'afwika, ya Halimu ya Karimu, ya Hayyu ya Qayyumu, ya Ghafira al-dhanbi, ya Qabila al-tawbi, ya 'Azima al-manni, ya Qadima al-ihsani, ayna sitruka al-jamilu, ayna 'afwuka al-jalilu, ayna farajuka al-qaribu, ayna ghiyathuka al-sari'u, ayna rahmatuka al-wasi'atu, ayna 'atayaka al-fadilatu, ayna mawahibuka al-hani'atu, ayna sana'i'uka al-saniyyatu, ayna fadluka al-'azimu, ayna mannuka al-jasimu, ayna ihsanuka al-qadimu, ayna karamuka ya Karimu, bihi wa-bi-Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin fa-istanqidhni wa-bi-rahmatika fa-khallisni ya Muhsinu ya Mujmilu, ya Mun'imu ya Mufdilu, lastu

الْإِحسانِ، ايْنَ سَتْرُكَ الْجَميلُ، ايْنَ عَفْوُكَ الْجَليلُ، ايْنَ فَرَجُكَ الْقَريبُ، ايْنَ غِياثُكَ السَّريعُ، ايْنَ رَحْمَتُكَ الْواسِعَةُ، ايْنَ عَطاياكَ الْفاضِلَةُ، ايْنَ مَواهِبُكَ الْهَنيئَةُ، ايْنَ صَنائِعُكَ السَّنِيَّةُ، ايْنَ فَضْلُكَ الْعَظيمُ، ايْنَ مَنُّكَ الْجَسيمُ، ايْنَ احْسانُكَ الْقَديمُ، ايْنَ كَرَمُكَ يا كَريمُ، بِهِ وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ فَاسْتَنْقِذْنى وَبِرَحْمَتِكَ فَخَلِّصْنى يا مُحْسِنُ يا مُجْمِلُ، يا مُنْعِمُ يا مُفْضِلُ، لَسْتُ
items.english: Your liberality and Your generosity; and my provision in my hardship, despite my lack of shame, is Your compassion and Your mercy. I have hoped that my wish would not be disappointed between these two; so fulfill my hope and hear my prayer, O Best of those whom a caller calls, and most Excellent of those in whom a hoper hopes. My hope, O my Master, is great, but my deed is evil; so grant me of Your forgiveness in proportion to my hope, and do not punish me for the worst of my deeds. For Your generosity is too great to requite the sinners, and Your forbearance is too immense to punish those who fall short. And I, my Master, am seeking refuge in Your grace, fleeing from You to You, seeking the fulfillment of what You have promised of pardon for the one who has a good opinion of You. And who am I, O Lord, and what is my significance? Grant me [pardon] by Your grace, and bestow upon me Your forgiveness as charity. O Lord, cover me with Your veil, and overlook my rebuke by the generosity of Your Face. For had anyone other than You seen my sin today, I would not have committed it; and had I feared the hastening of punishment, I would have avoided it. Not because You are the least of those who look, or the most insignificant of those who observe, but because You, O Lord, are the Best of those who veil, the Most Just of judges, and the Most Generous of the generous; the Veiler of faults, the Forgiver of sins, the Knower of the unseen. You veil the sin by Your generosity, and You delay the punishment by Your forbearance. So all praise is due to You for Your forbearance despite Your knowledge, and for Your forgiveness despite Your power. And what carries me and emboldens me to disobey You is Your forbearance toward me, and what calls me to a lack of shame is Your veiling of me, and what hastens me to leap into Your prohibitions is my knowledge of the vastness of Your mercy and the greatness of Your forgiveness. O Forbearing, O Generous, O Ever-Living, O Self-Subsisting, O Forgiver of sin, O Accepter of repentance, O Great in bestowal, O Eternal in beneficence. Where is Your beautiful veil? Where is Your majestic forgiveness? Where is Your near relief? Where is Your swift aid? Where is Your vast mercy? Where are Your excellent gifts? Where are Your pleasant endowments? Where are Your magnificent favors? Where is Your great grace? Where is Your immense bestowal? Where is Your eternal beneficence? Where is Your generosity, O Generous One? By it, and by Muhammad and the progeny of Muhammad, rescue me, and by Your mercy, deliver me, O Beneficent, O Beautifier, O Bestower of blessings, O Gracious. I am not...
items.transliteration: Juduka wa-karamuka, wa-'uddati fi shiddati ma'a qillati haya'i ra'fatuka wa-rahmatuka, wa-qad rajawtu an la takhiba bayna dhayni wa-dhayni munyati, fa-haqqiq raja'i wa-isma' du'a'i ya khayra man da'ahu da'in, wa-afdala man rajahu rajin, 'azuma ya sayyidi amali wa-sa'a 'amali fa-a'tini min 'afwika bi-miqdari amali wa-la tu'akhidhni bi-aswa'i 'amali fa-inna karamaka yajillu 'an mujazati al-mudhnibina, wa-hilmaka yakburu 'an mukafati al-muqassirina, wa-ana ya sayyidi 'a'idhun bi-fadlika, haribun minka ilayka, mutanajjizun ma wa'adta min al-safhi 'amman ahsana bika zannan, wa-ma ana ya Rabbi wa-ma khatari habni bi-fadlika, wa-tasaddaq 'alayya bi-'afwika, ay Rabbi jallilni bi-satrika, wa-'fu 'an tawbikhi bi-karami wajhika, fa-law ittala'a al-yawma 'ala dhanbi ghayruka ma fa'altuhu, wa-law khiftu ta'jila al-'uqubati la-ajtanabtuhu, la li-annaka ahwanu al-nazirina, wa-akhaffu al-muttali'ina 'alayya, bal li-annaka ya Rabbi khayru al-satirina, wa-ahkamu al-hakimina, wa-akramu al-akramina, sattaru al-'uyubi, ghaffaru al-dhunubi, 'allamu al-ghuyubi, tasturu al-dhanba bi-karamika, wa-tu'akhkhiru al-'uqubata bi-hilmika, fa-laka al-hamdu 'ala hilmika ba'da 'ilmika, wa-'ala 'afwika ba'da qudratika, wa-yahmiluni wa-yujarri'uni 'ala ma'siyatika hilmuka 'anni wa-yad'uni ila qillati al-haya'i sitruka 'alayya, wa-yusri'uni ila al-tawaththubi 'ala maharimika ma'rifati bi-sa'ati rahmatika, wa-'azimi 'afwika, ya Halimu ya Karimu, ya Hayyu ya Qayyumu, ya Ghafira al-dhanbi, ya Qabila al-tawbi, ya 'Azima al-manni, ya Qadima al-ihsani, ayna sitruka al-jamilu, ayna 'afwuka al-jalilu, ayna farajuka al-qaribu, ayna ghiyathuka al-sari'u, ayna rahmatuka al-wasi'atu, ayna 'atayaka al-fadilatu, ayna mawahibuka al-hani'atu, ayna sana'i'uka al-sanniyyatu, ayna fadluka al-'azimu, ayna mannuka al-jasimu, ayna ihsanuka al-qadimu, ayna karamuka ya Karimu, bi-hi wa-bi-Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin fa-istanqidhni wa-bi-rahmatika fa-khallisni ya Muhsinu ya Mujmilu, ya Mun'imu ya Mufdilu, lastu
