items.transliteration: al-Hamdu wa-Ya-Sin wa-al-Mulka wa-al-Tawhida.

items.arabic: 3. الصلاة مائة ركعة يقرأ في كلّ ركعة بعد
items.english: 3. To pray one hundred rak‘ahs, reciting in each rak‘ah after
items.transliteration: 3. al-Salatu mi'atu rak'atin yuqra'u fi kulli rak'atin ba'da

items.arabic: الحَمْد التّوحيد
items.english: al-Hamd and al-Tawhid
items.transliteration: al-Hamdi al-Tawhidi.

items.arabic: عشر مرّات. عن أميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام عن رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: ten times. From the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, from the Messenger of Allah, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny: “
items.transliteration: 'ashra marratin. 'an Amiri al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salamu 'an Rasuli Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi:

items.arabic: مَنْ صَلّى لَيْلَةُ النِّصْفِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ مَائَةَ رَكْعَةً، يَقْرَأُ فِي كُلِّ رَكْعَةٍ الحَمْدُ و (قُلْ هُو اللَّهُ أحَد) عَشْرَ مَرّاتٍ، أهْبَطَ اللَّهُ إلَيهِ عَشَرَةَ أمْلاكٍ يَدْرَؤُونَ عَنْهُ أعداءَهُ مِنَ الجِنِّ والإنْسِ، وأهْبَطَ اللَّهُ عِنْدَ مَوْتِه ثَلاثِينَ يُبَشِّرونَهُ بالجَنَّةِ، وثَلاثِينَ مَلَكاً يُؤمِنُونَهُ مِن النّارِ» .
items.english: Whoever prays one hundred rak‘ahs on the night of the middle of the month of Ramadan, reciting in each rak‘ah al-Hamd and “Say: He is Allah, the One” ten times, Allah shall send down ten angels to him who ward off from him his enemies among the jinn and mankind; and at his death, Allah shall send down thirty who give him glad tidings of Paradise, and thirty angels who grant him security from the Fire.”
items.transliteration: Man salla laylata al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana mi'ata rak'atin, yaqra'u fi kulli rak'atin al-Hamdu wa-(Qul huwa Allahu ahad) 'ashra marratin, ahbata Allahu ilayhi 'asharata amlakin yadra'una 'anhu a'da'ahu mina al-jinni wa-al-insi, wa-ahbata Allahu 'inda mawtihi thalathina yubashshirunahu bi-al-jannati, wa-thalathina malakan yu'minunahu mina al-nari.

items.arabic: 4. زيارة الحسين عليه السلام عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام قيل له: ما ترى لمن حضر قبر الحسين عليه السلام ليلة النصف من شهر رمضان؟ فقال عليه السلام: «
items.english: 4. The Ziyarah of Husayn, peace be upon him. From Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, it was said to him: “What is your view regarding the one who is present at the grave of Husayn, peace be upon him, on the night of the middle of the month of Ramadan?” He, peace be upon him, said: “
items.transliteration: 4. Ziyaratu al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salamu qila lahu: ma tara li-man hadara qabra al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu laylata al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana? fa-qala 'alayhi al-salamu: «

items.arabic: بَخٍ بَخٍ مَنْ صَلّى عِنْدَ قَبْرِه لَيْلَةَ النِّصْفِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ عَشْرَ رَكَعاتٍ مِنْ بَعْدِ العِشَاءِ يَقْرَأُ فِي كُلِّ رَكْعَةٍ فاتِحَةَ الكِتابِ وقُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أحَدٌ عَشْرَ مَرّاتٍ واسْتَجارَ باللَّهِ مِنَ النّارِ كَتَبَهُ اللَّهُ عَتِيقاً مِنَ النّارِ وَلَمْ يَمُتْ حَتّى يَرَى فِي مَنَامِهِ مَلائِكَةً يُبَشِّرونَهُ بالجَنَّةِ ومَلائِكةً يُؤمِنُونَهُ مِن النّارِ» .
items.english: “How wonderful, how wonderful! Whoever prays ten rak‘ahs at his grave on the night of the middle of the month of Ramadan after the ‘Isha prayer, reciting in each rak‘ah Fatihat al-Kitab and ‘Say: He is Allah, the One’ ten times, and seeks refuge in Allah from the Fire, Allah shall record him as one emancipated from the Fire; and he shall not die until he sees in his sleep angels giving him glad tidings of Paradise and angels granting him security from the Fire.”
items.transliteration: Bakhin bakhin man salla 'inda qabrihi laylata al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana 'ashra rak'atin min ba'di al-'isha'i yaqra'u fi kulli rak'atin Fatihata al-Kitabi wa-(Qul huwa Allahu ahadun) 'ashra marratin wa-istajara bi-Allahi mina al-nari katabahu Allahu 'atiqan mina al-nari wa-lam yamut hatta yara fi manamihi mala'ikatan yubashshirunahu bi-al-jannati wa-mala'ikatan yu'minunahu mina al-nari.

items.arabic: چ چ-
items.english: ...etc.
items.transliteration: ila akhirihi

items.arabic: يوم النّصف من شهر رمضان:
items.english: The day of the middle of the month of Ramadan:
items.transliteration: Yawmu al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana:

items.arabic: وفيه كانت في السنة الثانية من الهجرة ولادة الإمام المجتبى عليه السلام وفيه أيضاً على بعض الأقوال ولادة الإمام محمّد الجواد عليه السلام سنة 195 ولكنّ
items.english: On this day, in the second year of the Hijrah, was the birth of Imam al-Mujtaba, peace be upon him. On it also, according to some reports, was the birth of Imam Muhammad al-Jawad, peace be upon him, in the year 195; however...
items.transliteration: Wa-fihi kanat fi al-sunnati al-thaniyati mina al-hijrati wiladatu al-Imami al-Mujtaba 'alayhi al-salamu wa-fihi aydan 'ala ba'di al-aqwali wiladatu al-Imami Muhammadin al-Jawadi 'alayhi al-salamu sanata 195 wa-lakinna.

items.arabic: عشر مرّات. عن أميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام عن رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: ten times. From the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, from the Messenger of Allah, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny: “
items.transliteration: 'ashra marratin. 'an Amiri al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salamu 'an Rasuli Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi:

items.arabic: مَنْ صَلّى لَيْلَةُ النِّصْفِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ مَائَةَ رَكْعَةً، يَقْرَأُ فِي كُلِّ رَكْعَةٍ الحَمْدُ و (قُلْ هُو اللَّهُ أحَد) عَشْرَ مَرّاتٍ، أهْبَطَ اللَّهُ إلَيهِ عَشَرَةَ أمْلاكٍ يَدْرَؤُونَ عَنْهُ أعداءَهُ مِنَ الجِنِّ والإنْسِ، وأهْبَطَ اللَّهُ عِنْدَ مَوْتِه ثَلاثِينَ يُبَشِّرونَهُ بالجَنَّةِ، وثَلاثِينَ مَلَكاً يُؤمِنُونَهُ مِن النّارِ» .
items.english: Whoever prays one hundred rak‘ahs on the night of the middle of the month of Ramadan, reciting in each rak‘ah al-Hamd and “Say: He is Allah, the One” ten times, Allah shall send down ten angels to him who ward off from him his enemies among the jinn and mankind; and at his death, Allah shall send down thirty who give him glad tidings of Paradise, and thirty angels who grant him security from the Fire.”
items.transliteration: Man salla laylata al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana mi'ata rak'atin, yaqra'u fi kulli rak'atin al-Hamdu wa-(Qul huwa Allahu ahad) 'ashra marratin, ahbata Allahu ilayhi 'asharata amlakin yadra'una 'anhu a'da'ahu mina al-jinni wa-al-insi, wa-ahbata Allahu 'inda mawtihi thalathina yubashshirunahu bi-al-jannati, wa-thalathina malakan yu'minunahu mina al-nari.

items.arabic: 4. زيارة الحسين عليه السلام عن الإمام الصادق عليه السلام قيل له: ما ترى لمن حضر قبر الحسين عليه السلام ليلة النصف من شهر رمضان؟ فقال عليه السلام: «
items.english: 4. The Ziyarah of Husayn, peace be upon him. From Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, it was said to him: “What is your view regarding the one who is present at the grave of Husayn, peace be upon him, on the night of the middle of the month of Ramadan?” He, peace be upon him, said: “
items.transliteration: 4. Ziyaratu al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu 'an al-Imami al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salamu qila lahu: ma tara li-man hadara qabra al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu laylata al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana? fa-qala 'alayhi al-salamu: "

items.arabic: بَخٍ بَخٍ مَنْ صَلّى عِنْدَ قَبْرِه لَيْلَةَ النِّصْفِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ عَشْرَ رَكَعاتٍ مِنْ بَعْدِ العِشَاءِ يَقْرَأُ فِي كُلِّ رَكْعَةٍ فاتِحَةَ الكِتابِ وقُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أحَدٌ عَشْرَ مَرّاتٍ واسْتَجارَ باللَّهِ مِنَ النّارِ كَتَبَهُ اللَّهُ عَتِيقاً مِنَ النّارِ وَلَمْ يَمُتْ حَتّى يَرَى فِي مَنَامِهِ مَلائِكَةً يُبَشِّرونَهُ بالجَنَّةِ ومَلائِكةً يُؤمِنُونَهُ مِن النّارِ» .
items.english: “How wonderful, how wonderful! Whoever prays ten rak‘ahs at his grave on the night of the middle of the month of Ramadan after the ‘Isha prayer, reciting in each rak‘ah Fatihat al-Kitab and ‘Say: He is Allah, the One’ ten times, and seeks refuge in Allah from the Fire, Allah shall record him as one emancipated from the Fire; and he shall not die until he sees in his sleep angels giving him glad tidings of Paradise and angels granting him security from the Fire.”
items.transliteration: Bakhin bakhin man salla 'inda qabrihi laylata al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana 'ashra rak'atin min ba'di al-'isha'i yaqra'u fi kulli rak'atin Fatihata al-Kitabi wa-(Qul huwa Allahu ahadun) 'ashra marratin wa-stajara bi-Allahi mina al-nari katabahu Allahu 'atiqan mina al-nari wa-lam yamut hatta yara fi manamihi mala'ikatan yubashshirunahu bi-al-jannati wa-mala'ikatan yu'minunahu mina al-nari.

items.arabic: چ چ-
items.english: ...etc.
items.transliteration: ila akhirihi

items.arabic: يوم النّصف من شهر رمضان:
items.english: The day of the middle of the month of Ramadan:
items.transliteration: Yawmu al-nisfi min shahri Ramadana:

items.arabic: وفيه كانت في السنة الثانية من الهجرة ولادة الإمام المجتبى عليه السلام وفيه أيضاً على بعض الأقوال ولادة الإمام محمّد الجواد عليه السلام سنة 195 ولكنّ
items.english: On this day, in the second year of the Hijrah, was the birth of Imam al-Mujtaba, peace be upon him. On it also, according to some reports, was the birth of Imam Muhammad al-Jawad, peace be upon him, in the year 195; however...
items.transliteration: Wa-fihi kanat fi al-sunnati al-thaniyati mina al-hijrati wiladatu al-Imami al-Mujtaba 'alayhi al-salamu wa-fihi aydan 'ala ba'di al-aqwali wiladatu al-Imami Muhammadin al-Jawadi 'alayhi al-salamu sanata 195 wa-lakinna.

footnote_refs.title: منتهى الآمال: حياة الإمام الحسن عليه السلام( يعتقد البعض أن ولادته كانت في السنة الثانية).

items.arabic: المشهور خلاف ذلك . وعلى كلّ حال فإنّ هذا اليوم يوم شريف جدّاً وللصّدقة والبرّ فيه فضل كثير.
items.english: the well-known opinion is contrary to that. In any case, this day is an exceedingly noble day, and for charity and benevolence in it there is great merit.
items.transliteration: al-mashhuru khilafu dhalika. wa-'ala kulli halin fa-inna hadha al-yawma yawmun sharifun jiddan wa-li-al-sadaqati wa-al-birri fihi fadlun kathirun.

footnote_refs.title: منتهى الآمال: حياة الإمام محمّد الجواد عليه السلام.

items.arabic: الليلة السابعة عشرة:
items.english: The seventeenth night:
items.transliteration: al-Laylatu al-sabi'ata 'ashrata:

items.arabic: ليلة مباركة جدّاً، وفيها تقابل الجيشان في بدر، جيش رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله وجيش كفّار قريش، وفي يومها كانت غزوة بدر، ونصر اللَّه جيش المسلمين على المشركين رغم قلّة المسلمين وقلّة عدّتهم، فكان ذلك أعظم فتوح الإسلام، ولذلك قال علماؤنا: يستحبّ الإكثار من الصدقة والشكر في هذا اليوم، وللغسل والعبادة في ليله فضل عظيم .
items.english: It is an exceedingly blessed night, and on it the two armies met at Badr: the army of the Messenger of Allah, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, and the army of the disbelievers of Quraysh. On its day was the Battle of Badr, and Allah granted victory to the army of the Muslims over the polytheists despite the small number of Muslims and the paucity of their equipment; thus, it was the greatest of the conquests of Islam. For this reason, our scholars have said: It is recommended to give much in charity and gratitude on this day, and for ghusl and worship on its night there is great merit.
items.transliteration: Laylatun mubarakatun jiddan, wa-fiha taqabala al-jayshani fi Badrin, jayshu Rasuli Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi wa-jayshu kuffari Qurayshin, wa-fi yawmiha kanat ghazwatu Badrin, wa-nasara Allahu jaysha al-muslimina 'ala al-mushrikina raghma qillati al-muslimina wa-qillati 'iddatihim, fa-kana dhalika a'zama futuhi al-Islami, wa-li-dhalika qala 'ulama'una: yustahabbu al-iktharu mina al-sadaqati wa-al-shukri fi hadha al-yawmi, wa-li-al-ghusli wa-al-'ibadati fi laylihi fadlun 'azimun.

items.arabic: جاء في العديد من الروايات أنّ النّبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله قال لأصحابه ليلة بدر: «
items.english: It is mentioned in numerous narrations that the Prophet, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, said to his companions on the night of Badr: “
items.transliteration: Ja'a fi al-'adidi mina al-riwayati anna al-Nabiyya salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi qala li-ashabihi laylata Badrin: «

items.arabic: مَنْ مِنْكُمْ يَمْضِي هذِه اللّيلَة إلى البِئْرِ فَيَسْقِي لنا
items.english: “Who among you will go this night to the well and bring us water?”
items.transliteration: Man minkum yamdi hadhihi al-laylata ila al-bi'ri fa-yasqi lana

items.arabic: ؟» فصمتوا ولم يقدم منهم أحد على ذلك (فقد كان عملًا خطيراً) فنهض عليّ عليه السلام وانطلق يبغي الماء، وكانت ليلة ظلماء باردة ذات رياح حتّى ورد البئر وكان عميقاً مظلماً فلم يجد دلواً يستقي به فنزل في البئر وملأ القربة فارتقى وأخذ في الرجوع، فعصفت عليه عاصفة جلس على الأرض لشدّتها حتّى سكنت، فنهض واستأنف المسير وإذا بعاصفة كالاولى تعترض طريقه فتجلسه على الأرض، فلما هدأت قام يواصل مسيره وإذا بعاصفة ثالثة تعصف عليه فجلس على الأرض، فلمّا زالت عنه قام وسلك طريقه حتّى بلغ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه و آله فسأله النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه و آله فقال: «
items.english: ?” But they remained silent, and not one of them ventured to do that (for it was a dangerous task). Then Ali, peace be upon him, stood up and set out seeking water. It was a dark, cold night with winds, until he reached the well, and it was deep and dark. He did not find a bucket to draw water with, so he descended into the well, filled the water-skin, climbed out, and began to return. Then a gale blew against him, and he sat on the ground due to its intensity until it subsided. Then he stood up and resumed the journey, when suddenly a gale like the first one obstructed his path, forcing him to sit on the ground. When it calmed down, he rose to continue his path, when suddenly a third gale blew against him, so he sat on the ground. When it passed from him, he stood up and followed his way until he reached the Prophet, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny. Then the Prophet, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, asked him, saying: “
items.transliteration: ?» fa-samatu wa-lam yuqdim minhum ahadun 'ala dhalika (fa-qad kana 'amalan khatiran) fa-nahada 'Aliyyun 'alayhi al-salamu wa-intalaqa yabghi al-ma'a, wa-kanat laylatun zalma'u baridatun dhata riyahin hatta warada al-bi'ra wa-kana 'amiqan muzliman fa-lam yajid dalwan yastaqi bihi fa-nazala fi al-bi'ri wa-mala'a al-qirbata fa-irtaqa wa-akhadha fi al-ruju'i, fa-'asafat 'alayhi 'asifatun jalasa 'ala al-ardi li-shiddatiha hatta sakanat, fa-nahada wa-ista'nafa al-masira wa-idha bi-'asifatin ka-al-ula ta'taridu tariqahu fa-tujlisuhu 'ala al-ardi, fa-lama hada'at qama yuwasilu masirahu wa-idha bi-'asifatin thalithatin ta'sifu 'alayhi fa-jalasa 'ala al-ardi, fa-lama zalat 'anhu qama wa-salaka tariqahu hatta balagha al-Nabiyya salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi fa-sa'alahu al-Nabiyyu salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi fa-qala: «

items.arabic: يا أبَا الحَسَنِ لِمَاذا أبْطَأْتَ؟
items.english: O Abul Hasan, why did you delay?
items.transliteration: Ya Aba al-Hasani limadha abta'ta?

items.arabic: » فأخبره الإمام عليه السلام. فقال صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: ” So the Imam, peace be upon him, informed him. Then he, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, said: “
items.transliteration: » fa-akhbarahu al-Imamu 'alayhi al-salamu. fa-qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: «

items.arabic: وَهَلْ عَلِمْتَ مَا هِيَ تِلْكَ العَواصِف يا عَليّ؟ فقال عليه السلام: لا. فقال صلى الله عليه و آله: كانَتِ العاصِفَةُ الاولى جَبْرَئِيلُ ومَعَهُ ألْفُ مَلَكٍ سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكَ وسَلَّمُوا. والثّانِيةُ كانَتْ مِيكائيلُ وَمَعهُ ألْفُ مَلَكٍ سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكَ وَسَلَّمُوا. والثالِثَةُ إسْرافِيلُ ومَعَهُ ألْفُ مَلَكٍ سَلَّم عَلَيْكَ وسَلَّمُوا وَكُلُّهُم قَد هَبَطوا مَدَداً لنا» .
items.english: “And do you know what those gusts were, O Ali?” He, peace be upon him, said: “No.” Then he, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, said: “The first gust was Jibra’il, and with him were a thousand angels; he greeted you and they greeted you. The second was Mika’il, and with him were a thousand angels; he greeted you and they greeted you. And the third was Israfil, and with him were a thousand angels; he greeted you and they greeted you; and all of them have descended as reinforcement for us.”
items.transliteration: Wa-hal 'alimta ma hiya tilka al-'awasifu ya 'Aliyyu? fa-qala 'alayhi al-salamu: la. fa-qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: kanati al-'asifatu al-ula Jabra'ilu wa-ma'ahu alfu malakin sallama 'alayka wa-sallamu. wa-al-thaniyatu kanat Mika'ilu wa-ma'ahu alfu malakin sallama 'alayka wa-sallamu. wa-al-thalithatu Israfilu wa-ma'ahu alfu malakin sallama 'alayka wa-sallamu wa-kulluhum qad habatu madadan lana.

footnote_refs.title: بحار الأنوار: ج 19، ص 286- / 293 و 316؛ و ج 39، ص 95.

items.arabic: وإلى هذا أشار من قال: أنّه كانت لأميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام ثلاثة آلاف منقبة في ليلة واحدة، حيث سلّم عليه ثلاثة آلاف ملك مع ثلاثة من الملائكة المقرَّبين.
items.english: To this alluded the one who said: that the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, had three thousand merits in a single night, as three thousand angels greeted him along with three of the near-stationed angels.
items.transliteration: Wa-ila hadha ashara man qala: annahu kanat li-Amiri al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salamu thalathatu alafi manqabatin fi laylatin wahidatin, haythu sallama 'alayhi thalathatu alafi malakin ma'a thalathati mina al-mala'ikati al-muqarrabina.

items.arabic: ويشير إليه السيّد الحميري في مدحه له عليه السلام في الشعر:
items.english: And al-Sayyid al-Himyari alludes to this in his praise of him, peace be upon him, in verse:
items.transliteration: Wa-yushiru ilayhi al-Sayyidu al-Himyari fi madhihi lahu 'alayhi al-salamu fi al-shi'ri:

items.title: فضيلة لأميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام ليلة غزوة بدر:

It was a dark, cold night with winds, until he reached the well, and it was deep and dark. When it passed, he stood up and followed his path until he reached the Prophet, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny. Then the Prophet, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, asked him and said: “
items.transliteration: ?» fa-samatu wa-lam yuqdim minhum ahadun 'ala dhalika (fa-qad kana 'amalan khatiran) fa-nahada 'Aliyyun 'alayhi al-salamu wa-intalaqa yabghi al-ma'a, wa-kanat laylatun zalma'u baridatun dhata riyahin hatta warada al-bi'ra wa-kana 'amiqan muzliman fa-lam yajid dalwan yastaqi bihi fa-nazala fi al-bi'ri wa-mala'a al-qirbata fa-irtaqa wa-akhadha fi al-ruju'i, fa-'asafat 'alayhi 'asifatun jalasa 'ala al-ardi li-shiddatiha hatta sakanat, fa-nahada wa-ista'nafa al-masira wa-idha bi-'asifatin ka-al-ula ta'taridu tariqahu fa-tujlisuhu 'ala al-ardi, fa-lamma hada'at qama yuwasilu masirahu wa-idha bi-'asifatin thalithatin ta'sufu 'alayhi fa-jalasa 'ala al-ardi, fa-lamma zalat 'anhu qama wa-salaka tariqahu hatta balagha al-Nabiyya salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi fa-sa'alahu al-Nabiyyu salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi fa-qala: «

items.arabic: يا أبَا الحَسَنِ لِمَاذا أبْطَأْتَ؟
items.english: O Abul Hasan, why did you delay?
items.transliteration: Ya Aba al-Hasani limadha abta'ta?

items.arabic: » فأخبره الإمام عليه السلام. فقال صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: ” So the Imam, peace be upon him, informed him. Then he, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, said: “
items.transliteration: » fa-akhbarahu al-Imamu 'alayhi al-salamu. fa-qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: «

items.arabic: وَهَلْ عَلِمْتَ مَا هِيَ تِلْكَ العَواصِف يا عَليّ؟ فقال عليه السلام: لا. فقال صلى الله عليه و آله: كانَتِ العاصِفَةُ الاولى جَبْرَئِيلُ ومَعَهُ ألْفُ مَلَكٍ سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكَ وسَلَّمُوا. والثّانِيةُ كانَتْ مِيكائيلُ وَمَعهُ ألْفُ مَلَكٍ سَلَّمَ عَلَيْكَ وَسَلَّمُوا. والثالِثَةُ إسْرافِيلُ ومَعَهُ ألْفُ مَلَكٍ سَلَّم عَلَيْكَ وسَلَّمُوا وَكُلُّهُم قَد هَبَطوا مَدَداً لنا» .
items.english: “And do you know what those gusts were, O Ali?” He, peace be upon him, said: “No.” Then he, Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny, said: “The first gust was Jibra’il, and with him were a thousand angels; he greeted you and they greeted you. The second was Mika’il, and with him were a thousand angels; he greeted you and they greeted you. And the third was Israfil, and with him were a thousand angels; he greeted you and they greeted you; and they all had descended as reinforcements for us.”
items.transliteration: Wa-hal 'alimta ma hiya tilka al-'awasifu ya 'Aliyyu? fa-qala 'alayhi al-salamu: la. fa-qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: kanati al-'asifatu al-ula Jabra'ilu wa-ma'ahu alfu malakin sallama 'alayka wa-sallamu. wa-al-thaniyatu kanat Mika'ilu wa-ma'ahu alfu malakin sallama 'alayka wa-sallamu. wa-al-thalithatu Israfilu wa-ma'ahu alfu malakin sallama 'alayka wa-sallamu wa-kulluhum qad habatu madadan lana.

footnote_refs.title: بحار الأنوار: ج 19، ص 286- / 293 و 316؛ و ج 39، ص 95.

items.arabic: وإلى هذا أشار من قال: أنّه كانت لأميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام ثلاثة آلاف منقبة في ليلة واحدة، حيث سلّم عليه ثلاثة آلاف ملك مع ثلاثة من الملائكة المقرَّبين.
items.english: To this alluded the one who said: that the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, had three thousand merits in a single night, as three thousand angels greeted him along with three of the near-stationed angels.
items.transliteration: Wa-ila hadha ashara man qala: annahu kanat li-Amiri al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salamu thalathatu alafi manqabatin fi laylatin wahidatin, haythu sallama 'alayhi thalathatu alafi malakin ma'a thalathati mina al-mala'ikati al-muqarrabina.

items.arabic: ويشير إليه السيّد الحميري في مدحه له عليه السلام في الشعر:
items.english: And al-Sayyid al-Himyari alludes to this in his praise of him, peace be upon him, in verse:
items.transliteration: Wa-yushiru ilayhi al-Sayyidu al-Himyari fi madhihi lahu 'alayhi al-salamu fi al-shi'ri:

items.arabic: اقْسِمُ بِاللَّهِ وَآلائِهِ وَالْمَرْءُ عَمَّا قالَ مَسْؤُولُ
items.english: I swear by Allah and His favors, and man is held accountable for what he says.
items.transliteration: Uqsimu bi-Allahi wa-ala'ihi wa-al-mar'u 'amma qala mas'ulu.

items.arabic: انَّ عَلِىَّ بْنَ ابى طالِبٍ عَلَى التُّقى وَالْبِرِّ مَجْبُولُ
items.english: Verily, Ali ibn Abi Talib is fashioned upon piety and virtue.
items.transliteration: Inna 'Aliyya bna Abi Talibin 'ala al-tuqa wa-al-birri majbulu.

items.arabic: كانَ اذَا الْحَربُ مَرَتْهَا الْقَناوَاحْجَمَتْ عَنْهَا البَهاليلُ
items.english: Whenever the spears kindled the war, and the noble masters recoiled from it.
items.transliteration: Kana idha al-harbu marat-ha al-qana wa-ahjamat 'anha al-bahalilu.

items.arabic: يَمْشى الَى الْقِرْنِ وَفى كَفِّهِ ابْيَضُ ماضِى الْحَدِّ مَصْقُولُ
items.english: He advances towards the adversary, and in his hand is a bright sword, keen-edged and polished.
items.transliteration: Yamshi ila al-qirni wa-fi kaffihi abyadu madi al-haddi masqulu.

items.arabic: مَشْىَ الْعَفَرْنى بَيْنَ اشْبالِهِ ابْرَزَهُ لِلْقَنَصِ الْغيلُ
items.english: Stepping with the gait of a brave lion among his cubs, brought forth from the thicket for the hunt.
items.transliteration: Mashya al-'afarna bayna ashbalihi abrazahu li-al-qanasi al-ghilu.

items.arabic: ذاكَ الَّذى سَلَّمَ في لَيْلَةٍعَلَيْهِ ميكالٌ وَجِبْريلُ
items.english: That is the one whom Mika’il and Jibra’il greeted in a night.
items.transliteration: Dhaka alladhi sallama fi laylatin 'alayhi Mikalu wa-Jibrilu.

items.arabic: ميكالُ في الْفٍ وَجِبْريلُ في الْفٍ وَيَتْلُوهُمْ سَرافيلُ
items.english: Mika’il among a thousand, and Jibra’il among a thousand, and following them was Israfil.
items.transliteration: Mikalu fi alfin wa-Jibrilu fi alfin wa-yatlu-hum Sarafilu.

items.arabic: لَيْلَةَ بَدْرٍ مَدَداً انْزِلُواكَانَّهُمْ طَيْرٌ ابابيلُ
items.english: On the night of Badr, they were sent down as reinforcements, as if they were flocks of birds.
items.transliteration: Laylata Badrin madadan unzilu ka-annahum tayrun Ababilu.

items.arabic: اقْسِمُ بِاللَّهِ وَآلائِهِ وَالْمَرْءُ عَمَّا قالَ مَسْؤُولُ

items.english: Whenever the spears kindled the war, and the noble masters recoiled from it.

items.english: That is the one whom Mika’il and Jibra’il greeted in a night.
items.transliteration: Dhaka alladhi sallama fi laylatin 'alayhi Mikalu wa-Jibrilu.

items.arabic: ميكالُ في الْفٍ وَجِبْريلُ في الْفٍ وَيَتْلُوهُمْ سَرافيلُ
items.english: Mika’il among a thousand, and Jibra’il among a thousand, and following them was Israfil.
items.transliteration: Mikalu fi alfin wa-Jibrilu fi alfin wa-yatlu-hum Sarafilu.

items.arabic: لَيْلَةَ بَدْرٍ مَدَداً انْزِلُواكَانَّهُمْ طَيْرٌ ابابيلُ
items.english: On the night of Badr, they were sent down as reinforcements, as if they were flocks of birds.
items.transliteration: Laylata Badrin madadan unzilu ka-annahum tayrun Ababilu.

items.arabic: ليلة القدر ليلة تتعيّن فيها مقدّرات الناس- حسب استعدادهم وقابليتهم- لسنة وفضلها والعمل فيها خير من العمل في ألف شهر. تهبط فيها الملائكة والروح وهو أعظم الملائكة في تلك الليلة إلى الأرض على إمام الزمان عليه السلام وتعرض عليه ما تقرّر لكلّ شخص إلى السنة القادمة .
items.english: The Night of Decree is a night in which the destinies of people are ordained—according to their preparation and capacity—for a year; its virtue and performing deeds during it are better than the deeds of a thousand months. On that night, the angels and the Spirit—who is the greatest of the angels—descend to the earth unto the Imam of the Time, peace be upon him, and they present to him what has been decreed for every individual until the following year.
items.transliteration: Laylatu al-Qadri laylatun tata'ayyanu fiha muqaddaratu al-nasi - hasaba isti'dadihim wa-qabiliyyatihim - li-sanatin wa-fadluha wa-al-'amalu fiha khayrun mina al-'amali fi alfi shahrin. Tahbitu fiha al-mala'ikatu wa-al-ruhu wa-huwa a'zamu al-mala'ikati fi tilka al-laylati ila al-ardi 'ala Imami al-zamani 'alayhi al-salamu wa-tu'radu 'alayhi ma taqarrara li-kulli shakhsin ila al-sanati al-qadimati.

items.arabic: وهنيئاً لمن استفاض من هذه الليلة التي نزل فيها القرآن وأقبل على الحقّ تعالى بالدعاء والمناجاة والتوبة والبكاء ويمهّد لنفسه من التقديرات القيّمة والمصير المعنويّ والروحيّ الرفيع.
items.english: And blessed is the one who draws from the overflowing grace of this night in which the Quran was revealed, and turns towards the Truth, Exalted is He, through supplication, intimate prayer, repentance, and weeping, thus preparing for himself precious ordainments and a lofty spiritual and inner destiny.
items.transliteration: Wa-hani'an li-man istafada min hadhihi al-laylati allati nazala fiha al-Qur'anu wa-aqbala 'ala al-Haqqi Ta'ala bi-al-du'a'i wa-al-munajati wa-al-tawbati wa-al-buka'i wa-yumahhidu li-nafsihi mina al-taqdirati al-qayyimati wa-al-masiri al-ma'nawiyyi wa-al-ruhiyyi al-rafi'i.

items.arabic: ولم يعيّن المعصومون عليهم السلام هذه الليلة بدقّة وذكروها خلال ثلاث ليالٍ (التاسعة عشرةوالحادية والعشرون والثالثة والعشرون) ليقوم المؤمنون بأعمال هذه الليالي وينالون فيضها ويعيشون الاستعداد التامّ لألطاف اللَّه وعناياته.
items.english: And the Infallibles, peace be upon them, did not specify this night precisely, but mentioned it within three nights (the nineteenth, the twenty-first, and the twenty-third), so that the believers may perform the deeds of these nights, attain their overflowing grace, and experience complete readiness for the kindnesses and cares of Allah.
items.transliteration: Wa-lam yu'ayyini al-Ma'sumuna 'alayhimu al-salamu hadhihi al-laylata bi-diqqatin wa-dhakaru-ha khilala thalathi layalin (al-tasi'ata 'ashrata wa-al-hadiyatu wa-al-'ishruna wa-al-thalithatu wa-al-'ishruna) li-yaquma al-mu'minuna bi-a'mali hadhihi al-layali wa-yanaluna faydaha wa-ya'ishuna al-isti'dada al-tamma li-altafi Allahi wa-'inayatihi.

items.arabic: وإن عدّ العلماء على ضوء الروايات أنّ ليلتي الحادي والعشرين والثالث والعشرين هما الأقرب .
items.english: And although scholars, in light of the narrations, consider the two nights of the twenty-first and the twenty-third to be the most likely.
items.transliteration: Wa-in 'adda al-'ulama'u 'ala daw'i al-riwayati anna laylatay al-hadi wa-al-'ishrina wa-al-thalithi wa-al-'ishrina huma al-aqrabu.

items.arabic: الليلة التاسعة عشرة:
items.english: The Nineteenth Night:
items.transliteration: Al-Laylatu al-Tasi'atu 'Ashrata:

items.arabic: وهي أوّل ليلة من ليالي القدر وبها تبدأ الأعمال.
items.english: It is the first of the Nights of Decree, and with it the deeds begin.
items.transliteration: Wa-hiya awwalu laylatin min layali al-Qadri wa-biha tabda'u al-a'malu.

items.arabic: الليلة التاسعة عشرة:
items.english: The Nineteenth Night:
items.transliteration: Al-Laylatu al-Tasi'atu 'Ashrata:

items.arabic: وهي أوّل ليلة من ليالي القدر وبها تبدأ الأعمال.
items.english: It is the first of the Nights of Decree, and with it the deeds begin.

items.arabic: أعمال ليلة القدر قسمان؛ قسم عام يؤدّى في الليالي الثلاث وقسم خاصّ يُؤتى فيما خصّ به كلّ ليلة.
items.english: The deeds of the Night of Decree are of two categories: a general category performed during the three nights, and a specific category performed as designated for each night.
items.transliteration: A'malu Laylati al-Qadri qismani; qismun 'ammun yu'adda fi al-layali al-thalathi wa-qismun khassun yu'ta fima khussa bihi kullu laylatin.

items.arabic: أعمال ليلة القدر قسمان؛ قسم عام يؤدّى في الليالي الثلاث وقسم خاصّ يُؤتى فيما خصّ به كلّ ليلة.
items.english: The deeds of the Night of Decree are of two categories: a general category performed during the three nights, and a specific category performed as designated for each night.
items.transliteration: A'malu Laylati al-Qadri qismani; qismun 'ammun yu'adda fi al-layali al-thalathi wa-qismun khassun yu'ta fima khussa bihi kullu laylatin.

items.arabic: 1. الغسل، قال العلّامة المجلسي: الأفضل أن يغتسل عند غروب الشمس ليكون على غسل لصلاة العشاء .
items.english: 1. The ritual bath; Al-Allamah al-Majlisi said: It is best to perform the ritual bath at sunset so that one performs the Isha prayer in a state of ritual purity.
items.transliteration: 1. Al-ghuslu, qala al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu: al-afdalu an yaghtasila 'inda ghurubi al-shamsi li-yakuna 'ala ghuslin li-salati al-'isha'i.

items.arabic: 2. الصلاة ركعتين يقرأ في كلّ ركعة بعد
items.english: 2. Performing a two-rak’ah prayer; in each rak’ah, reciting after
items.transliteration: 2. Al-salatu rak'atayni yaqra'u fi kulli rak'atin ba'da.

items.arabic: الحمد التوحيد
items.english: Al-Hamd and Al-Tawhid
items.transliteration: al-Hamdi al-Tawhida.

items.arabic: سبع مرّات ويقول بعد الفراغ سبعين مرّة:
items.english: seven times, and says after completion seventy times:
items.transliteration: Sab'a marratin wa-yaqulu ba'da al-faraghi sab'ina marratan:

items.arabic: اسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ الَيْهِ
items.english: I seek the forgiveness of Allah and I turn unto Him.
items.transliteration: Astaghfiru Allaha wa-atubu ilayhi.

items.arabic: ففي الحديث النبويّ الشريف: «
items.english: For in the noble prophetic Hadith: "
items.transliteration: Fa-fi al-hadithi al-nabawiyyi al-sharifi: "

items.arabic: مَنْ فَعَلَ ذلِكَ لا يَقومُ مِن مَقامِه حَتّى يَغْفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ ولِأبَوَيْهِ ويَأمُر المَلائِكَةَ أنْ تَكْتُبَ لَهُ حَسَناتٍ حتّى السَّنَةِ القَادِمَةِ
items.english: Whosoever performs this shall not rise from his place until Allah forgives him and his parents, and commands the angels to record good deeds for him until the coming year.
items.transliteration: Man fa'ala dhalika la yaqumu min maqamihi hatta yaghfira Allahu lahu wa-li-abawayhi wa-ya'muru al-mala'ikata an taktuba lahu hasanatin hatta al-sanati al-qadimati.

items.arabic: 3. قال الإمام الباقر عليه السلام في عمل آخر لهذه الليلة:
items.english: 3. Imam al-Baqir, peace be upon him, said regarding another deed for this night:
items.transliteration: 3. Qala al-Imamu al-Baqiru 'alayhi al-salamu fi 'amalin akharin li-hadhihi al-laylati:

items.arabic: تَنْشُرُ المُصْحَفَ وتَضَعُهُ بَيْنَ يَدَيْكَ وتَقولُ:
items.english: Open the Mushaf and place it in front of you and say:
items.transliteration: Tanshuru al-Mushafa wa-tada'uhu bayna yadayka wa-taqulu:

items.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ بِكِتابِكَ الْمُنْزَلِ وَما فيهِ، وَفيهِ اسْمُكَ [الْأَعْظَمُ الْأَكْبَرُ، وَاسْماؤُكَ الْحُسْنى وَما يُخافُ وَيُرْجى انْ تَجْعَلَنى مِنْ عُتَقائِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ.
items.english: O Allah, I beseech You by Your revealed Book and what it contains; and in it is Your Greatest, Grandest Name, and Your Most Beautiful Names, and that which is feared and hoped for, that You make me among those whom You have set free from the Fire.
items.transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka bi-kitabika al-munzali wa-ma fihi, wa-fihi ismuka [al-a'zamu al-akbaru, wa-asma'uka al-husna wa-ma yukhafu wa-yurja an taj'alani min 'utaqa'ika mina al-nari.

items.arabic: وتدعو بما بدا لك من حاجة .
items.english: And supplicate for whatever needs occur to you.
items.transliteration: Wa-tad'u bi-ma bada laka min hajatin.

items.arabic: 4. مراسم رفع المصاحف، قال الصادق عليه السلام: «
items.english: 4. The ceremony of raising the Mushafs; al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, said: "
items.transliteration: 4. Marasimu raf'i al-masahifi, qala al-Sadiqu 'alayhi al-salamu: "

items.arabic: خُذِ المُصْحَفَ فَدَعْهُ على رَأْسِكَ وَقُلْ
items.english: Take the Mushaf and place it upon your head and say:
items.transliteration: Khudhi al-Mushafa fa-da'hu 'ala ra'sika wa-qul.

items.arabic: »: اللَّهُمَّ بِحَقِّ هذَا الْقُرْآنِ، وَبِحَقِّ مَنْ ارْسَلْتَهُ بِهِ، وَبِحَقِّ كُلِّ مُؤْمِنٍ مَدَحْتَهُ فيهِ، وَبِحَقِّكَ عَلَيْهِمْ، فَلا احَدَ اعْرَفُ بِحَقِّكَ مِنْكَ. ثمّ قل عشر مرّات
items.english: ": O Allah, by the right of this Quran, and by the right of him whom You sent with it, and by the right of every believer whom You have praised therein, and by Your right over them, for there is none more cognizant of Your right than You." Then say ten times:
items.transliteration: ": Allahumma bi-haqqi hadha al-Qur'ani, wa-bi-haqqi man arsaltahu bihi, wa-bi-haqqi kulli mu'minin madahtahu fihi, wa-bi-haqqika 'alayhim, fa-la ahada a'rafu bi-haqqika minka. Thumma qul 'ashra marratin.

items.arabic: بِكَ يا اللَّهُ
items.english: By You, O Allah
items.transliteration: Bika ya Allahu.

items.arabic: وعشر مرّات
items.english: And ten times
items.transliteration: Wa-'ashra marratin.

items.arabic: بِمُحَمَّدٍ صلى الله عليه و آله
items.english: By Muhammad, peace be upon him and his family.
items.transliteration: Bi-Muhammadin salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi.

items.arabic: وعشر مرّات
items.english: And ten times
items.transliteration: Wa-'ashra marratin.

items.arabic: بعَلِىٍّ عليه السلام
items.english: By Ali, peace be upon him.
items.transliteration: Bi-'Aliyyin 'alayhi al-salamu.

items.transliteration: Wa-'ashra marratin.

items.arabic: بِالْحُسَيْنِ عليه السلام

items.transliteration: Bi-al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu.

items.arabic: وعشر مرّات
items.english: And ten times
items.transliteration: Wa-'ashra marratin.

items.arabic: بِعَلِىِّ بْنِ
items.english: By Ali ibn
items.transliteration: Bi-'Aliyyi ibni.

items.arabic: 1. الغسل، قال العلّامة المجلسي: الأفضل أن يغتسل عند غروب الشمس ليكون على غسل لصلاة العشاء .
items.english: 1. The ritual bath; Al-Allamah al-Majlisi said: It is best to perform the ritual bath at sunset so that one performs the Isha prayer in a state of ritual purity.
items.transliteration: 1. Al-ghuslu, qala al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu: al-afdalu an yaghtasila 'inda ghurubi al-shamsi li-yakuna 'ala ghuslin li-salati al-'isha'i.

items.arabic: 2. الصلاة ركعتين يقرأ في كلّ ركعة بعد
items.english: 2. Performing a two-rak’ah prayer; in each rak’ah, reciting after
items.transliteration: 2. Al-salatu rak'atayni yaqra'u fi kulli rak'atin ba'da.

items.arabic: الحمد التوحيد
items.english: Al-Hamd and Al-Tawhid
items.transliteration: al-Hamdi al-Tawhida.

items.arabic: سبع مرّات ويقول بعد الفراغ سبعين مرّة:
items.english: seven times, and says after completion seventy times:
items.transliteration: Sab'a marratin wa-yaqulu ba'da al-faraghi sab'ina marratan:

items.arabic: اسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ الَيْهِ
items.english: I seek the forgiveness of Allah and I turn unto Him.
items.transliteration: Astaghfiru Allaha wa-atubu ilayhi.

items.arabic: ؛ وتسأل حاجتك وتحفظ حضور قلبك وتوجّهك إلى اللَّه طيلة هذه الأذكار.
items.english: And ask for your needs, maintaining the presence of your heart and your turning towards Allah throughout these supplications.
items.transliteration: Wa-tas’alu hajataka wa-tahfazu hudura qalbika wa-tawajjuhaka ila Allahi tilata hadhihi al-adhkari.

items.arabic: والأفضل ذكر المصيبة قبل أو بعد الدعاء دون قطعه إن أراد التوسّل.
items.english: It is preferable to mention the tragedy before or after the supplication, without interrupting it, if one intends to seek intercession.
items.transliteration: Wa-al-afdalu dhikru al-musibati qabla aw ba'da al-du'a'i duna qat'ihi in arada al-tawassula.

items.arabic: 5. زيارة الحسين عليه السلام فزيارته كما ذكر العلّامة المجلسيّ في إحدى هذه الليالي من المستحبّات المؤكدة ، وجاء في الرواية أنّها غُفْرانُ للذّنوبِ وإن تعذّرت زيارته من قرب فليزُر من بُعد.
items.english: 5. The Ziyarah of al-Husayn, peace be upon him: Performing his visitation during one of these nights, as mentioned by al-Allamah al-Majlisi, is among the emphasized recommended acts. It is stated in the narration that it results in the forgiveness of sins; and if visitation from near is not possible, then one should perform the visitation from afar.
items.transliteration: 5. Ziyaratu al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu fa-ziyaratuhu kama dhakara al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu fi ihda hadhihi al-layali mina al-mustahabbati al-mu'akkadati, wa-ja'a fi al-riwayati annaha ghufranun li-al-dhunubi wa-in ta'adhdharat ziyaratuhu min qurbin fa-lyazur min bu'din.

items.arabic: 6. إحياء هذه الليالي الثلاث، أي يبقى يقظاً إلى الصباح ويقضيها بالعبادة والدعاء وتلاوة القرآن والمجالس الدينية والأسئلة والأجوبة الشرعية أو مطالعة كتب التفسير والعقائد والمواعظ.
items.english: 6. Keeping the vigil of these three nights; that is, remaining awake until morning and spending them in worship, supplication, recitation of the Quran, religious gatherings, and religious questions and answers, or studying books of exegesis, beliefs, and exhortations.
items.transliteration: 6. Ihya'u hadhihi al-layali al-thalathi, ay yabqa yaqizan ila al-sabahi wa-yaqdiha bi-al-'ibadati wa-al-du'a'i wa-tilawati al-Qur'ani wa-al-majalisi al-diniyyati wa-al-as'ilati wa-al-ajwibati al-shar'iyyati aw mutala'ati kutubi al-tafsiri wa-al-'aqa'idi wa-al-mawa'izi.

items.arabic: عن الإمام الباقر عليه السلام: «
items.english: From Imam al-Baqir, peace be upon him: "
items.transliteration: 'An al-Imami al-Baqiri 'alayhi al-salamu: "

items.arabic: مَنْ أحْيا لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ غُفِرَتْ لَهُ ذُنوبُه، وَلَو كانَتْ ذُنُوبُه عَدَدَ نُجومِ السَّماءِ ومَثاقيلَ الجِبالِ، ومَكائِيلَ البِحارِ»
items.english: Whoever keeps the vigil of Laylat al-Qadr, his sins shall be forgiven, even if his sins were as numerous as the stars of the heaven, the weight of the mountains, and the measure of the seas."
items.transliteration: Man ahya laylata al-Qadri ghufirat lahu dhunubuhu, wa-law kanat dhunubuhu 'adada nujumi al-sama'i wa-mathaqila al-jibali, wa-maka'ila al-bihari."

items.arabic: . والأفضل أن يستريح في اليوم الذي يسبقها قليلًا ويقلّل من تناول الطعام والشراب حتّى لا يغلبه النوم ومن لا يستطيع الإحياء فالأفضل أن يستريح أوّل الليل ويتعبّد في الأسحار.
items.english: It is preferable to rest a little on the day preceding it and to reduce the intake of food and drink so that sleep does not overcome him. And whoever is unable to keep the vigil, it is preferable for him to rest during the first part of the night and engage in worship during the pre-dawn hours.
items.transliteration: Wa-al-afdalu an yastariha fi al-yawmi alladhi yasbiquha qalilan wa-yuqallila min tanawuli al-ta'ami wa-al-sharabi hatta la yaghlibahu al-nawmu wa-man la yastati'u al-ihya'a fa-al-afdalu an yastariha awwala al-layli wa-yata'abbada fi al-ashari.

I bear witness to that against myself, and I confess to You the weakness of my strength and the paucity of my resources. So bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and fulfill for me what You have promised me and all the believing men and believing women of

items.english: And ask for your needs, maintaining the presence of your heart and your turning towards Allah throughout these supplications.
items.transliteration: Wa-tas’alu hajataka wa-tahfazu hudura qalbika wa-tawajjuhaka ila Allahi tilata hadhihi al-adhkari.

items.arabic: والأفضل ذكر المصيبة قبل أو بعد الدعاء دون قطعه إن أراد التوسّل.
items.english: It is preferable to mention the tragedy before or after the supplication, without interrupting it, if one intends to seek intercession.
items.transliteration: Wa-al-afdalu dhikru al-musibati qabla aw ba'da al-du'a'i duna qat'ihi in arada al-tawassula.

items.arabic: 5. زيارة الحسين عليه السلام فزيارته كما ذكر العلّامة المجلسيّ في إحدى هذه الليالي من المستحبّات المؤكدة ، وجاء في الرواية أنّها غُفْرانُ للذّنوبِ وإن تعذّرت زيارته من قرب فليزُر من بُعد.
items.english: 5. The Ziyarah of al-Husayn, peace be upon him: Performing his visitation during one of these nights, as mentioned by al-Allamah al-Majlisi, is among the emphasized recommended acts. It is stated in the narration that it results in the forgiveness of sins; and if visitation from near is not possible, then let him perform the visitation from afar.
items.transliteration: 5. Ziyaratu al-Husayni 'alayhi al-salamu fa-ziyaratuhu kama dhakara al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu fi ihda hadhihi al-layali mina al-mustahabbati al-mu'akkadati, wa-ja'a fi al-riwayati annaha ghufranun li-al-dhunubi wa-in ta'adhdharat ziyaratuhu min qurbin fa-lyazur min bu'din.

items.arabic: 6. إحياء هذه الليالي الثلاث، أي يبقى يقظاً إلى الصباح ويقضيها بالعبادة والدعاء وتلاوة القرآن والمجالس الدينية والأسئلة والأجوبة الشرعية أو مطالعة كتب التفسير والعقائد والمواعظ.
items.english: 6. Keeping the vigil of these three nights; that is, remaining awake until morning and spending them in worship, supplication, recitation of the Quran, religious gatherings, and religious questions and answers, or studying books of exegesis, beliefs, and exhortations.
items.transliteration: 6. Ihya'u hadhihi al-layali al-thalathi, ay yabqa yaqizan ila al-sabahi wa-yaqdiha bi-al-'ibadati wa-al-du'a'i wa-tilawati al-Qur'ani wa-al-majalisi al-diniyyati wa-al-as'ilati wa-al-ajwibati al-shar'iyyati aw mutala'ati kutubi al-tafsiri wa-al-'aqa'idi wa-al-mawa'izi.

items.arabic: عن الإمام الباقر عليه السلام: «
items.english: From Imam al-Baqir, peace be upon him: "
items.transliteration: 'An al-Imami al-Baqiri 'alayhi al-salamu: "

items.arabic: مَنْ أحْيا لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ غُفِرَتْ لَهُ ذُنوبُه، وَلَو كانَتْ ذُنُوبُه عَدَدَ نُجومِ السَّماءِ ومَثاقيلَ الجِبالِ، ومَكائِيلَ البِحارِ»
items.english: Whoever keeps the vigil of Laylat al-Qadr, his sins shall be forgiven, even if his sins were as numerous as the stars of the heaven, the weight of the mountains, and the measure of the seas."
items.transliteration: Man ahya laylata al-Qadri ghufirat lahu dhunubuhu, wa-law kanat dhunubuhu 'adada nujumi al-sama'i wa-mathaqila al-jibali, wa-maka'ila al-bihari.

items.arabic: . والأفضل أن يستريح في اليوم الذي يسبقها قليلًا ويقلّل من تناول الطعام والشراب حتّى لا يغلبه النوم ومن لا يستطيع الإحياء فالأفضل أن يستريح أوّل الليل ويتعبّد في الأسحار.
items.english: It is preferable to rest a little on the day preceding it and to reduce the intake of food and drink so that sleep does not overcome him. And whoever is unable to keep the vigil, it is preferable for him to rest during the first part of the night and engage in worship during the pre-dawn hours.
items.transliteration: Wa-al-afdalu an yastariha fi al-yawmi alladhi yasbiquha qalilan wa-yuqallila min tanawuli al-ta'ami wa-al-sharabi hatta la yaghlibahu al-nawmu wa-man la yastati'u al-ihya'a fa-al-afdalu an yastariha awwala al-layli wa-yata'abbada fi al-ashari.

I bear witness to that against myself, and I confess to You the weakness of my strength and the paucity of my resources. So bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and fulfill for me what You have promised me and all the believing men and believing women, of
items.transliteration: Allahumma inni amsaytu laka 'abdan dakhiran, la amliku li-nafsi naf'an wa-la darran, wa-la asrifu 'anha su'an, ashhadu bi-dhalika 'ala nafsi wa-a'tarifu laka bi-da'fi quwwati wa-qillati hilati fa-salli 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin, wa-anjiz li ma wa'adtani wa-jami'a al-mu'minina wa-al-mu'minati mina.

items.arabic: الْمَغْفِرَةِ فى هذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ، وَاتْمِمْ عَلَىَّ ما اتَيْتَنى فَانّى عَبْدُكَ الْمِسْكينُ الْمُسْتَكينُ، الضَّعيفُ الْفَقيرُ الْمَهينُ، اللهُمَّ لا تَجْعَلْنى ناسِياً لِذِكْرِكَ فيما اوْلَيْتَنى وَلا لِإِحْسانِكَ فيما اعْطَيْتَنى وَلا ايِساً مِنْ اجابَتِكَ، وَانْ ابْطَاتْ عَنّى فى سَرَّآءَ اوْ ضَرَّآءَ، اوْ شِدَّةٍ اوْ رَخآءٍ، اوْ عافِيَةٍ اوْ بَلاءٍ، اوْ بُؤْسٍ اوْ نَعْمآءَ، انَّكَ سَميعُ الدُّعآءِ .
items.english: of Muhammad, and grant me forgiveness in this night, and complete for me that which You have granted me; for I am Your wretched, submissive, weak, poor, and abject servant. O Allah, do not make me forgetful of Your remembrance regarding what You have bestowed upon me, nor of Your bounty regarding what You have given me, nor despairing of Your response, even if it is delayed from me, whether in ease or hardship, in severity or prosperity, in health or affliction, in misery or blessing. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.
items.transliteration: al-maghfirati fi hadhihi al-laylati, wa-atmim 'alayya ma ataytani fa-inni 'abduka al-miskinu al-mustakinu, al-da'ifu al-faqiru al-mahinu, Allahumma la taj'alni nasiyan li-dhikrika fima awlaytani wa-la li-ihsanika fima a'taytani wa-la ayisan min ijabatika, wa-in abta'at 'anni fi sarra'a aw darra'a, aw shiddatin aw rakha'in, aw 'afiyatin aw bala'in, aw bu'sin aw na'ma'a, innaka sami'u al-du'a'i.

items.arabic: 9. قال العلّامة المجلسي: أنّ أفضل الأعمال في هذه الليالي هو الاستغفار والدعاء لمطالب الدنيا والآخرة، للنفس وللوالدين والأقرباء وللإخوان المؤمنين، الأحياء منهم والأموات، والذكر والصلاة على محمّد وآل محمّد ما تيسّر.
items.english: 9. al-Allamah al-Majlisi said: The best of deeds during these nights is seeking forgiveness and supplicating for the needs of this world and the Hereafter, for oneself, for one's parents, relatives, and the faithful believers, the living among them and the deceased, and remembrance and sending blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as much as possible.
items.transliteration: 9. Qala al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu: Anna afdala al-a'mali fi hadhihi al-layali huwa al-istighfaru wa-al-du'a'u li-matalibi al-dunya wa-al-akhirati, li-al-nafsi wa-li-al-walidayni wa-al-aqriba'i wa-li-al-ikhwani al-mu'minina, al-ahya'i minhum wa-al-amwati, wa-al-dhikru wa-al-salatu 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin ma tayassara.

items.arabic: وقد ورد في بعض الأحاديث استحباب قراءة دعاء الجوشن الكبير (الذي مضى، ص 91) في هذه الليالي الثلاث .
items.english: It has been narrated in some traditions the recommendation of reciting Dua al-Jawshan al-Kabir (which preceded, p. 91) during these three nights.
items.transliteration: Wa-qad warada fi ba'di al-ahadithi istihbabu qira'ati du'a'i al-Jawshani al-Kabiri (alladhi mada, sa. 91) fi hadhihi al-layali al-thalathi.

items.arabic: وروي أنّ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه و آله قيل له: إن أنا أدركت ليلة القدر، فما أسأل ربّي؟ قال صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: And it is narrated that the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, was asked: "If I reach Laylat al-Qadr, what should I ask my Lord?" He, peace be upon him and his family, said: "
items.transliteration: Wa-ruwiya anna al-Nabiyya salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi qila lahu: In ana adraktu laylata al-Qadri, fa-ma as'alu Rabbi? Qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: "

items.arabic: العافِيَة» .
items.english: Well-being."
items.transliteration: Al-'afiyata."

O Allah, do not make me forgetful of Your remembrance regarding what You have bestowed upon me, nor of Your bounty regarding what You have given me, nor despairing of Your response, even if it is delayed from me, whether in ease or hardship, or severity or prosperity, or well-being or affliction, or misery or blessings; surely You are the Hearer of prayer.

items.english: 9. al-Allamah al-Majlisi said: The best of deeds during these nights is seeking forgiveness and supplicating for the needs of this world and the Hereafter, for oneself, for one's parents, relatives, and the faithful believers, the living among them and the deceased, and remembrance and sending blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as much as is possible.
items.transliteration: 9. Qala al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu: Anna afdala al-a'mali fi hadhihi al-layali huwa al-istighfaru wa-al-du'a'u li-matalibi al-dunya wa-al-akhirati, li-al-nafsi wa-li-al-walidayni wa-al-aqriba'i wa-li-al-ikhwani al-mu'minina, al-ahya'i minhum wa-al-amwati, wa-al-dhikru wa-al-salatu 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin ma tayassara.

items.arabic: وقد ورد في بعض الأحاديث استحباب قراءة دعاء الجوشن الكبير (الذي مضى، ص 91) في هذه الليالي الثلاث .
items.english: It has been narrated in some traditions the recommendation of reciting Dua al-Jawshan al-Kabir (which preceded, p. 91) during these three nights.
items.transliteration: Wa-qad warada fi ba'di al-ahadithi istihbabu qira'ati du'a'i al-Jawshani al-Kabiri (alladhi mada, sa. 91) fi hadhihi al-layali al-thalathi.

items.arabic: وروي أنّ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه و آله قيل له: إن أنا أدركت ليلة القدر، فما أسأل ربّي؟ قال صلى الله عليه و آله: «
items.english: And it is narrated that the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, was asked: "If I reach Laylat al-Qadr, what should I ask my Lord?" He, peace be upon him and his family, said: "
items.transliteration: Wa-ruwiya anna al-Nabiyya salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi qila lahu: In ana adraktu laylata al-Qadri, fa-ma as'alu Rabbi? Qala salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi: "

items.arabic: العافِيَة» .
items.english: Well-being."
items.transliteration: Al-'afiyata."

items.title: الأعمال الخاصة بكل ليلة من ليالي القدر

items.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اْجْعَلْ فيما تَقْضى وَتُقَدِّرُ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ الْمَحْتُومِ، وَفيما تَفْرُقُ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ الحَكيمِ فى لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ، وَفِى الْقَضآءِ الَّذى لا يُرَدُّ وَلا يُبَدَّلُ، انْ تَكْتُبَنى مِنْ حُجَّاجِ بَيْتِكَ الْحَرامِ، الْمَبْرُورِ حَجُّهُمْ، الْمَشْكُورِ سَعْيُهُمْ، الْمَغْفُورِ ذُنُوبُهُمْ، الْمُكَفَّرِ عَنْهُمْ
items.english: O Allah, ordain among that which You decree and destine of the inevitable matter, and among that which You distinguish of the wise matter on Laylat al-Qadr, and in the decree that is neither turned back nor changed, that You register me among the pilgrims of Your Sacred House, whose pilgrimage is accepted, whose effort is appreciated, whose sins are forgiven, and whose evil deeds are expiated.
items.transliteration: Allahumma ij'al fima taqdi wa-tuqaddiru mina al-amri al-mahtumi, wa-fima tafruqu mina al-amri al-hakimi fi laylati al-Qadri, wa-fi al-qada'i alladhi la yuraddu wa-la yubaddalu, an taktubani min hujjaji baytika al-harami, al-mabruri hajjuhum, al-mashkuri sa'yuhum, al-maghfuri dhunubuhum, al-mukaffari 'anhum.

items.english: cepted, their efforts appreciated, their sins forgiven, and their evil deeds expiated; and ordain among that which You decree and destine that You prolong my life, expand for me my sustenance, and do for me such and such.
items.transliteration: sayyi'atuhum, wa-ij'al fima taqdi wa-tuqaddiru, an tutila 'umri wa-tuwassi'a 'alayya fi rizqi wa-taf'ala bi kadha wa-kadha.

items.english: And ask for your need instead of saying: such and such.
items.transliteration: Wa-tatlubu badalan 'an qawli: kadha wa-kadha, hajataka.

items.arabic: وفضلها أعظم من الليلة التاسعة عشرة فتؤدّى بها الأعمال المشتركة لليالي القدر بتوجّه أعمق. وأكّدت الروايات فيها على الغسل والإحياء والاجتهاد في العبادة وكذلك الليلة الثالثة والعشرون وأنّ ليلة القدر إحدى الليلتين . وفي بعض الروايات حين سئل المعصوم عليه السلام عن ليلة القدر، فلم يعيّن بل قال:
items.english: And its merit is greater than the nineteenth night, so the common acts for the Nights of Power are performed in it with deeper devotion. The narrations emphasize within it the ritual bath, the night vigil, and striving in worship, as well as the twenty-third night, and that Laylat al-Qadr is one of the two nights. In some narrations, when the Infallible, peace be upon him, was asked about Laylat al-Qadr, he did not specify it but rather said:
items.transliteration: Wa-fadluha a'zamu mina al-laylati al-tasi'ati 'ashrata fa-tu'adda biha al-a'malu al-mushtarakatu li-layali al-Qadri bi-tawajjuhin a'maqa. Wa-akkadati al-riwayatu fiha 'ala al-ghusli wa-al-ihya'i wa-al-ijtihadi fi al-'ibadati wa-kadhalika al-laylatu al-thalithatu wa-al-'ishruna wa-anna laylata al-Qadri ihda al-laylatayni. Wa-fi ba'di al-riwayati hina su'ila al-ma'sumu 'alayhi al-salamu 'an laylati al-Qadri, fa-lam yu'ayyin bal qala:

items.arabic: «ما ايْسَرَ لَيْلَتَيْنِ فيما تَطْلُبُ» .
items.english: How easy are two nights for what you seek!
items.transliteration: Ma aysara laylatayni fima tatlubu.

items.arabic: وقال المرحوم الصدوق في الأمالي:
items.english: And the late al-Saduq said in al-Amali:
items.transliteration: Wa-qala al-Marhumu al-Saduqu fi al-Amali:

items.arabic: «مِنْ دينِ الإمامِيَّةِ ... مَنْ احْيى هاتَيْنِ اللَّيْلَتَيْنِ بِمُذاكَرَةِ الْعِلْمِ فَهُوَ افْضَلُ» .
items.english: From the religion of the Imamiyyah... whoever keeps these two nights in vigil with the discussion of knowledge, it is better.
items.transliteration: Min dini al-Imamiyyati... man ahya hatayni al-laylatayni bi-mudhakarati al-'ilmi fa-huwa afdalu.

items.arabic: أعمال هذه الليلة نوعان؛ الأوّل الأدعية المتعلّقة بالعشر الأواخر، وسترد علينا (ص 533)، والآخر الأعمال الخاصة بهذه الليلة وهي:
items.english: The acts of this night are of two types: the first is the supplications pertaining to the last ten nights, which will follow (p. 533), and the other is the acts specific to this night, and they are:
items.transliteration: A'malu hadhihi al-laylati naw'ani; al-awwalu al-ad'iyatu al-muta'alliqatu bi-al-'ashri al-awakhiri, wa-sataridu 'alayna (sa. 533), wa-al-akharu al-a'malu al-khassatu bi-hadhihi al-laylati wa-hiya:

items.arabic: 1. ما ورد في «مصباح المتهجّد» و «الكافي» حيث يقرأ في الليلة الحادية والعشرون يا مُولِجَ اللَّيْلِ فِى النَّهارِ، وَمُولِجَ النَّهارِ فِى اللَّيْلِ، وَمُخْرِجَ الْحَىِّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ، وَمُخْرِجَ الْمَيِّتِ مِنَ الْحَىِّ، يا رازِقَ مَنْ يَشآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسابٍ، يا اللَّهُ يا رَحْمنُ، يا اللَّهُ يا رَحيمُ، يا اللَّهُ يا اللَّهُ يا اللَّهُ، لَكَ الْأَسْمآءُ الْحُسْنى وَالْأَمْثالُ الْعُلْيا، وَالْكِبْرِيآءُ وَالْألاءُ، اسْئَلُكَ انْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَانْ تَجْعَلَ اسْمى فى هذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ فِى السُّعَدآءِ، وَرُوحى مَعَ الشُّهَدآءِ، وَاحْسانى فى عِلِّيّينَ، وَاسآئَتى مَغْفُورَةً، وَانْ تَهَبَ لى يَقيناً تُباشِرُ بِهِ قَلْبى وَايماناً يُذْهِبُ الشَّكَّ عَنّى وَتُرْضِيَنى بِما قَسَمْتَ لى وَآتِنا فِى الدُّنْيا حَسَنَةً، وَفِى الْأخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً، وَقِنا
items.english: 1. What was narrated in *Misbah al-Mutahajjid* and *al-Kafi*, where one recites on the twenty-first night: O He Who merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living; O Provider for whomsoever He wills without account; O Allah, O All-Beneficent; O Allah, O All-Merciful; O Allah, O Allah, O Allah! To You belong the Most Beautiful Names, the loftiest examples, greatness, and bounties. I ask You to send blessings upon Muhammad and the progeny of Muhammad, and that You place my name on this night among the felicitous, my soul with the martyrs, my good deeds in *'Illiyyin*, and my evil deeds forgiven; and that You grant me a certainty that stays close to my heart and a faith that removes doubt from me, and make me satisfied with what You have allotted for me; and give us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and protect us
items.transliteration: 1. Ma warada fi «Misbahi al-Mutahajjidi» wa-«al-Kafi» haythu yuqra'u fi al-laylati al-hadiyati wa-al-'ishruna: Ya mulija al-layli fi al-nahari, wa-mulija al-nahari fi al-layli, wa-mukhrija al-hayyi mina al-mayyiti, wa-mukhrija al-mayyiti mina al-hayyi, ya raziqa man yasha'u bi-ghayri hisabin, ya Allahu ya Rahmanu, ya Allahu ya Rahimu, ya Allahu ya Allahu ya Allahu, laka al-asma'u al-husna wa-al-amthalu al-'ulya, wa-al-kibriya'u wa-al-ala'u, as'aluka an tusalliya 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin, wa-an taj'ala ismi fi hadhihi al-laylati fi al-su'ada'i, wa-ruhi ma'a al-shuhada'i, wa-ihsani fi 'illiyyina, wa-isa'ati maghfuratan, wa-an tahaba li yaqinan tubashiru bihi qalbi wa-imanan yudh-hibu al-shakka 'anni wa-turdiyani bima qasamta li wa-atina fi al-dunya hasanatan, wa-fi al-akhirati hasanatan, wa-qina.

items.english: The acts of this night are of two types: the first is the supplications pertaining to the last ten nights, which will follow (p. 533), and the other is the acts specific to this night, and they are:
items.transliteration: A'malu hadhihi al-laylati naw'ani; al-awwalu al-ad'iyatu al-muta'alliqatu bi-al-'ashri al-awakhiri, wa-sataridu 'alayna (sa. 533), wa-al-akharu al-a'malu al-khassatu bi-hadhihi al-laylati wa-hiya:

items.arabic: 1. ما ورد في «مصباح المتهجّد» و «الكافي» حيث يقرأ في الليلة الحادية والعشرون يا مُولِجَ اللَّيْلِ فِى النَّهارِ، وَمُولِجَ النَّهارِ فِى اللَّيْلِ، وَمُخْرِجَ الْحَىِّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ، وَمُخْرِجَ الْمَيِّتِ مِنَ الْحَىِّ، يا رازِقَ مَنْ يَشآءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسابٍ، يا اللَّهُ يا رَحْمنُ، يا اللَّهُ يا رَحيمُ، يا اللَّهُ يا اللَّهُ يا اللَّهُ، لَكَ الْأَسْمآءُ الْحُسْنى وَالْأَمْثالُ الْعُلْيا، وَالْكِبْرِيآءُ وَالْألاءُ، اسْئَلُكَ انْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَانْ تَجْعَلَ اسْمى فى هذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ فِى السُّعَدآءِ، وَرُوحى مَعَ الشُّهَدآءِ، وَاحْسانى فى عِلِّيّينَ، وَاسآئَتى مَغْفُورَةً، وَانْ تَهَبَ لى يَقيناً تُباشِرُ بِهِ قَلْبى وَايماناً يُذْهِبُ الشَّكَّ عَنّى وَتُرْضِيَنى بِما قَسَمْتَ لى وَآتِنا فِى الدُّنْيا حَسَنَةً، وَفِى الْأخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً، وَقِنا
items.english: 1. What was narrated in *Misbah al-Mutahajjid* and *al-Kafi*, where one recites on the twenty-first night: O He Who merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living; O Provider for whomsoever He wills without account; O Allah, O All-Beneficent; O Allah, O All-Merciful; O Allah, O Allah, O Allah; to You belong the Most Beautiful Names, the loftiest examples, the greatness, and the bounties. I ask You to bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and that You place my name on this night among the felicitous, and my soul with the martyrs, and my good deeds in *'Illiyyin*, and my misdeeds forgiven; and that You grant me a certainty which stays close to my heart, and a faith that removes doubt from me, and make me content with that which You have apportioned for me; and grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and protect us...
items.transliteration: 1. Ma warada fi «Misbahi al-Mutahajjidi» wa-«al-Kafi» haythu yuqra'u fi al-laylati al-hadiyati wa-al-'ishruna: Ya mulija al-layli fi al-nahari, wa-mulija al-nahari fi al-layli, wa-mukhrija al-hayyi mina al-mayyiti, wa-mukhrija al-mayyiti mina al-hayyi, ya raziqa man yasha'u bi-ghayri hisabin, ya Allahu ya Rahmanu, ya Allahu ya Rahimu, ya Allahu ya Allahu ya Allahu, laka al-asma'u al-husna wa-al-amthalu al-'ulya, wa-al-kibriya'u wa-al-ala'u, as'aluka an tusalliya 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin, wa-an taj'ala ismi fi hadhihi al-laylati fi al-su'ada'i, wa-ruhi ma'a al-shuhada'i, wa-ihsani fi 'illiyyina, wa-isa'ati maghfuratan, wa-an tahaba li yaqinan tubashiru bihi qalbi wa-imanan yudh-hibu al-shakka 'anni wa-turdiyani bima qasamta li wa-atina fi al-dunya hasanatan, wa-fi al-akhirati hasanatan, wa-qina

items.arabic: عَذابَ النَّارِ الْحَريقِ، وَارْزُقْنى فيها ذِكْرَكَ وَشُكْرَكَ، وَالرَّغْبَةَ الَيْكَ وَالْإِنابَةَ، وَالتَّوْفيقَ لِما وَفَّقْتَ لَهُ مُحَمَّداً وَآلَ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَيْهِمُ السَّلامُ.
items.english: the punishment of the burning Fire, and grant me therein Your remembrance, gratitude to You, longing for You, and turning in repentance to You, and the success for that which You granted Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, peace be upon him and upon them.
items.transliteration: 'adhaba al-nari al-hariqi, wa-urzuqni fiha dhikraka wa-shukraka, wa-al-raghbata ilayka wa-al-inabata, wa-al-tawfiqa lima waffaqta lahu Muhammadan wa-ala Muhammadin 'alayhi wa-'alayhimu al-salamu.

items.arabic: 2. روى الكفعمي عن السيّد ابن باقي تقول في الليلة الحادية والعشرين:
items.english: 2. Al-Kaf‘ami narrated from al-Sayyid Ibn Baqi: you say on the twenty-first night:
items.transliteration: 2. Rawa al-Kaf'amiyyu 'an al-Sayyidi Ibni Baqi taqulu fi al-laylati al-hadiyati wa-al-'ishrina:

items.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَاقْسِمْ لى حِلْماً يَسُدُّ عَنّى بابَ الْجَهْلِ، وَهُدىً تَمُنُّ بِهِ عَلَىَّ مِنْ كُلِّ ضَلالَةٍ، وَغِنىً تَسُدُّ بِهِ عَنّى بابَ كُلِّ فَقْرٍ، وَقُوَّةً تَرُدُّ بِها عَنّى كُلَّ ضَعْفٍ، وَعِزّاً تُكْرِمُنى بِهِ عَنْ كُلِّ ذِلَّةٍ، وَرِفْعَةً تَرْفَعُنى بِها عَنْ كُلِّ ضَعَةٍ، وَامْناً تَرُدُّ بِهِ عَنّى كُلَّ خَوْفٍ، وَعافِيَةً تَسْتُرُنى بِها مِنْ كُلِّ بَلاءٍ، وَعِلْماً تَفْتَحُ لى بِهِ كُلَّ يَقينٍ، وَيَقيناً تُذْهِبُ بِهِ عَنّى كُلَّ شَكٍّ، وَدُعآءً تَبْسُطُ لى بِهِ الْإِجابَةَ فى هذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ، وَفى هذِهِ السَّاعَةِ السَّاعَةِ السَّاعَةِ يا كَريمُ، وَخَوْفاً تَنْشُرُ لى بِهِ كُلَّ رَحْمَةٍ، وَعِصْمَةً تَحُولُ بِها بَيْنى وَبَيْنَ الذُّنُوبِ، حَتّى افْلِحَ بِها بَيْنَ الْمَعْصُومينَ عِنْدَكَ، بِرَحْمَتِكَ يا ارْحَمَ الرَّاحِمينَ .
items.english: O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, and apportion for me a forbearance that shuts against me the door of ignorance, and a guidance with which You favor me against every misguidance, and a self-sufficiency with which You shut against me the door of every poverty, and a strength with which You repel from me every weakness, and a might with which You honor me against every humiliation, and an elevation with which You raise me above every lowliness, and a security with which You repel from me every fear, and a well-being with which You shield me from every affliction, and a knowledge with which You open for me every certainty, and a certainty with which You remove from me every doubt, and a supplication for which You extend to me the response in this night, and in this hour—this hour, this hour—O Generous One, and a fear through which You spread for me every mercy, and a protection with which You intervene between me and sins, until I succeed through it among the infallible ones in Your presence; by Your mercy, O most Merciful of the merciful.
items.transliteration: Allahumma salli 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin, wa-aqsim li hilman yasuddu 'anni baba al-jahli, wa-hudan tamunnu bihi 'alayya min kulli dalalatin, wa-ghinan tasuddu bihi 'anni baba kulli faqrin, wa-quwwatan taruddu biha 'anni kulla da'fin, wa-'izzan tukrimuni bihi 'an kulli dhillatin, wa-rif'atan tarfa'uni biha 'an kulli da'atin, wa-amnan taruddu bihi 'anni kulla khawfin, wa-'afiyatan tasturuni biha min kulli bala'in, wa-'ilman taftahu li bihi kulla yaqinin, wa-yaqinan tudh-hibu bihi 'anni kulla shakkin, wa-du'a'an tabsutu li bihi al-ijabata fi hadhihi al-laylati, wa-fi hadhihi al-sa'ati al-sa'ati al-sa'ati ya Karimu, wa-khawfan tanshuru li bihi kulla rahmatin, wa-'ismatan tahulu biha bayni wa-bayna al-dhunubi, hatta afliha biha bayna al-ma'sumina 'indaka, bi-rahmatika ya arhama al-rahimina.

items.arabic: 3. قال الشيخ المفيد ينبغي في هذه الليلة الإكثار من الصلاة على محمّد وآل محمّد والجدّ في اللعن على ظالمي آل محمّد واللعن على قاتل أميرالمؤمنين عليه السلام والدعاء لنفسه ووالديه وسائر المؤمنين .
items.english: 3. Shaykh al-Mufid said: It is appropriate on this night to frequently invoke blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, to be diligent in invoking curses upon the oppressors of the family of Muhammad and the killer of the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, and to supplicate for oneself, one’s parents, and the rest of the believers.
items.transliteration: 3. Qala al-Shaykhu al-Mufidu yanbaghi fi hadhihi al-laylati al-iktharu mina al-salati 'ala Muhammadin wa-ali Muhammadin wa-al-jiddu fi al-la'ni 'ala zalimi ali Muhammadin wa-al-la'nu 'ala qatili Amiri al-Mu'minina 'alayhi al-salamu wa-al-du'a'u li-nafsihi wa-walidayhi wa-sa'iri al-mu'minina.

footnote_refs.title: المقنعة: ص 167( باب صلاة شهر رمضان).

items.arabic: 4. الدعاء لإمام الزمان عليه السلام وتعجيل فرجه أحد أعمال هذه الليلة.
items.english: 4. Supplicating for the Imam of the Time, peace be upon him, and for the hastening of his reappearance is one of the acts of this night.
items.transliteration: 4. Al-du'a'u li-Imami al-Zamani 'alayhi al-salamu wa-ta'jili farajihi ahadu a'mali hadhihi al-laylati.

items.arabic: روى السيّد ابن طاووس عن حمّاد بن عثمان قال: دخلت على الصادق عليه السلام ليلة إحدى وعشرين من شهر رمضان. فقال عليه السلام لي: «
items.english: Al-Sayyid Ibn Tawus narrated from Hammad ibn ‘Uthman, who said: I visited al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, on the twenty-first night of the month of Ramadan. So he, peace be upon him, said to me: “
items.transliteration: Rawa al-Sayyidu Ibnu Tawusa 'an Hammadi bni 'Uthmana qala: dakhaltu 'ala al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salamu laylata ihda wa-'ishrina min shahri Ramadana. Fa-qala 'alayhi al-salamu li: "

items.arabic: يا حَمَّادُ إغْتَسَلْت
items.english: O Hammad, have you performed the ritual bath?
items.transliteration: Ya Hammadu ightasalta?

items.arabic: »؟ فقلت: نعم. فدعا عليه السلام بحصير ثمّ قال عليه السلام:
items.english: ?” I said: “Yes.” So he, peace be upon him, called for a mat, then he, peace be upon him, said:
items.transliteration: ? Fa-qultu: Na'am. Fa-da'a 'alayhi al-salamu bi-hasirin thumma qala 'alayhi al-salamu:

items.arabic: إلي لِزْقِي
items.english: Come close to me.
items.transliteration: Ilayya lizqi.

items.arabic: . فلم يزل يصلّي وأنا أُصلي حتّى فرغنا من جميع صلواتنا ثمّ أخذ يدعو وأنا أومّن على دعائه إلى أن اعترض الفجر فأذّن وأقام ودعا بعض غلمانه فصلّى بنا الغداة.
items.english: He continued to pray and I prayed until we completed all of our prayers; then he began to supplicate while I said “Amen” to his supplication until the dawn broke. Then he recited the call to prayer and the call to stand for prayer, and he summoned some of his servants and led us in the morning prayer.
items.transliteration: Fa-lam yazal yusalli wa-ana usalli hatta faraghna min jami'i salawatina thumma akhadha yad'u wa-ana u'amminu 'ala du'a'ihi ila an i'tarada al-fajru fa-adhdhana wa-aqama wa-da'a ba'da ghilmanihi fa-salla bina al-ghadata.

items.arabic: ولما فرغ الإمام الصادق عليه السلام من التسبيح والتحميد والتقديس والثناء على اللَّه والصلاة على رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله والدعاء لجميع المؤمنين خرّ ساجداً لا أسمع منه إلّاالنفس ساعة طويلة ثمّ سمعته يدعو ومن دعائه:
items.english: And when Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, finished the glorification, praise, sanctification, and lauding of Allah, invoking blessings upon the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, and supplicating for all the believers, he fell into prostration. I heard nothing from him but his breathing for a long time, then I heard him supplicating, and among his supplication was:
items.transliteration: Wa-lamma faragha al-Imamu al-Sadiqu 'alayhi al-salamu mina al-tasbihi wa-al-tahmidi wa-al-taqdisi wa-al-thana'i 'ala Allahi wa-al-salati 'ala Rasuli Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi wa-al-du'a'i li-jami'i al-mu'minina kharra sajidan la asma'u minhu illa al-nafasa sa'atan tawilatan thumma sami'tuhu yad'u wa-min du'a'ihi:

items.arabic: روى السيّد ابن طاووس عن حمّاد بن عثمان قال: دخلت على الصادق عليه السلام ليلة إحدى وعشرين من شهر رمضان. فقال عليه السلام لي: «
items.english: Al-Sayyid Ibn Tawus narrated from Hammad ibn ‘Uthman, who said: I visited al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, on the twenty-first night of the month of Ramadan. So he, peace be upon him, said to me: “
items.transliteration: Rawa al-Sayyidu Ibnu Tawusa 'an Hammadi bni 'Uthmana qala: dakhaltu 'ala al-Sadiqi 'alayhi al-salamu laylata ihda wa-'ishrina min shahri Ramadana. Fa-qala 'alayhi al-salamu li: "

items.arabic: يا حَمَّادُ إغْتَسَلْت
items.english: O Hammad, have you performed the ritual bath?
items.transliteration: Ya Hammadu ightasalta?

items.arabic: »؟ فقلت: نعم. فدعا عليه السلام بحصير ثمّ قال عليه السلام:
items.english: ?” I said: “Yes.” So he, peace be upon him, called for a mat, then he, peace be upon him, said:
items.transliteration: ? Fa-qultu: Na'am. Fa-da'a 'alayhi al-salamu bi-hasirin thumma qala 'alayhi al-salamu:

items.arabic: إلي لِزْقِي
items.english: Come close to me.
items.transliteration: Ilayya lizqi.

items.arabic: . فلم يزل يصلّي وأنا أُصلي حتّى فرغنا من جميع صلواتنا ثمّ أخذ يدعو وأنا أومّن على دعائه إلى أن اعترض الفجر فأذّن وأقام ودعا بعض غلمانه فصلّى بنا الغداة.
items.english: He continued to pray and I prayed until we completed all of our prayers; then he began to supplicate while I said “Amen” to his supplication until the dawn broke. Then he recited the call to prayer and the call to stand for prayer, and he summoned some of his servants and led us in the morning prayer.
items.transliteration: Fa-lam yazal yusalli wa-ana usalli hatta faraghna min jami'i salawatina thumma akhadha yad'u wa-ana u'amminu 'ala du'a'ihi ila an i'tarada al-fajru fa-adhdhana wa-aqama wa-da'a ba'da ghilmanihi fa-salla bina al-ghadata.

items.arabic: ولما فرغ الإمام الصادق عليه السلام من التسبيح والتحميد والتقديس والثناء على اللَّه والصلاة على رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله والدعاء لجميع المؤمنين خرّ ساجداً لا أسمع منه إلّاالنفس ساعة طويلة ثمّ سمعته يدعو ومن دعائه:
items.english: And when Imam al-Sadiq, peace be upon him, finished the glorification, praise, sanctification, and lauding of Allah, invoking blessings upon the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, and supplicating for all the believers, he fell into prostration. I heard nothing from him but his breathing for a long while; then I heard him supplicating, and among his supplication was:
items.transliteration: Wa-lamma faragha al-Imamu al-Sadiqu 'alayhi al-salamu mina al-tasbihi wa-al-tahmidi wa-al-taqdisi wa-al-thana'i 'ala Allahi wa-al-salati 'ala Rasuli Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi wa-al-du'a'i li-jami'i al-mu'minina kharra sajidan la asma'u minhu illa al-nafasa sa'atan tawilatan thumma sami'tuhu yad'u wa-min du'a'ihi:

items.arabic: وَأسْألُكَ بِجَميعِ ما سَأَلْتُكَ وَما لَمْ أَسْأَلْكَ مِنْ عَظيمِ جَلالِكَ، ما لَوْ عَلِمْتُهُ لَسَأَلْتُكَ بِهِ، أَنْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ، وَأَنْ تَأْذَنَ لِفَرَجِ مَنْ بِفَرَجِهِ فَرَجُ أَوْلِيائِكَ وَأَصْفِيائِكَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، وَبِهِ تُبيدُالظَّالِمينَ وَتُهْلِكُهُمْ، عَجِّلْ ذلِكَ يا رَبَّ الْعالَمينَ.
items.english: And I ask You by all that I have asked You and what I have not asked You of Your great majesty—that which, had I known it, I would have asked You by it—to bless Muhammad and his household, and to permit the deliverance of the one through whose deliverance is the deliverance of Your friends and Your chosen ones from among Your creation, and through whom You shall annihilate the oppressors and destroy them; hasten that, O Lord of the worlds.
items.transliteration: Wa-as'aluka bi-jami'i ma sa'altuka wa-ma lam as'alka min 'azimi jalalika, ma law 'alimtuhu la-sa'altuka bihi, an tusalliya 'ala Muhammadin wa-ahli baytihi, wa-an ta'dhana li-faraji man bi-farajihi faraju awliya'ika wa-asfiya'ika min khalqika, wa-bihi tubidu al-zalimina wa-tuhlikahum, 'ajjil dhalika ya Rabba al-'alamina.

items.arabic: فلمّا رفع رأسه قلت: جعلت فداك لمن دعوت بالفرج. قال عليه السلام: «
items.english: And when he raised his head, I said: “May I be made your ransom, for whom did you pray for deliverance?” He, peace be upon him, said: “
items.transliteration: Fa-lamma rafa'a ra'sahu qultu: ju'iltu fidaka li-man da'awta bi-al-faraji. Qala 'alayhi al-salamu: "

items.arabic: هُوَ قائِمُ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ
items.english: He is the Qa’im of the family of Muhammad.
items.transliteration: Huwa Qa'imu ali Muhammadin.

items.arabic: ». ثمّ بيّن عليه السلام علامات ظهوره وقال:
items.english: .” Then he, peace be upon him, explained the signs of his appearance and said:
items.transliteration: . Thumma bayyana 'alayhi al-salamu 'alamati zuhurihi wa-qala:

items.arabic: (وَتَوَقَّعْ امْرَ صَاحِبِكَ لَيْلَكَ وَنَهارَكَ، فانَّ اللَّهَ كُلُّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ في شَأنٍ، لا يَشْغَلُهُ شأنٌ عَنْ شَأنٍ) .
items.english: “And anticipate the affair of your Master night and day, for indeed, Allah is every day in a state, and no matter distracts Him from another.”
items.transliteration: Wa-tawaqqa' amra sahibika laylaka wa-naharaka, fa-inna Allaha kullu yawmin huwa fi sha'nin, la yashghaluhu sha'nun 'an sha'nin.

items.arabic: ملاحظة: تبتدئ العشر الأواخر من شهر رمضان بليلة الحادي والعشرين ويستحبّ الغسل في كلّ ليلة من هذه الليالي، حيث روي أنّ النَّبيِّ صلى الله عليه و آله كان يغتسل كلّ ليلة من هذه الليالي .
items.english: Note: The last ten nights of the month of Ramadan begin with the twenty-first night, and it is recommended to perform the ritual bath on every night of these nights, as it has been narrated that the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, used to perform the ritual bath every night of these nights.
items.transliteration: Mulahazah: tabtadi'u al-'ashru al-awakhiru min shahri Ramadana bi-laylati al-hadi wa-al-'ishrina wa-yustahabbu al-ghuslu fi kulli laylatin min hadhihi al-layali, haythu ruwiya anna al-Nabiyya salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi kana yaghtasilu kulla laylatin min hadhihi al-layali.

items.arabic: كما يستحبّ الاعتكاف فيها في المساجد الجامعة، فله فضل عظيم، ففي الحديث: «
items.english: It is also recommended to perform *i‘tikaf* during them in congregational mosques, for it has great merit; and it is mentioned in the hadith: “
items.transliteration: Kama yustahabbu al-i'tikafu fiha fi al-masajidi al-jami'ati, fa-lahu fadlun 'azimun, fa-fi al-hadithi: "

items.arabic: الاعْتِكَافُ فِي العَشَرَةِ الأخِيرَةِ مِنْ شَهْرِ رَمَضانَ يَعْدِلُ حِجَّتَيْنِ وعُمْرَتَيْنِ» .
items.english: *I‘tikaf* in the last ten [nights] of the month of Ramadan is equivalent to two Hajj and two ‘Umrah.”
items.transliteration: Al-i'tikafu fi al-'asharati al-akhirati min shahri Ramadana ya'dilu hijjatayni wa-'umratayni."

items.arabic: وكان صلى الله عليه و آله يعتكف في المسجد في العشر الأواخر فيطوي فراشه ويشدّ مئزره للعبادة (ويقتدي به في ذلك العديد من المسلمين) خلافاً لما يعتقده بعض الجهّال من انتهاء برامج شهر رمضان المبارك بمضيّ ليالي القدر.
items.english: And he, peace be upon him and his family, used to perform *i‘tikaf* in the mosque during the last ten nights, so he would fold up his bedding and tighten his waist-belt for worship (and many Muslims follow his example in that), contrary to what some of the ignorant believe regarding the conclusion of the programs of the blessed month of Ramadan with the passing of the Nights of Destiny.
items.transliteration: Wa-kana salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi ya'takifu fi al-masjidi fi al-'ashri al-awakhiri fa-yatwi firashahu wa-yashuddu mi'zarahu li-al-'ibadati (wa-yaqtadi bihi fi dhalika al-'adidu mina al-muslimina) khilafan lima ya'taqiduhu ba'du al-juhhali min intiha'i baramiji shahri Ramadana al-mubaraki bi-madiyyi layali al-qadri.

items.arabic: وَأسْألُكَ بِجَميعِ ما سَأَلْتُكَ وَما لَمْ أَسْأَلْكَ مِنْ عَظيمِ جَلالِكَ، ما لَوْ عَلِمْتُهُ لَسَأَلْتُكَ بِهِ، أَنْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ، وَأَنْ تَأْذَنَ لِفَرَجِ مَنْ بِفَرَجِهِ فَرَجُ أَوْلِيائِكَ وَأَصْفِيائِكَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، وَبِهِ تُبيدُالظَّالِمينَ وَتُهْلِكُهُمْ، عَجِّلْ ذلِكَ يا رَبَّ الْعالَمينَ.

items.english: .” Then he, peace be upon him, explained the signs of his appearance and said:

items.arabic: وهي أفضل من الليلتين السابقتين ويستفاد من أحاديث كثيرة أنّها هي ليلة القدر. روي عن الإمام الباقر عليه السلام: «
items.english: And it is more virtuous than the two previous nights, and it is inferred from many hadiths that it is the Night of Power. It was narrated from Imam al-Baqir, peace be upon him: “
items.transliteration: Wa-hiya afdalu mina al-laylatayni al-sabiqatayni wa-yustafadu min ahaditha kathiratin annaha hiya Laylatu al-Qadri. Ruwiya 'an al-Imami al-Baqiri 'alayhi al-salamu: "

items.arabic: أنَّ الجُهَنِيّ أتى رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه و آله فقالَ لَهُ: إنَّ لِي إبلًا وَغَنَماً وَغَلَمَةً فأُحِبُّ أنْ تَأْمُرَنِي بِلَيْلَةٍ أدْخُلُ فيها. فَدَعاهُ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه و آله فَسارَّهُ فِي أُذُنِه. قالَ: فَكانَ الجُهَنِيُّ إذا كانَتْ لَيْلَةُ ثَلاثٍ وعِشْرِينَ دَخَلَ بإبِلِهِ وغَنَمِه وأهْلِهِ ووُلْدِهِ وغَلَمَتِهِ إلى المَدِينَةِ فَإذا أصْبَحَ خَرَج بأهْلِه» .
items.english: that al-Juhani came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, and said to him: “Indeed, I have camels, sheep, and servants, so I would like you to command me regarding a night in which I should enter [the city].” So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, called him and whispered into his ear. He said: “So whenever it was the twenty-third night, al-Juhani would enter Medina with his camels, his sheep, his family, his children, and his servants, and when morning came, he would leave with his family.”
items.transliteration: Anna al-Juhaniyya ata Rasula Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi fa-qala lahu: inna li ibilan wa-ghanaman wa-ghalamatan fa-uhibbu an ta'murani bi-laylatin adkhulu fiha. Fa-da'ahu Rasulu Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi fa-sarrahu fi udhunihi. Qala: fa-kana al-Juhaniyyu idha kanat laylatu thalathin wa-'ishrina dakhala bi-ibilihi wa-ghanamihi wa-ahlihi wa-wuldihi wa-ghalamatihi ila al-Madinati fa-idha asbaha kharaja bi-ahlihi.

items.arabic: وروي أنّ رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله كان يرشّ على أهله الماء ليلة ثلاث وعشرين (وينتفعوا بفضل هذا الشهر) .
items.english: And it was narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, used to sprinkle water on his family on the twenty-third night (so that they might benefit from the virtue of this month).
items.transliteration: Wa-ruwiya anna Rasula Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi kana yarushshu 'ala ahlihi al-ma'a laylata thalathi wa-'ishrina (wa-yantafi'u bi-fadli hadha al-shahri).

items.arabic: وروي أنّ رسول اللَّه صلى الله عليه و آله كان يرشّ على أهله الماء ليلة ثلاث وعشرين (وينتفعوا بفضل هذا الشهر) .
items.english: And it was narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, used to sprinkle water on his family on the twenty-third night (so that they might benefit from the virtue of this month).
items.transliteration: Wa-ruwiya anna Rasula Allahi salla Allahu 'alayhi wa-alihi kana yarushshu 'ala ahlihi al-ma'a laylata thalathi wa-'ishrina (wa-yantafi'u bi-fadli hadha al-shahri).

items.arabic: ولدينا عدّة روايات في أنّ ليلة القدر ليلة ثلاث وعشرون . قال العلّامة المجلسي في زاد المعاد، روي بأسناد معتبرة أنّ ليلة ثلاث وعشرين هي ليلة القدر .
items.english: And we have several narrations stating that the Night of Power is the twenty-third night. Al-Allamah al-Majlisi said in *Zad al-Ma‘ad*: It has been narrated through reliable chains of transmission that the twenty-third night is the Night of Power.
items.transliteration: Wa-ladayna 'iddatu riwayatin fi anna Laylata al-Qadri laylatu thalathi wa-'ishruna. Qala al-'Allamatu al-Majlisiyyu fi Zadi al-Ma'adi, ruwiya bi-asnadin mu'tabaratin anna laylata thalathi wa-'ishrina hiya Laylatu al-Qadri.

items.arabic: ولدينا عدّة روايات في أنّ ليلة القدر ليلة ثلاث وعشرون . قال العلّامة المجلسي في زاد المعاد، روي بأسناد معتبرة أنّ ليلة ثلاث وعشرين هي ليلة القدر .
items.english: And we have several narrations stating that the Night of Power is the twenty-third night. Al-Allamah al-Majlisi said in *Zad al-Ma‘ad*: It has been narrated through reliable chains of transmission that the twenty-third night is the Night of Power.

items.english: There are other acts besides the common acts, including:

items.arabic: 1. قراءة سورتي
items.english: 1. Reciting the two Surahs of
